description:
Breakfast is a new hobby for me.  

When my schedule was more regimented, this wasn't my thing as I valued my sleep more than a hearty day starting meal.  After a doctor's appointment, my friend and I chose this quaint restaurant for a weekday breakfast.  There were only a couple tables occupied so we choose a table against the right wall.  

After a quick menu study, I ordered my usual breakfast, corn beef hash and eggs (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Ex8EF31tmSQg94qd0sLgxQ&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q), sunnyside up and English muffin dry; the menu stated the name as New England Flannel corned beef hash, but, not having traveled to that part of the country in over 25 years, I don't remember trying this before.  I liked the potatoes and eggs the best and am still on the fence on the corned beef part.  It was shredded corned beef with some carrots and potatoes that didn't really stand out.  The potato side was actually more interesting to me especially after I jazzed it up with some ketchup and Tabasco sauce.  Mix in that runny egg... well, just good stuff.

The service was great yet laid back as there were no other customers as we finished our meal. In studying the menu, the cuisine seemed more southern style cooking than northeastern cuisine.  My friend ordered their signature pancake on the side and let me try a bite and it was not bad; I'm not a pancake person, more likely to be impressed by the syrup or topping than the actual pancake.  Would like to return to try their dinner offerings...  Would return if in the neighborhood.
author: Mike C.

description:
Eggs benedict is always my go-to brunch food and I was not disappointed! What set Kate's Kitchen apart is that they don't use ham, but rather a delicious sausage patty and they add grilled onions. While some sausages are salty and a tad bit artificial, Kate's Kitchen's sausage patty tasted organic and low in sodium. You also feel fuller eating the sausage benedict as opposed to the traditional ham benedict. Before ordering, I was concerned that the benedict itself may not be enough, but it turned out to be sufficient! The dish comes with a generous side portion of potatoes, which I eat with the ketchup and hot sauce provided on the table. One important note though: the restaurant has an open-kitchen layout, so it smells greasy and a little overwhelming with the sheer amount of different cooking ingredients. 

When I was reading the Yelp tips, I was warned of the lower quality service during busy weekends. Unfortunately, they turned out to be true. So what happened was my friend and I split the bill using two credit cards and the waitress put both halves on my card... You could imagine how confused my friend and I were when we got the receipts! Also, my friend wanted house fries instead of potatoes, but either the waitress or the chef forgot about that, even though on the receipt it said "with house fries." Being too busy is not an excuse for lower quality service because many places are busy for Sunday brunch and they have been able to figure internal processes out. This place has been around for at least a couple years now, from what it seems from the reviews I read...
author: Louis Suo L.

description:
our server and the cook were working very hard on a weekday morning, running the place seemingly by themselves.  i did see a woman toward the back of the kitchen, but couldn't figure out what she was doing.

our breakfast of a vege scramble and a hashbrown egg dish were good, but not terrific.  the scramble supposedly had soyrizo, a chorizo substitute, in it, but it was impossible to taste.
the coffee was absolutely terrible.  it tasted sour and burnt.  hopefully this was an aberration.  bad coffee at a breakfast place is "hard to swallow".

overall, we might return for the gracious service, but there are so damn many other places to choose from.
author: Alexandria B.

description:
This place is delicious def will come here again the customer service is great parking isn't crazy mess and the restrooms are clean!! 
Oh and there OJ is
author: Julie P.

description: The veggie scramble was good but it is more like a homemade dish. The coffee was not bad and the refill from the waitress was quite frequent. I guess the name tells it all. A neighbourhood kitchen for neighbors.
author: Shaun Z.

description: Love this little brunch gem in the lower Haight. You NEED to put your name on the list for the weekend but they don't take reservations. I would prepare to wait 20-40 minutes depending on the size of your party. It's not a huge place so I recommend keeping your party small. Go with the sausage gravy & biscuits- you can't go wrong. My husband also loves the side of sausage for the farmer's breakfast. The sausage is fresh and delicious! The hash is great as well. It's nothing fancy, so skip if you are looking for a nice ambiance or unique experience. Good, greasy spoon breakfast!
author: Carol Ann V.

description: Amazing and tasteful experience at Kate's kitchen! We ordered French toast orgie and the best one is a bacon and cheddar pancake! Definitely would go back there again
author: Sonia P.

description:
The food was probably more of a 3-star, but the service, ambiance, and goodwill pushes it to 4.

I had heard how large and infamous the pancakes were, but I went for savory instead of sweet (always.) I ordered the daily veggie scramble special: avocado torta strips, cilantro, spicy onions, roasted tomatoes, cumin seeds, and cheddar cheese.

The scramble was pretty good, but I was missing something (maybe some sour cream?) to make it really great.

I had a bite of my boyfriend's Strawberry Banana Lemon Curd pancakes, which were fantastic - light and fruity.

Service was very casual but super friendly!
author: Herbie H.

description: I happen to see an episode of Check Please and it featured Kate's Kitchen. I am ALWAYS in search of a great place for breakfast. Still searching. I am a simple eggs, toast, hash browns and protein type girl. I ordered the Farmers Breakfast which was just that except it came with country potatoes. I also added a side of grits. They tasted like water...Everything looked the part but It didn't taste the part. It was missing flavor and seasoning and the buttery richness you expect from breakfast. The owner is nice he walks around and checks in on the customers....a personal touch. The server was nice but not that attentive. As stated....still searching. I might have to wait a bit and go get a fish sandwich from Two Jacks. ‍
author: Stacie J.

description:
Not exactly your run of the mill breakfast spot, but somewhere between your bougie hour to two hour wait spot to a greasy spoon on haight street spot. 

Servings are generous to say the least and the pancakes come cheap! Order the big man breakfast and split it between two people or get in on the cornmeal pancakes at 2 for $8. Can't really find a deal like that in SF anymore!

Atmosphere is more haight street edge than fancy SF brunch, but their lemon curd pancakes would never let that on. They come doused in lemon sauce and top with a generous portion of fresh fruit.

The coffee is strong and the wait staff is friendly. It's the definitely the no brainer brunch destination in the neighborhood.
author: Patricia K.

description: Had a great breakfast here today. Grill cheese and a full American breakfast. Staff were friendly and service was reasonable. Price was good for what we had, would try again.
author: Daniel G.

description:
Ordered mimosas and the Lauren Special (kaiser roll topped with sausage, scrambled eggs, cheese, tomato, onion, avocado, and chipotle aioli). The special came with home fries on the side. The sandwich was delicious and very reasonably priced for brunch in the area. 

The restaurant is not huge so we had to wait about half an hour since we went on a Sunday. Once inside, you feel at home with the assorted art, quotes, and menu written on chalkboards hung up on the wall. The wait was definitely worth it given the portions, price, and atmosphere!
author: Cassandra C.

description:
I really love this place. If you're looking for fancy breakfast and brunch with mimosas, don't go here. This is a down-home, good cooking, affordable greasy-spoon. Everything is good here, but they are known for their New England Flannel Hash, and their pancakes. I really like the food here, and the service is friendly and sweet. The coffee is different (I believe it has chicory flavoring, a la Cafe du Monde in New Orleans). It's not bad, just different. Weekends are very busy, weekdays are a lot more laid back .
Enjoy!
author: Jason P.

description:
Loved the breakfast foods! I had a giant portion of fresh fruit with a delicious sausage egg and cheese on a roll with avocados in it or something along those lines. 

The atmosphere is charming, and it has nice paintings and other artwork hanging on the walls.

Loved that they give free coffee refills and that it actually tastes like real coffee.
author: Audrey L.

description: I really like this place. Although it's been there for years I had not eaten there until recently. It's a really nice little breakfast place with excellent service and a great classic breakfast!  A honest, humble, clean and reliable breakfast spot!
author: Jim K.

description:
Not a great experience. The waiter spilled syrup on my bag and didn't say anything. Over medium eggs came our over easy - twice. The bacon was dry and overcooked. The sausage was even worse - sort of looks like a lumpy hamburger, burnt on the outside and undercooked inside. The cornmeal pancakes are basically just diner cornbread.

I ate about half my food and then stopped because it was making me feel ill. Would not recommend.
author: acolight s.

description:
Wow!  What a cozy, homey breakfast spot.  Really enjoyed everything about my visit.

The service here was notably friendly and thoughtful in a way I appreciated.  For example, I ordered an iced coffee and our server brought me an extra cup of ice in case the ice in the cup started to melt, which wound up coming in handy!

The food was fantastic as well.  I got the shakshuka with a green onion biscuit on the side, and both were excellent (plus it was a HUGE portion).  The shakshuka was served with liberal amounts of delicious jalapeño salsa which was a unique twist on the dish.

Prices were great for SF, too - around ~$20/pp with tip included for a coffee/tea and an entree.  I'll be back for sure!
author: Christine G.

description: Update: they take credit cards now.  They finally made it to the 2000s.  Food is great.  Love the place, love it more now.
author: Osama B.

description:
If it's possible to have an existential experience at a brunch place, we definitely did today. I'm rarely free on weekday mornings but we were celebrating a life milestone so I took the morning off to meander with my partner.

We walked here from the TL and had built up an appetite by the time we got here. Only a handful of patrons were there around 10:45 on a Monday morning so we had our pick of seats and full attention of our server.

The interior of Kate's is refreshingly non-fancy. Definitely a throwback, simple, diner. The menu was varied but not overwhelming and we ordered the big guy breakfast, French toast orgy and side of biscuits.

When the food came out, I was SHOCKED. Portions are so so generous here and we barely ate half of what we got. Everything was delicious though! Loved the sausage and home fries. French toast was really decadent but not heavy. Yogurt added some lightness to it and I liked the fruit as well. The biscuits came warm and were good but could have used some salt. 

Our server was kind and checked on us throughout without hovering. The coffee here (sf coffee co?) was also really tasty and I appreciated the free refills.

Both my partner and I were really satisfied and will be back! We also have leftovers galore so the value and quality of food here is really great. Highly recommend!
author: Semuteh F.

description: I love my pumpkin French toasts unlike anything I ever had. Your even able to get bloody Mary in morning. Kind tight fit during rush our. Good menu for vegans. Crab omelet bros getting my attention. Really want know what that taste like.
author: Vincent V.

description: Great food and mimosas ... it's the second time I visit this place and it was amazing ! I got the bbq tri tip Benedict it was awesome , rich and full of flavor
author: Karen P.

description: Amazing breakfast! Their Meat Scrambler was to die for! Great atmosphere too! If you're a pancake fan for lunch, it's a must have! Amazing job guys!
author: PJ V.

description: Not a place to recommended unless the owner change the cook ! why is it so hard to cook potatoes ??? they are tasteless,burned and thrown on the plate like a dog shit on the sidewalk ! either the cook has to learn how to cook or change him !! no matter if it is only breakfast but if you don't like what you do go sale shoes !!
author: Francis G.

description: We arrived and they kicked us outside without taking down names. This repeated itself two or three times as other parties arrived and were kicked out equally confused. We ended up getting seated in order, but it was a little chaotic. Food was decent diner breakfast food. The waiter weirdly kept referring to our table as "the cool kids table." Cash only and we did not have any, so one of us had to run around the corner while everyone else finished up. On the whole, not a great experience.
author: Michael D.

description: Not that good. Egg Benedict weren't tasty and service was poor. Got food from another table on my pant because a clumsy server.... not recommended.
author: Mauro P.

description:
I've been to Kate's several times for breakfast/brunch and the food never disappoints. I would give this place a 5-star rating only this time I went early when they were not busy and the service quality was poor. 

Advice: be conscious of the service you provide. Don't serve hot tea in a water glass that has a chip on the rim and don't bring the bill 5 minutes after serving the food. The waiter did not even check on us because he basically checked out after he placed the bill on the table while we were still on our first bites. Not good.
author: Leonora H.

description: What a great place for breakfast and brunch. Sure the tablecloths have coffee stains so deep you think they're fresh, but that's just part of the homey vibe here. The prices are cheaper than most SF brunch joints and there are so many options for eggs it's dizzying. Great biscuits. Strangely small coffee cups which made it so you had to wait for someone to fill up your cup many times which just creates more work for the poor servers. But regardless, they've got good potatoes, fresh fruit and I'm going to have to return for the stuffed hash browns. As it was, I had to go for a special they only have a few months a year - the dungeons crab omelet. Lovely suffer with caramelized onions and roasted red peppers, but not so seasoned that you couldn't taste the delicious crab meat. Can't wait to return!
author: David A R.

description: Awesome first visit! The food was great, huge specials board (I got the crab Benedict) and they have different mimosa flavors (grapefruit was awesome but I'm curious about pomegranate). Good dark coffee, great service, and a cute wooden walls and counters ambiance. Definitely coming back some time soon.
author: Jesse D.

description:
I love Kate's Kitchen because it's one of the first breakfast places to open on weekends. They open at 8:30am, so you can get in and get some food if you have somewhere to be in the late morning.

The food was great too, and prices are reasonable. I got the New England Flannel Hash ($12.50). It was a good-sized portion worth the price. The corned beef was thick sliced, but very soft and juicy. And FOR ONCE, I found a restaurant where they don't skimp out on the meat. Praise the lord almighty!!

I was not a big fan of the biscuit--many they forgot to put a dash of salt?? Not impressed, for a biscuit that they take pride in making themselves. 

We also got the Hush Puppies, which were pretty good (once I drenched them in syrup), but somehow the hush puppies were outshined by their side, the Pooh Butter (get your mind out of the gutter yo). I could have just ate the honey butter by itself, it was that good!

The staff there was very nice, although they had trouble making medium-over eggs for my friends hahaha. We ended up settling on eggs over hard lmao. All jokes aside, the staff was very nice about it and were full of smiles early in the morning :)))

SIDE NOTE: Kate's has a very nice backyard--why do they not use this areas for events????? Please tell me!!!!!!!
author: Vasiliy M.

description:
My wife and I enjoyed brunch here twice during our visit to San Francisco. Their food was not only delicious, but a hearty portion. Their mimosa carafe is very strong. 

The only thing better than their food is the attentive service from their friendly staff. Highly recommend for breakfast.
author: Erick H.

description:
French toast - pass. Nothing special
Egg and cheese sandwich - bland. No flavor
Hush puppies - being from the South, these are not hush puppies. While I do like the sweeter hush puppies, these are just fried balls of corn meal dough. The only thing that gives it any taste is the Pooh butter 
City Salad - nothing fancy
Overall skip this place.
author: S C.

description:
This is my absolute favorite place to get breakfast in SF. The best hush puppies ever (sweet rather than savory, especially good with honey butter or pooh butter as they call it). The sausage is excellent, so is any egg dish and the pancakes are awesome, particularly the banana walnut and the pumpkin pancakes. The orange French toast is good too.
The atmosphere is fun, great looking murals and rebuses on the walls and usually some fun loud rock or soul playing. Not super expensive either.
author: Nina L.

description: Food was TERRIBLE, Over charged for items we didn't get and  the waitress was Rude & Yelled at me for requesting "hot" coffee and not eating food that was burnt.
author: Doreen M.

description: A solid place for breakfast and can get crowded with a compact seating area. I had the Lauren special egg sandwich, which came with the potato home fries and mouth watering sausage. Large portions and tasted great. Kaiser bun was a little too large and fluffy. One suggestion would be to add espresso options for caffeinating. Will be back.
author: Chris G.

description: My bae enjoyed his corned beef hash w/ poached eggs.  I had the two pancakes, eggs, two slices of bacon, pork sausage & country fries.  No substitution. Pancakes a bit gritty, bacon was thick but so-so, pork sausages ok. I packed the fries home for my bae.  Coffees were constantly refilled and service was attentive.  Bae would give it a 5*, but mine would be a 3*.  Took an average and gave a 4*, fair enough.
author: John L.

description: Very friendly / clean/ great food. server was very helpful and flexible with our menu choices - thank you !
author: Hlb C.

description: I was trying to figure out what I wanted to eat this morning and this place popped up. I went today and they had a lot of construction going on. But the staff was super nice and even gave us complimentary hush puppies for the noises. The staff was super attentive and polite and to get something complimentary at a restaurant due to noises is rare. I would love to come back again! Not to forget the food was extremely filling and delicious! I wasn't disappointed, i had the orange spice french toast and the farmers breakfast which included potatoes, toast and eggs.
author: Theresa H.

description:
It was pretty empty when we came. 

Started with the wings. Half buffalo, half bbq.

The wings were oddly small. My favorite was the bbq, and my bfs fav was the buffalo. It all worked out fine. I really liked the ranch sauce they served with it.

We shared the mahi mahi. It has a sweet and sour sauce. Which was good and they didn't like the sauce on top of it. It was weird because half of the fish tasted good and the other half was fishy and salty. It came with mixed greens on the side. The plate was light and very balanced. 

It's an alright place to check out.
author: Lynn C.

description:
This place is quite delicious, we initially came in the lower haight area to go to nickies, however we didn't make it in time for brunch and accross the street was this packed hole in the wall called Kate's kitchen.  We made our way there, put our name on the list and waited patiently.  Once we sat down we ordered the mimosa carafe with orange and pomegranate, my fiance got the corn beef hash with the onion biscuit which was delicious, and I got the breakfast sandwich and added sausage, everything was great we also ordered the hush puppies which were probably the best ones I had in sf, especially matched with the strawberry jelly and butter they have.

All in all, great place, great atmosphere, great food and the waitresses are very friendly.

We will be back :)
author: Josh Giosue D.

description:
Perfect little breakfast spot to dine solo. I sat at the small table near the door and it was a perfect spot, especially with the slight cool breeze. I ordered the farmers market breakfast, which is your basic 2 eggs, bacon, potatoes, and toast. The bacon was thick and the potatoes had grilled onions and peppers mixed in. The best part is that with this breakfast, the coffee is free! My waitress was really sweet and attentive as well. Great suggestion from a local!

Side note: some reviews on here stated that this place is cash-only. That is not the case anymore and I was able to pay with my card.
author: Morgan R.

description: Breakfast at Kate's Kitchen was just as I remembered it from 18 years ago, sooo good! Yeah, I don't know why it took so long to go back either, Life! The hush puppies and poo butter are a must try, so delicious!
author: Verdie M.

description:
Very homey place to dine in. We came here early on a Saturday evening to catch dinner. I love the decor, and the diners seemed to be locals. 

The beet salad was good. Sliced beets, lettuce, lathered up in a creamy cilantro dressing sprinkled with some cheese. Added a side of salmon, but it wasn't cooked all the way. Good thing I like sushi, so it was like eating seared salmon LOL. 

The paella didn't really seem to have a paella identity. It had chunks of salmon, small grilled shrimp (almost bay sized), rice, and tomatoes. Reminded me of gumbo without the sausage and beans. Tasted like salsa with rice, in a good way. Not my favorite choice. 

We were a bit excited about the fried chicken, but disappointed. The breading was crunchy and tasty, but the overall dish lacked seasoning. I ate it the way it was supposed to, whole. My girlfriend got picky (literally!) and picked off the skin and breading (oh the agony!) and noticed that the chicken meat itself was not marinated. The beans were bland, however the mashed potatoes were creamy, moist, and had good flavor. 

My girlfriend likes her drinks sweet, and I like mine fragrant and not sweet. We both found the perfect drinks here. For her, the lemonade spritzer. I thought it was too sweet, even for a sweet drink, but it was tasty. Freshly squeezed lemon juice. Mmm. I had the herbal berry iced tea. Tasted like hibiscus tea with a hint of blackberry (or was it my imagination?). No refills on the drinks. 

Overall a bit disappointed, but on the positive side, the service was good. The server was very accommodating and polite. I may come back just because of the good service and neighborhood feel of the place and give some of the other dishes another try. We'll have Kate's on the radar for the brunch, which seems like what Kate's is known for! The hush puppies looked good, but it's not available on the dinner menu. 

FYI, the online menu's prices are not up to date as of this review.
author: David K.

description:
If u like French toast and pancakes this is the place to go.  So many different options and varieties to choose from.  It's a good neighborhood joint that's a little cozy.

The one thing which was heavier was the pumpkin French toast.   Sweet and decadent so be ready for a food coma!
author: Spencer Q.

description:
This place was GREAT! Some of these reviews don't do it justice! 

I found this place as a "must go" on Haight and I'd have to say, I agree 100%. The food is not only delicious and inexpensive, but the portion size is waaaaay more than enough. The French toast-to die for, the hush puppies and pancakes were interestingly different and delicious. 

The service was also great. Erin was so attentive and nice and her recommendations were spot on! 

I'd highly recommend this pale to anyone anytime! Like the internet said...a must go on Haight!
author: Kourtney A.

description:
They used to have great food.  But their false advertising and lack of customer service makes me hesitant about coming back.

Today I ordered for pick up a couple of their main listed items that I'd ordered from them in the past  (their meatloaf and chicken, both of which I loved).  I then get a call from Eat24 saying that the restaurant had told them that they had run out of the chicken.  Okay, I thought, and substituted a replacement item.

Then, after I was half way to the restaurant I get another call from Eat24.  The restaurant had now told them that they no longer offered any of the listed entrees, and so they were cancelling my order.  What the hell?  How does a restaurant fail to offer any of their advertised entrees?  Why didn't they tell Eat24 that at the same time as they identified their chicken problem?  Entrees that they definitely used to offer.  I wound up going to another Haight restaurant (Memphis Minnie's) instead, since I was already in the neighborhood.

To top it off, Kate's Kitchen did not even offer a credit, coupon, or anything to make me whole despite their failure to tell me about their false advertising until 15 minutes after I'd placed my pick up order and was already half way over there.  Sad.
author: Joseph B.

description:
We attempted to come here for dinner a month earlier because Yelp says Kate's is open for dinner. No such thing. When we called prior to coming, the phone was left off the hook.
Our second attempt was a to go order. Do not order soup to go here. They don't have the proper containers and will not tell you until you pick it up. They put my soup which consisted of broth and vegetables in a cardboard recyclable to go container. (The same container they put Sandwiches & salads to go.) They simply wrapped it in Saran Wrap and said sorry because they didn't have soup containers. On the car ride home, the soup leaked through the cardboard container down onto/into the 2 cardboard containers of salads underneath it. Basically ruined the entire meal. When I got home and opened up what was left of the soup, it was just soggy vegetables and soggy biscuit.
author: Jessica D.

description: Cute little place for breakfast. Everything was delicious. There was a group of 7 and we all tried something different. Their French toast is to die for! Service was great. Will definitely come back in our next visit to San Francisco
author: Monica L.

description: Do NOT order their grits! All water...toast was cold and eggs were half warm/half cold. Really and truly, how does one mess up breakfast? Server was a sistah so tipped her well and remained calm...however, the cooks clearly lack the levels of heavy ethnic sophistication to prepare quality grits! Back to Al's on Divisadero it is!
author: Casa I.

description:
A good spot for brunch in the lower haight area. 

Usually there's no wait or a short wait (10-15 minutes). 

They have the usual brunches staples, and are particularly known for their interesting French toasts flavours.

The French toast orgy is basically a yogurt parfait on top of French toast and is quite delicious. They also have specials which change around such as the pumpkin chocolate chip French toast. 

I also really liked the simple farmers breakfast which has eggs, potatoes, and toast (get the biscuit instead of toast because it's really good!).
author: Tanay J.

description:
Food is good. 

New server is god awful. Had to ask for every refill of coffee, she was on her phone twice in the hour I was there. Spilled a lot of coffee on the table and never wiped it up. Had to flag her down and interrupt her phone calls for everything. Bad. 

Most servers there are awesome. 

I miss the old server this new one replaced!
author: Brian T.

description:
Look, it doesn't matter if you're Paleo, carb conscious, diabetic, allergic to gluten, allergic to orgies, or what. There's something called French Toast Orgy = it must be ordered. At *least* once in your life. #steviewondersaidforonceinmylife It's all kinds of sugar x carbohydrate x insulin chaos on a plate. Get one per person. No sharing.

And preferably go when the white chick server is working; her self-described "just some ratchet mix" ipod which flip flops from effing 8bit video game tracks to Ludacris x Mystikal is counter(?)intuitively the best thing for Sunday mornfternoon brunch. #sunchdaybrunchday
author: Dan B.

description:
My boyfriend and I were craving biscuits and gravy this morning, so we decided to stop by Kate's Kitchen since it was nearby. He's been twice before, and had a good experience the first time, and a poor experience the second time- so we thought that maybe the third time's the charm?

We were very wrong. We ordered 2 plates of biscuits with sausage gravy, one side of scrambled eggs, one side of eggs over medium, a side of bacon, and a coffee. 

The biscuits and gravy: As soon as it was put in front of us I knew something wasn't right. The gravy was an odd green/grey color, and looked like they mixed split pea soup with an old gelatinous stew. So odd. But I try not to judge a book by its cover, so we gave it a try. It was bad. It was really bad. It was strangely sweet, but also bland, and tasted like it had been sitting out for a while. The biscuits were a nice consistency, but I personally wasn't a fan of the dill inside. They were herbaceous in an unappetizing way.

Scrambled eggs: Okay, under seasoned, but edible.

Eggs over-medium: Looked fine.

Bacon: Tasted strangely chemically? Like that $3.99 bacon you grab at the corner liquor store when you're hungover but craving salt.

Coffee: Pretty good.

My bf and I are pretty big fans of traditional, diner-style foods, and while we've had a lot of breakfasts all over the place, we're fine with solid, basic, breakfasts. We weren't expecting anything ~fancy~, but this was just...off. We're also not fans of complaining or returning food, but we mentioned to the server working behind the bar that we weren't big fans of the biscuits and gravy, and that they might want to take a look at today's batch, as it didn't taste quite right. We also insisted that we weren't looking for a refund. He apologized thoroughly. However, the manager then stormed over and aggressively said that he "heard that we didn't like the gravy, and that there's absolutely nothing wrong with it. That many people this morning have eaten it and loved it- that people either love it or hate it" and a bunch of other rambling, obnoxious things. They ended up comping 1 order of the biscuits and gravy, and we quickly left.

It was startling, honestly. I came to Yelp to check out the reviews this evening, because I was starting to think that maybe we were in the wrong for not liking the dish- but after scanning the posts, it seems that at least 2 other people have mentioned the SAME issue with the dish.

Anyway.. this is a pretty busy place with a line sometimes, so maybe they have something else on the menu going for them? Just avoid the B & G I guess.
author: Ally H.

description:
R u hungryyyyy for some love? Or how about some eggs?? 

How about dabbling in a honey mixed with butter?

What? You want fruit ?  How about they give you some mint and berries with your fruit?!

What? Your healthy? Then sit your bottom down and open that gorgeous mouth of yours. 

Eat. Enjoy. Digest. Love

Be happy. Be proud. Eat something

One love.
author: Sheik S.

description: I love this place! It has a lot more personality than other options nearby--a buzzy southern vibe and a good price range. The hush puppies ($5) were super: crunchy on the outside, soft in the middle, served with butter and home made jam. I got a French toast special ($10) with chocolate and strawberries-- a real treat. The coffee was amazing, nola-style. This place is great if you're tired of the typical bougie SF brunch spots. Bustling and friendly.
author: Rachel B.

description: We just left Kate's Kitchen.  We got there before the rush and we're seated quickly, which was nice.  I ordered the shakshuka- which looked amazing on the menu, and my boyfriend ordered the egg sandwich.  Our food came out and his was good, mine was raw- like, raw egg floating in tomatoes.  The waitress, to her credit, seemed horrified when I brought it to her attention.  Unfortunately, when she brought it back about ten minutes later, the egg had been mixed into the stew, defeating the whole idea of a shakshuka, in which there should be two baked eggs on top.  The flavor was okay, a little too canned tomatoey for my taste.  It would have been good with my English muffin, but it was covered in butter despite me ordering it dry, so that wasn't an option.  At that point, complaining seemed to be pretty useless, given that we were completely ignored, as the waiters filled water glasses around us and ignored ours.  All in all, the food was okay, but the butchered shakshuka was overpriced for what I got and the service was lackluster at best. (To be fair, the egg sandwich WAS good. So not all bad)
author: Christy S.

description:
Came for a quick lunch. Really liked the ambience; laid back and fitting for Haight St. Prices are very reasonable and you get a lot of food. 

Got the daily egg scramble, which had kale, butternut squash, Gorgonzola, and whole cloves of roasted garlic. It came with a scratch made biscuit that was excellent.

The hush puppies were less dense and crispy than I was used to - wound t recommend if tire looking for southern style pups.
author: Ben S.

description: Two solid stars. The hush puppies are delicious. The bathroom is gross. The French toast is underwhelming. The service is indifferent.
author: Adriana V.

description: I think that this is an overestimated brunch option. It is rustic but the coffee is not good and the food is not refined or anything special. I ordered benedict eggs with crab and I could barely taste the crab as it was covered by onions and cream.
author: Katerina D.

description:
Weekends does get crowded at this little café/restaurant, with a ton of people waiting for the breakfast/brunch.

But during the weekdays for lunch are not too bad. I came here for lunch and had the meatloaf sandwich. My $8.50 sandwich has a thick slab of beefy meatloaf, ketchup sauce, grilled caramelized onions, lettuce and sliced cherry tomatoes in a toasted rye bread. A side of home fries is also included with the sandwich. It has been a while since I had meat loaf. The restaurant's version is legit. My sandwich: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kates-kitchen-san-francisco#KlpqlmC1NKJngfpUtZC7Yw

I also added a glass of refreshing Herbal Iced tea with my meal. Drink: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kates-kitchen-san-francisco#046_F27jaWjDkmR6FsNgOA

As I was enjoying my lunch, I was browsing through the menu. Kate's also serve fried chicken for dinner.

So I came back a few nights later for the Fried Chicken dinner. For $8.50, I get two pieces (drumstick and thigh), a side of mashed potatoes and a bowl of bean soup. The chicken pieces were cooked perfectly and not too overly battered. But the spuds were too dry and the soup was tad too salty. I usually do not put gravy on my mashed spuds, but feared of the saltiness. Fried chicken dinner: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kates-kitchen-san-francisco#nn3qwoDX5G0SCoCZDi0p1A

With my dinner, I also added a pint of Lagunita's IPA brew for $5.00. There are three beers served on tap. Restaurant picked three good local brews. My brew: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/kates-kitchen-san-francisco#F1aVLQaA8aHwwdgdtnSuZw

My lunch was better than my dinner. But I can't wait to come back and try the popular breakfasts. 

And this restaurant is Cash only!
author: Matt G.

description: Ordered biscuits and gravy...it was horrible! Took one bite and spit it out! Gravy is not supposed to be sour! When I asked the waiter to bring me something else he was condescending and said he'd have to charge for a second dish because "nobody else is complaining about it. We've never had a problem." When I asked for my check and a manager, this lil man says, "My father isn't here right now." I basically got charged for being served shitty food by a condescending, entitled brat. Never going back!
author: Amber F.

description:
This was my first and last time eating at Kate's Kitchen. Everything started out so promising with the granola and fruit but quickly deteriorated when the biscuit and gravy arrived. B.'N G.
is something I always order when I go out to breakfast but it was depressing to see what constituted as gravy, bland, soupy, I asked the server if she accidentally gave me the veggie gravy because I could't taste any sausage or anything resembling flavor. I took literally two bites and sent it back and asked if I could have the Texas fries instead and ordered them extra crispy. The Texas fries arrived and were lack luster and far from crispy and full of chunks of bacon fat. When my check came I saw they charged me for the Biscuits and gravy, I guess they think repeat customers and positive customer service is not part of good business.
author: Paul R.

description:
Kate's Kitchen has a diner feel meets trendy breakfast spot. The service we had was incredible, accommodating and quick to take our order and meet our needs. They had great prices and breakfast and brunch selections.
 
I ordered the Lauren Special: Two eggs any style on a kaiser roll with sausage, cheese, tomato, red onion, avocado, and chipotle aioli. Served with home fries. YUM!
author: Kim K.

description: Best breakfast deal in San Francisco. The big guys breakfast is filling. The service outstanding. The atmosphere is casual and eclectic. Very warm and inviting place to eat.  I've eaten here more than any other place for brunch in SF. The cornmeal pancakes are out of this world. Definitely check this place out.
author: Chandler G.

description: It wasn't what I expected for Corned beef hash.  Hash should not be in chunks. It's HASH. It should be mashed up. IMHO
author: Kevin G.

description:
Awesome brunch served up by real people without emptying your pockets. Try the biscuits and gravy for brunch- the biscuit is filled with salty, chivy, cheesy goodness. Meals are best shared between friends as portions are.. Well.. "Southern style". 

Love the friendly service here, the heaping portions of simple goodness and the fact that you don't need to wait two hours for some hash browns. 

Solid.Brunch.Spot.
author: Hannah B.

description:
I went to Kate's kitchen on a Saturday for brunch. We had to wait 15 minutes (party of 2) to be seated which is fine for San Francisco.

The place is cute. I got the Lauren's special which really isn't nothing special, it's just a burger.

I might go again to try their pancakes or French toasts.

Pro tip: They have a Groupon for dinner!
author: Coralie S.

description:
There are much better brunch places in SF but this place was across the street from my apartment so I could put our name in and walk back across the street instead of waiting outside with ~15 other people during weekend brunch time. 

One thing I noticed is they have very reasonable prices, compared to other SF place, but that's because the atmosphere is very casual as opposed to the usual upscale city brunch. No need to fear-- yes they have mimosas.

If the ideas of a cornbread/flapjack hybrid excites you, definitely come here for the cornmeal pancakes. I had them plain although they have a ton of specials on the wall, the more interesting ones I remember were peach/ginger, strawberry/granola, and strawberry/banana/lemoncurd. They have the classics like blueberry and banana/walnut as well. 

The french toast was pretty good but nothing special. Nice hint of cinnamon although you can barley taste any orange flavor. I've also had the hash before; again, good but nothing special. 

Fantastic coffee. 

They now accept credit cards!
author: Kristen T.

description: A Yelp member name Irene l. Told me to "get a life and F**k off" because of the review I wrote. Hope it's not someone from from the restaurant.
author: Angela T.

description: Love this place!!! A San Francisco must eat! If you visit the city, and skip this gem, you have issues! Eat there, I'm not going to tell you again! LOL;)
author: Ryan D.

description:
Tables are crammed in a small space so customers are sitting nearly elbow to elbow. Those with tables on the inside can't get out without other customers moving out of the way.

Food itself is decently okay. I had the California oatmeal which was garnished with a lot of fruit but the oatmeal itself was watery. My boyfriend had the big guys breakfast, and that was okay as well. Nothing out of the ordinary from eggs, sausage, and home fries. The bacon was the best part.

Overall, just another brunch spot with the same standard brunch food that did the trick but did not wow.
author: Connie S.

description:
the good: big portions, good coffee, good service. 

the bad: i ordered the corned beef hash and there were more veggies than hash. the veggies were massive. i had to basically cut up everything before i ate so it could all be incorporated. 

my food was burnt. veggies were burnt on one side, 2/4 pieces of toast were burnt. it was also really under seasoned. i hate sending food back and i didn't but i could totally see someone not wanting to eat it. 

definitely not enough meat. there were 6-7 chunks of hash. i had to break up the chunks so there would be meat in as many bites as possible. it's a shame because the meat was great. 

would i return? maybe... the pancakes sound good.
author: Alyssa L.

description: Server was nice and breakfast was ok, but I got low grade food poisoning from here. It was the only thing I'd had that day and afterward stomach was nauseous and cramping all afternoon and night. I should've known not to eat here when I went through the kitchen to use the restroom -- there were tubs of cut up meat and bleached out veggies sitting in the back storage closet, not refrigerated and not about to be cooked. Kitchen was way too small and cramped for the volume of customers they serve with dish washers working way too close to the cooks. Oi.
author: Carmel D.

description: Just mediocre food. The potatoes were soft and the food were flavorless. They sell the juice as freshly squeezed but in reality is of a bottle. And is worst than obwalla juice brand. Avoid this place.
author: Julie C.

description:
The service was great but it can't make up for mediocre food.  The flannel hash was mostly burnt and there was very little corned beef, saying that these are outstanding biscuits is like saying Noah's has great bagels.  Nope, they are not great.

I had the pumpkin french toast. - I feel like that 1980's Wendy's commercial "Where's the pumpkin?" it had chocolate chips and blueberries (which really didn;t make sense) - but very little pumpkin flavor.

Why bother wait in line here when there are so many better places? Skip it.

Oh and we had a coupon for free hushpuppies but the fryer wasn't up to snuf so we didn't get them and were offered nothing substituted.  I'm not upset only b/c they are probably not very good either.

CASH ONLY.
author: Amy W.

description: One of the best brunch spot in the area. The service is always super friendly, efficient, and as comforting as their food. Get the Irene's wrap. Munch on that while you deciper the code on their wall.
author: Yad L.

description:
I normally only take the time to post 4 or 5-star reviews of the things I love. However, this place is so mediocre in a city of fabulous food, it prompts me to help others save themselves (and their wallets) from this experience. 

First, their wait staff isn't very committed to the customer. Our waiter dropped the bill, but never once asked us how our food was or anything else to verify our satisfaction. (A low, even for CA service.)

The kitchen and bathroom are near one another. I saw pans of food sitting out, unrefrigerated, that should have been in the walk-in cooler they don't seem to have. (Food health seems important, but we did check and they have a 94 health score so I will let this lie.)

All the food was simply...meh. In a city where I am overwhelmed with amazing food choices, I'm bummed I forgot to check Yelp first to check their rating and relied solely on a "hidden brunch" article elsewhere. Lesson learned.
author: Crystal G.

description: I was in SF vacationing with a few of my buds, and our airbnb host recommended Kate's Kitchen. As 5 hungover dudes, we were in need of some serious fuelage. Kate's did not disappoint. I ordered the "Big Boy Breakfast," (for obvious reasons), and my compadres ordered a variety of eggs, bacon, and pancake breakfasts'. No frills, delicous food across the board. Service was charming and on point. Also, there is a killer mural in there that you could spend hours dissecting. If you are near the Lower-Haight district, or hell, in SF, go to Kate's.
author: Daniel K.

description:
Good brunch! Inconsistent biscuits. :/

Eaten here a few times now; really like their seasonal french toast (strawberry cranberry chocolate). Hash browns are wonderfully crispy and thin. You can even sub the homefries for browns during the weekday (too busy on weekends for that).

Good biscuits (cheddar & green onion) when made relatively fresh. I think I had a stale one in my biscuits & gravy on another day. They give you two huge biscuits sitting in a big shallow bowl of gravy. The sausage gravy was decent and salty; the sausage bits were relatively sparse though. Gets pretty salty near the end as your taste buds tire of the flavor. However, the annoying thing about this dish one weekday morning was that one of the biscuits had a harder chewier exterior and less fluffy interior than the other one, which was much softer everywhere with a lighter crustiness on the outside. Boo on stale/inconsistent biscuits!

I still wanna try their pancakes & french toast orgy! The orgy sounds like they just take their fruit granola & yogurt mixture and dump it on their toast, but hey I'd still join in. ;)
author: Linus W.

description:
Three words.. FRENCH TOAST ORGY.. If you haven't indulged in this tasty treat, than you probably haven't discovered all the wonders of the world yet.

This delicious menu item has orange spiced French toast at the bottom, with fresh (and yes, I mean FRESH) fruit topped with to-die for yogurt and granola at the tippy top to add that extra crunch. Enriching all your taste buds for a magical ride. Yes, the French toast orgy satisfied me indeed.

My friends and I also had the pleasure of tasting their corned beef, Texas fries, meatloaf sandwich, and burger. All of which were exceptional. 

Would we come back here? Of course, how can anyone go without that French toast orgy in their life.
author: Jayme N.

description: Very nice American breakfast, but the main thing is the atmosphere. I went in to have breakfast by myself. A table for one can be an unpleasant experience in some places. Here I enjoyed not the breakfast and the atmosphere.
author: Gil R.

description:
The best food in all of SF! Great service, delicious food, charming atmosphere a wonderful small business owner who is keeping the spirit of San Francisco alive making delious food with heart and love, Hassan is a lovely man that cares about the community he is feeding and gives back more than he takes I wish we had more people like him! Thanks Kates kitchen for not only Feeling my belly but also feeding my soul.  ;) 
Also they are now open at night from 5:30 until 10pm and on Fridays live Jazz! Just when you thought it couldn't get any better it does.
author: Kary M.

description: The first time I came to Kate's Kitchen I thought I walked into an alternate universe. Absurdly extensive menu, big portions, tasty diner coffee, cheery little hole in the wall in the Lower Haight. I almost don't want to tell people about it for fear it'll turn into a brunch mainstay... but I will talk about the French Toast Orgy for the rest of my life.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
OHHH KATE you make a good brunch. EVERYTHING looks great, so sorry we took a long time to order. You were really nice about it though. You were very attentive but not pushy. Great omelette. Fabulous pumpkin pancakes although it didn't taste like pumpkin. OMG OMG THE JUICE it was so good. And they'll blend whatever you want. And they're so freaking nice.

And then we went for dinner, and it was almost 10pm and I think on the menu it said they were already closed but they were just hanging out so they let us order some comfort food to go. I was getting over a weird illness thing and that was the first real meal I'd had in DAYS. Shrimp and grits to help get some calories in me. It was alright, the spice was nice. The seasonal veggies side was a total sleeper hit -- so flavorful and "healthy" and very sizable. Collards were sad, bland, and small. I would eat those veggies every day.

PS they get their pies from safeway.. although apparently sometimes they make their own blueberry.
author: Vivian H.

description: Great pancakes! I always get the cornmeal pancakes with blueberries and they never disappoint. The corned beef hash (cubed) is also great and comes on a big plate of vegetables and potatoes. Atmosphere is casual Americana.
author: Dave B.

description: I really do not recommend eating here.  Wish i saw the other reviews before taking my boyfriend there.  It's dingy, trashy, musky, grimmy, dark and cramped.  I can't believe they make food out of that kitchen. I saw a roach walking on counter surrounding kitchen area.  One of the cooks used a really dirty rag and he had no apron on and just kept wiping his hands on his clothes and resumed touching and handling food.  So gross.  The food tasted old, something you would have thrown out cause it expired.  The cutlery was dirty, we didn't even want to drink from the cups and the water wasn't even cold.  The food was beyond gross.  The staff was pathetic had no knowledge of menu items or where the food came from; they were disorganized and looked like they were being tortured by having to work there.  One server in particular needs some education it didn't seem like she was mentally all there.  You really have to re-examine your life if you work there.  DO NOT SPEND YOUR MONEY THERE unless your doing it as charity.  They are a kitchen nightmare and I don't know when they had their last inspection or review but it is overdue.  I will never return to eat at Kate's kitchen.  It looks like the house Norman Bates from psycho lived in.  Trust me go anywhere else than here in fact stay home and crack 2 eggs in a pan you'll be happier that you did.  Sorry, but it's true.
author: Sophie B.

description:
Great breakfast place.  Some unusual combinations, solid traditional plates, veggie options, and good variety.  The tables can be a little cramped, but not too much.  Service is quick and the staff is busy but friendly and helpful.

A popular spot, so plan on a wait (the wait usually passes pretty quickly, though).  

And the fryer is fixed, so they have hush puppies again!
author: Rik C.

description: this is such a wonderful place for brunch with casual environment and with an outstanding service . a must visit for everyone.
author: John C.

description:
Cute small neighborhood spot - the seating is a bit strange as they sat us with another two top - but the place is small so they have to fit us in some how I guess. 

Friendly service with decent prices. I ordered Mindy's Hash Browns - hash browns folded with scrambled eggs, bacon, and cheddar. It was like an omelet surrounded by hash browns - pretty delicious in my book. And a good sized portion - it lasted me two meals.
author: Shannon H.

description:
Came here with a couple of girlfriends after a morning hike at Land's End. We were looking for a tasty hearty brunch after our morning activities. We ordered 2 dishes and a side to share - French toast orgy, pumpkin and chocolate french toast, and a side of hash browns. 

As the 3 star rating says, the meal was A-OK, but it certainly wasn't mind blowing nor even awesome enough to make me want to come back again. 

The best part about the meal was when it was served. It looked fantastic! The french toast orgy was piled at least 6 inches high off the plate with fruit, yogurt, and granola on top of french toast. The pumpkin and chocolate looked absolutely mouthwatering. But actually biting into each of these dishes is where the disappointment set in. The french toast was plain. Plain plain plain. No amount of fruit/yogurt/granola topping can help if the french toast itself is just mediocre. The pumpkin french toast was the better of the two, but that was merely because it had chocolate sauce and whip cream on it - the toast itself didn't taste a thing like pumpkin. Thankfully the hash browns were tasty.


Glad I went, glad we tried the dishes we did, glad I took pictures of the craziness that is the french toast orgy, but won't be back.
author: Krista S.

description:
After my last visit in 2009, we decided it's been long enough and we should give it a go.

Great eggs (veggies scramble), coffee and biscuits.  They have added gluten free biscuits too!  Their veggie gravy is pretty good too it could use some some salt and a little kick in the pants (cayenne or paprika would do the trick).

Unfortunately, the house potatoes still are a problem.  They lack flavor and I could have done without them.
author: Jillian K.

description: Wonderful spot for breakfast or brunch, offering a wide variety of typical brunch times, specifically French toast and pancakes. their cornmeal buttermilk pancakes are unique and delicious. they come with several options for topics. definitely worth the trip for a wonderful and fulfilling brunch experience!
author: Mario C.

description: Kate's Kitchen is a Lower Haight staple. In a word- southern. The portions are large and the restaurant's atmosphere is casual and quite homey, making it a very pleasant breakfast experience. Prices are reasonable for the quality and quantity of food you're getting. My only complaint is that the restaurant is cash only.
author: Caroline L.

description:
After a night of intense partying, the guy, Jayme N., Andrew L., and I were looking to get our fat kid on for breakfast. After going through our bookmarks and searching through Yelp, we finally stumbled upon Kate's Kitchen. Luckily, we found street parking immediately as we found the place. Though there was a short wait, we didn't mind going to the smoke shop next door and checking out their selection of smoking devices. As for the place itself, it literally feels like a kitchen because it is very cramped inside with few tables and chairs and of course, the kitchen. 
The food is the star of this place. I went for the Texas fries which is their version of a breakfast skillet. That dish alone was amazing, but include an order of the French Toast Orgy and this meal truly became an orgasm in my mouth. Though the French Toast Orgy can be a meal in itself, we found it is best to shared with our group of 4. Overall, if you are looking for a deliciously awesome meal to fill you up, then don't hesitate to check out Kate's Kitchen and get your orgy on!
author: Cristal C.

description:
Best brunch spot in SF -- hands down. 

If I could, I would come here several times a week. It's that good. Whenever I get a day off work, I make sure to come to Kate's Kitchen...there's simply no better way to start my day. Unfortunately I'm not able to do so, which is unfortunate because as many other Yelpers have bemoaned, you'll need to come early on Weekends, because this place is small and fills up quickly...so be prepared to wait if you're not an early riser. 

But make sure you do wait, however, because Kate's is an experience like no other, and you'll always leave feeling 100x times better than when you arrive. The menu is extensive, the wait staff is quirky and and extremely friendly, and the food of course is absolutely amazing.

The best part for me though, is that ALL "egg breakfasts" and most of the other menu items come with a MASSIVE helping of their homefries. And these are not just any homefries...they are quite literally the best possible thing that could happen to your hangover...ever. Homefries are an essential part of every person's balanced weekend brunch, and these are the best out there.

Need suggestions for what to order? Thought you'd never ask: 

The biscuits and gravy...french toast "orgy"...meat omelette...veggie scramble...buttermilk pancakes (caution: the tall stack is massive)

Pick your poison - they're all good. If those aren't up your alley, be sure to check out their SPECIALS board, which is handwritten in chalk and full of delicious mysteries. Last time I came by they had this special of homefries that came stuffed with bacon, eggs, peppers, onions and other ridiculous things inside (Update: These were the "Mindy Hashbrowns". Highly recommended). Needless to say it was dank.

Apparently (per a recent Yelp review) they now have started serving dinner too!! So I'll definitely have to check that out sooner rather than later. 

See you there.
author: Brian S.

description: Got to brunch there with my friend, waitress is rude, place is not healthy and we got sick afterwards... DON'T GO THERE.
author: Ma R.

description:
Gotta agree the brunch here is not only reasonably priced but delicious.
Had biscuits and gravy $5.50 not a huge southern fan but once awhile I love the richness of sausage gravy and hands down one of the best gravy! The scones are good buy not spectacular
Hush puppies $3.75 a little dry on its own but add the honey pooh but ur and it's amazing, a little dessert afar the meal
And the French toast orgy covered in granola, yogurt and fruit. The orange zest in the toast brings it all together.

There is always a line for brunch so you can do take out!
Get back to bed for lazy weekend meal.

Value 4.5/5
Atmosphere 4/5
Service 4/5
Quality 4.5/5

17/20
author: Nina S.

description:
I loooooove Kates. 

They have a French Toast Orgy that is heaven on this earth. Where do they get this yogurt? I've never had yogurt this good. 

The buckwheat pancakes with fruit and lemon curd are so delish. You don't really even need syrup. 

I never get the biscuits because hush puppies!!

One of the best meals you can get for this price in the whole city. Love love.
author: Rachael M.

description:
I have come here several times in the past ten months and have loved their gluten free pancakes. I come today and they changed the recipe.

They once served fluffy light GF pancakes. They currently serve gooey, sour, mochi textured cakes. A disappointment.
author: Michele F.

description:
Kate's Kitchen is on point! Two specific occasions you should look to Kate's Kitchen for:

Have some extra time in the morning on a weekday? Stop by for their Rooster Booster- $5.50 for a Farmer's Breakfast or Flanched Farny Garny with coffee (& unlimited refills!) It's an awesome deal- only available M-F 8am-10am!

Feeling lazy on a Saturday or Sunday morning? Call in and order pick up or delivery. The site says to expect a 30-40 min wait but when I called in, the waitress said "It'll be ready in 10 minutes...or 15 to be safe." The price is slightly higher for their special dishes (like the Lauren's Special and Eggs Benedict that we ordered) BUT the portions are so huge, so you can save half for the next day's breakfast. So really, what you pay is for two meals, not one.
author: Joanna H.

description: Fantastic hollandaise sauce. It's increasingly hard to find real, housemade hollandaise sauce in this city. Kate's Eggs Benedict doesn't skimp on real, expertly made sauce or the full sized muffin. Also the coffee is pretty good.
author: Kim O.

description:
Came here for Sunday brunch (yesterday) with a friend and only had a wait ~15 minutes and were seated by the window.  Cozy table, but it was fine.

Had the veggie omelet special which was flavorful.  

Unfortunately my experience changed when I went to use the facilitates.  The bathroom is near the kitchen, understandable as it is a small place, but noticed the bacon was on a tray across from where the dishes were being cleaned.  The most troubling thing was there was no soap in the bathroom.  I looked for it and if there was a soap dish/dispenser I did not see it.  At some point in the immediate future soap / hand sanitizer needs to be made available.
author: Jess K.

description:
First time customer orders delivery and is delighted!
Wow, the chicken fried steak was delicious, juicy, tasty and oh so good, the habanero burger made my night, seriously good. But it was the Texas Fries that knocked my socks across the room, so very good, a must eat.
Great food, must try.
Enjoy!
author: William M.

description: Our breakfast visit on 9/3/16 was a disappointment. Ordered the vegi scramble that was supposed to have cilantro...but was not there. Cauliflower....missing also. Tons of avocado and looked very messy and bland. It wasn't even busy, but busy should never be an excuse anyway. Seems like they got their Zagat rating a few years ago and then let the quality slide. Have seen this before. Lots of hype that doesn't deliver :( We typically dine out 4-5 times a week and know good service and good food. I love giving good reviews, and don't like giving bad ones. Yelpers should know either way, so here it is.
author: Mario L.

description: Kate's Kitchen is my favorite breakfast spot in the city. The food is excellent and always good specials. But, what's better than the food is the service. Irene is one of the best servers I've ever had wait on me! I highly recommend!
author: Mark B.

description: Still our favorite breakfast place in the City and northern Peninsula. The corned beef hash is a winner: carrot, onion, potato, brisket corned beef. I ordered poached eggs and got sunnies, but so what? Orange spice French toast would benefit from a longer egg bath. Interior of Kate's is hard used and showing signs of age, but so am I. After an 18 month hiatus, I still love it. To me it's worth 25 minutes on 101 north, torn up streets in the lower Haight, and iffy parking. I'll be back next week.
author: Stu H.

description: Everything here was awesome! I came with a party of 5 and although there was a wait, it only took maybe 10 minutes even though the place is pretty small. We had a variety of foods and it was all very good and nice portion sizes. the next time I'm in town I'll most likely come again for breakfast. Our server was very attentive and they also had a couple of people filling coffee and waters so we were always good and full. if in the area of highly recommend this joint.
author: Mike G.

description: Decent quasi-southern food in a relaxed atmosphere. Biscuits, huspuppies, etc were all sort of same-y and didn't have much in the way to recommend them flavor-wise. It's a good way to scratch the itch but not actually awesome food.
author: Daniel E.

description: Terrible breakfast. I'm not a picky person, so terrible means terrible. They some how had no way to heat water for tea, the eggs were like continental breakfast eggs, and the bacon was rubbery.
author: Aimee B.

description: I have never been treated with such rudeness and blatant disrespect as I have at Kate's Kitchen. I've worked in the service industry for over the past 5 years as both a cocktail waitress and server, and I have never seen a restaurant owner treat a customer as poorly as I was treated at Kate's Kitchen. I maintain a plant-based diet for health reasons, and I normally eat at plant-based restaurants, but when I go out with my friends I accompany them to non-vegan restaurants and always look for items on the menu that are plant-based. When we arrived at Kate's Kitchen I saw on the board a dish that described having all veggies: Spinach, avocado, mushrooms, bell peppers, etc. I thought "great, that's perfect, I'll get that." I ordered it not realizing it was a veggie scramble, therefore it had eggs in it (stupid mistake, I know). Because I'm used to eating at plant-based restaurants, and because eggs were not listed on the board as one of the ingredients, it didn't even cross my mind that it had eggs in it. When it arrived my friends even joked with me about how big of a dumbass I was, and I agreed and laughed with them. It was an honest mistake, but the way it was handled was completely out of line and shocked my friends and I. When our food arrived and I saw that it had eggs, I said "oh my gosh, I'm so sorry, I didn't realize this dish had eggs in it!" The waitress gave an awkward look and hesitated before saying "okay, we'll remake it for you." Being well aware of how annoying and high-maintenance vegans can be, and not wanting to be "that person" or make a big ordeal out of it or be an inconvenience in any way, I said "if it's a problem I can just eat the potatoes, seriously, don't worry about it." And she said "no it's fine, no problem." She went to the kitchen to replace the food when the manager/restaurant owner came up to the table and said to me "you ordered the veggie scramble?" I said "Yes." He replied in the rudest tone, "How do you not know what that is???" and waited for me to answer. I explained the situation by saying "I'm sorry, I was just looking for something on the menu with veggies, and since eggs are not listed on the description I didn't realize it had eggs in it." He continued to speak to me in the most condescending (almost yelling) tone and said "How do you not know what a veggie scramble is??? Everyone knows that a veggie scramble has eggs in it." At this point I was both shocked and embarrassed and just said "I'm sorry" again. He continued to say "I'm running a business here, you do realize it costs money to replace food?" Still feeling both shocked and completely embarrassed, I just said "it's fine, I'll just take it. Don't worry about it." And he just walked away with his hand in the air and said "whatever, we'll just remake it." Obviously, at this point I'm not going to feel comfortable eating food he guilted me about making. So I walked to the back of the kitchen and said "Sir, do not worry about making me new food. You made it very clear to me that it is an ordeal to replace, and that it costs money to replace, so don't worry about it." At this point I was feeling pretty embarrassed about the situation and I could feel tears welling up in my eyes. The waitress delivered the same plate of food and she could see how defeated and embarrassed I looked and just said "I'm so sorry. If he wasn't here, we'd replace it in an instant." She was really sweet about it and I just said "don't worry about it." As I was trying to eat my potatoes I could feel a lump in my throat and I could feel a tear coming on. I kept telling myself; "Don't be a little bitch brigitte!" But try as hard as I might, I couldn't keep the tears from coming. Trust me --I'm well aware of how embarrassing it is for a grown woman to be crying in public. It was beyond humiliating. My sister, being outraged with the way he spoke to me went up to him and said "that was incredibly rude of you to talk to my sister that way, and that is no way to run a business." He just rolled her eyes at her. When the waitress brought the bill she was kind enough to profusely apologize, I think she felt embarrassed for her boss. We got the bill and my friends refused to let me pay for my meal that I did not eat. I think once the manager saw that my friends weren't allowing me to pay he had the waitress take my food off the bill, which was kind of him but quite frankly the least he could do after the way he treated me. I may have made a mistake and ordered the wrong thing, but you don't treat customers like they're a worthless piece of trash. He complained about his business not doing well, but clearly if he learned a little customer service and respect, I'm sure his business would be doing much better.  It's unfortunate that this happened, and it definitely dampened the mood for the rest of our trip in San Francisco. Next time I visit San Fran I'll be sure to steer clear from Kate's Kitchen.
author: Brigitte B.

description:
Unlike a lot of small restaurants that serve brunch on Saturday/Sunday mornings, this place is not ridiculously busy. This is kind of a wonder seeing as the food here is very good (nothing overly fancy or decadent) but simple and delicious; the pancakes, omelettes, and fruit bowls they serve here are incredible and the prices are very low. 

I highly recommend this place for breakfast. They have a list outside the door for you to put your party name and size on and they move through it very quickly. I've waited here before, but not for much more than 20 minutes.

The interior is cozy and funky. They've got an incredible mural image of America on one of the walls that really lends to the Americana feel of Kate's Kitchen.

5 stars cuz why not?
author: Andrew C.

description: Really enjoy this place. They had a great veggie omelet and pomegranate mimosas. Our waiter was super nice and attentive. I recommend it for a casual diner brunch
author: R D.

description:
My family visited SF last spring. We still talk about how good the breakfast was. We actually ended up eating here 2-3 times on the trip. Orgy French Toast!? YES!
Great corned beef hash, fresh juice & smoothie options. Great Haight St atmosphere.
author: Casey D.

description:
Why do I keep coming back here?! Argh! I just keep forgetting that while the food is (usually) good and the price is right, the service is BAD. Always horribly understaffed (1 server for all tables), ornery. Probably because of the understaffing. I feel like I'm imposing if I ask for anything. The service is so bad that it's distracting, and I can never have a nice, relaxing breakfast here.  

Oh and my New England Flannel Hash had like 5 pieces of corned beef on the HUGE plate.

I suggest you try another breakfast place.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
The "French Toast Orgy" looked great, but wasn't very tasty. I tried the combo of french toast (orange spiced), fruit, yogurt, and granola, but I wasn't a fan. If you already like this match, then this item might be for you. Their home fries weren't very good either (side order). 

However, the hush puppies were very good, along with the accompanying "pooh butter." 

Take the bus or walk, because it's very hard to find parking around meal time(s) and on street cleaning days.
author: Marc B.

description: Gluten free pancakes. Gluten free eggs Benedict. Carafe of mi.osas. Be still my heart.  It's not often I fangirl over good food. I'm a huge fan girl of Kates.
author: Katie E.

description: Very nice place for brunch. I went at a time where they are not busy, food is served fast. Their house coffee is hot but not scalding, taste is bold, which I really liked. Ordered Lauren's special (can't really remember the name) which is served with house fries. Love the touch of avocado on the sandwich. Server was very sweet and attentive.
author: Emma H.

description:
Friendly, welcoming, and reasonably priced.

The waitstaff happily made subs to my order for me, and when something came out of the kitchen not so well --- bones and cartilage snuck into my roast chicken omelette, and I was pretty put out -- they got me something different, and really good, right away.

This could have been a bad dining experience, but the great staff turned it into a darn good one. And my second omelette -- chicken-free -- was excellent. 

Nice one.
author: Eric B.

description: Awesome service for how busy it was this morning! I sat at the bar and had Irene's Wrap. A breakfast burrito with potatoes and vegetables on the side - super delicious!
author: Bryoni L.

description: Looks promising inside but the thing I had (sausage sandwich was pretty terrible) the sausage was cold and tough, the cheese like Kraft cheese. The bun wasn't even toasted. Service a little moody but they had a good grapefruit mimosa.
author: Marek B.

description: Went with my during a weekend visit.  We both loved our breakfast/brunch.  I think I had cornmeal pancakes, I forget what she had maybe benedict sauce muffin?  I would recommend to locals and to tourists.  I would go back solo or with friends or family any weekend.
author: Jaiden F.

description:
Come for happy hour and get paid to eat the fried chicken!

So Lagunitas IPA, red beans, potatoes, fried chicken.
I figure $6, $4, $4 for the first three.  that's $14. the chicken is $10. You're getting paid to eat their excellent fried chicken.

The waitress was great. Music: dubbin electronica.  Da food, da bomb.  Red beans, excellent.  Potatoes: delicious, creamy sauce.  Fried chicken: the weakest part, and all that means is the breast/ wing combo was juicy and delicious, but the spices could have been better, and it didn't have that big,crackly skin.

I hadn't had the Lagun before, and there was a very pleasant secondary taste. 16 oz draw, done right.  First, the waitress drew a big head, and then refilled the mug.

Going back, mos def.  

When the entree is free, it's pretty easy to give 5*****

I've been here for breakfast many time, excellent as well. SF without attitude and high prices, e.g. our SF.
author: Steve L.

description: Polite servers, fast service, generous portions. This place is great!! Highly recommended
author: Amaresh S.

description: I had a blast here! They do their biscuits and gravy very well. Our waitress was very nice and attentive but not in an annoying way. She also suggested my friend and I upgrade to the carafe of Mimosa and she was right.
author: Kendra S.

description:
Used a groupon for this place.  I've been to Kate's Kitchen before during weekend brunch many many years ago.  i haven't returned since until this deal came up.  We were met with no one at the restaurant.  Only 3 employees.  2 working and one guy just kind of hanging out.  We started with chicken wings and it was drenched in this BBQ sauce that overpowered the wings.  I ordered the paella and my friend ordered the fried chicken.  The paella was presented on a plate rather than on a paella pan.  The presentation needed a little more support. It looked like a hot mess.  It tasted and looked like gumbo.  It was good...enough...only if they just called it gumbo instead of paella.  The fried chicken was good with sides of mash potatoes and added side of collard greens w/ hamhock.  collard greens were slightly too salty. 

I hate to say it but overall it was just ok.   Service was okay.  By the end of the night an additional 2 tables were filled so it felt a little better that other folks were in there.  I hope they build their evening crowd with potentially better quality food.
author: ismael d.

description:
Such. Big. Portions. 

When I showed up and saw a cluster of people bundled up in the cold outside, I was a tad worried about brunch wait (who isn't out to brunch on New Year's Day?), but we were seated within fifteen minutes. See 0:22 of Shit San Franciscans Say for context (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Epwumykcs8).

The Scoutmob app currently gets you a free order of Kate's so-good-you'll-give-up-on-gym-resolutions hush puppies. It comes with a side of "hush puppy sauce," which I still dispute the existence of. Not that I will knock a combo of honey and whipped butter.

The big guy's breakfast will surprise everyone but me that it was HUGE. The cornmeal pancakes came first and I knew I was in trouble when it filled out half of our two-person table. And then the snickering and pointing and fat-shaming by other patrons happened when my platter of bacon, sausage, eggs, and home fries showed up. If our table could have extended, it would have made room for it. And all of this for $9.25.

I packed the remaining food to go, but three consecutive homeless peeps turned down my offer of brunch leftovers. :(
author: Kevin L.

description:
We used a Groupon last night for dinner and I have to say that neither of us were impressed. We have been many times for breakfast and it was great. However, last nights meal is one I hope to soon forget. Over seasoned and lack luster food, if you are going to offer "southern style cooking" you might need to make a trip to the south to get a taste first hand. 

Unfortunately, we will not be back for dinner.
author: T. O.

description:
Place is somewhat loudish, mostly given to the fact its also smallish.  Went here on Memorial day. 
We got to the door around 10:45 and had to wait about half an hour. The wait was all due to the fact we had a larger party. We had a table of 5 and there were 2 tables of 2 and three tables of 4 in front of us. 
I have to say it was absolutely worth the 34 minute wait. 
In fact, 3 words to fix that up "Pulled pork omelet". This thing is loaded down with tomato, red beans, squash, Smoked Gouda cheese and a ton of pulled pork.
The flavor combinations just don't stop. One bite - its like a veggie omelet, next bite tastes more like a traditional huevos rancheros, but then you hit the pulled pork and its like a BBQ exploding in your mouth with eggs and cheese. I asked one of the kitchen staff about the pulled pork, he told me its slow roasted in the oven for 3 1/2 hours. Its obviously pulled with care. 
It's got the magical flavor of 3 dishes in one. The home fries are great as well.
author: Ben M.

description: Amazing food. Even better people. I went there on a friday evening and was treated to live music by Sons of the Beach: a local jazz band. I ordered Mary's fried chicken. It was delish. :-) The chicken itself was crispy. But what won me over was the garlic mash. Would gladly go here again.
author: Avadhut P.

description: I should have known what to expect after seeing the reviews on this place - shame on me for checking once I'd already sat down. The biscuits and gravy felt really heavy and I could barely finish one biscuit, let alone get through even half of the gravy. The lady bussing the plates was also pretty impatient with us as we sat there waiting for our waiter to grab our check. Would definitely not recommend to a friend, a bit of disappointment in a neighborhood with so many awesome eateries.
author: Olivia T.

description: Yummy!!! The food looked so good when it came out &  it tasted just as well :) The restaurant was cute & there are a lot of good choices to choose from. Also, the potatoes & veggies that the meal comes with is also delicious to have. If you order your meal with biscuits & gravy, it comes with a lott of gravy & you can dip those potatoes in it! Very filling meal :D
author: Alice H.

description: We decided to give them another shot on a weekday morning.  Went in right around opening. This place is so much better when it is slow. The waitress was very very nice.
