The food was cooked beautifully. This was the first time and only time we have had a good experience here. (though we have only come in on the weekends so maybe that's the problem). The biscuits and veg gravy was excellent. We will start coming here again but only on week days. Never again on weekends.
author: Daniel A.

description: Went there for early lunch on a Tuesday and we got seating right away. Love the ambiance. The food was delicious. Everyone was really nice. It was great!
author: Stacie C.

description:
Not impressed.

*Potatoes burnt on the outside, uncooked on the inside
*not much taste to the mess (had the Texas Fries)
*Expensive

My #1 criteria for a brunch place is that they need to have good potatoes: cooked right, golden brown, a little crunchy on the outside and seasoned as to have some flavor. None of that here, just a mound of lukewarm burnt potatoes with a few messy toppings.  No, I didn't feel the love in the food here...

OK service.
author: Monkey B.

description:
Okay, so a niman ranch burger and fries is 9 freakin bucks. Oh, and it's delicious. And it comes with a 2 piece bluegrass band playing at the front of the joint. Then the waitress told me it's happy hour and for another buck I get a beer. Reporting to you live from paradise, this place is fucking awesome.

Also, I've been here for two hangover demolishing breakfasts and they were stellar.

If I could give em a 6th star for the jimmy smith record on the wall I would.
author: Rob G.

description:
Perfect place for brunch.

Came here with the girlfriend. It's a quick cafe, so be prepared to know what you want to order (specials are up front on the chalkboard).

We ordered the pumpkin french toast and the New England Flannel hash, both of which were amazing.

TIP: Order the biscuit over any other toast. 

Everything in the place looked tasty, so I would definitely come again to explore it.  $20 bucks for two meals!
author: Liz A.

description:
Came here on a Sunday morning for SF's best/worst meal: brunch. I was not in great shape. However we were seated quickly, and our server was attentive immediately. Within 10 minutes we had constantly filled cups of coffee, hangover-destroying life-saving hush puppies, and a full American breakfast and meat omelette delightfully overcrowding our table.

10/10 would hit up Kate again.
author: Aaron W.

description: I've been to Kate's a handful of times and I'm absolutely in love with Erin - she slings the fasted coffee refills in the city without even blinking, and she's a joy to talk to no matter how busy she is. Go in for brunch on a weekday to get the crispy hashbrowns, and if you're stopping by on a weekend, give yourself a minute because you'll have to wait - but never for too long!
author: Jayme B.

description: Nice to have this little gem in my neighborhood. I do find, best to go "early" as it gets really busy and the noise level is off the charts. Popped in yesterday as I was feeling a "breakfast out" might be in order. Decided on the California Oatmeal which was "more than plentiful" and reasonably priced @ $8.00. Sadly, the oatmeal came only "luke warm" and I asked the server if I might get a new order.  I did put a little milk on it and she said, the milk is really cold, this is probably what happened.  Well, I think the bowl was cold to begin with and then yes, the tiny bit of milk I put on it may have added to the temperature factor.  Thankfully the 2nd bowl came piping hot, I could see the steam and it was full of delicious Strawberries and Bananas but the promised Walnuts were almost non existent.  The texture was a lot like cream of wheat... not very oatmeal like.  Plus it had absolutely no flavor.  The maple syrup helped, but not much.  I did ask for a side of Cinnamon, which did help.  I will stick to the other breakfast options moving forward.
author: Marla B.

description: In a town increasingly awash with pretentious, upscale, mediocre breakfast places, it's encouraging to know Kate's is still here and still wonderful. I used to be a regular till I moved away from the neighborhood about 14 years ago, but I happened to be nearby today and popped in for the first time in years. While tempted by old favorites that happily are still on the menu, like the M &M Sandwich and the Grate Salad, I went for one of the daily specials, a pulled pork omelet. Wow, was this ever great! Stuffed to overflowing with pulled pork, avocado, and roasted tomatoes and red peppers, it was a massive pile of scrumptiousness, accompanied by an equally massive pile of excellent home fries and toast. With coffee and tax, the tab came to $13.75. This place is a local treasure. May it endure forever.
author: Bruce M.

description:
Oh Kate. Just when I was prepared to accept the possibility that it's not you, it's me, I stop in and you provide me with a few examples of how it IS you and it's got nothin' to do with me. 

At one point, you were serving some of the best coffee in SF. A special chicory blend that was made specifically for you and now, I don't even know if we can call what you served coffee. It was bland, burnt and oh yeah, the spoonful of grounds at the bottom of my cup was not so attractive. 

I only order one dish here because I tend to go with what's great and just enjoy that as often as possible. The flannel hash used to be tender, juicy, loaded with flavor and melt in your mouth goodness. Sadly, it's done a 180 and turned into rubbery, bland, tough nastiness and I was so butt hurt by that jab to the gut. 

What happened girl? Are you nursing a break up? What is it baby?? Well, whatever it is, I need to say that we can't see each other anymore. Not even the occasional late night booty call. I need to move on and see other people, but I hope you find what you are looking for hun.
author: Hector G.

description:
I'll preface by saying this place isn't for me, but I can see why some people are in to it. 

I felt so horrible about myself after eating here that I decided to go on a diet. I've never had such a greasy meal before. Both my girlfriend and I felt the same way.

Couple that feeling with overall average taste and the long wait - just not worth it in my opinion.
author: Greg K.

description:
I've been to Kate's countless times for brunch, and never left disappointed. Like all great brunch spots in the city, Kate's will always have a bit of a wait on the weekends. And as many brunch spots in the city, it is well worth the wait.
     Once inside, the service is prompt and in my opinion has great timing. I never feel rushed but also don't have to try to flag down our waitress to ask for more condiments or our check. The staff is readily available but not hovering, which is perfect.
     The best thing about Kate's is the huge portions they give you! And they don't skimp on the quality like some other cafes do.
     Kate's has great service, great atmosphere, and great food. If you have not yet been for a quality brunch, I highly recommend it!
author: Chelsea M.

description: The "big guy breakfast" is really good!! It has eggs, home fries, bacon, homemade sausages, and pancakes!!
author: Yuchen Z.

description: Went in for breakfast this morning with a large group. Most of people's food was fine but one of our group didn't like the food, thought the egg was undercooked, the sausage was still pink, and the dish tasted wrong. We made this aware to our waitress, and they refused to make something else or take it off the check. Later in the day that person got sick and vomited. I called and told them that their food made him sick. The employee replied that they had poached the egg. I told this employee that since this was the only food he had today, it stands to reason that it was the cause of his illness. He rudely told me goodbye and hung up the phone. Don't plan on going back.
author: Rachel W.

description:
My sister comes here for brunch at least once a week because it's her favorite place for breakfast. Since I'm visiting in her in SF, she wanted to share.  And Kate's did not disappoint.  

We ordered the veggie scramble, the meat omelet and strawberry banana lemon curd pancakes.  The veggie scramble was the best I every had and the cornmeal pancakes are so yummy (kind of like a thin johnny cake) and make sure you ask for the biscuit which is made in house - so hearty and made with cheese and scallions.  The meat omelet was good too and nice that they add spinach and cheese. However the veggie option is the way to go. :)
author: Jina K.

description: Kate's has a great reputation for breakfast, but the fact that they also serve dinner seems to be a big secret. Not only do they serve dinner, but they have a jazz band that plays there on  Fridays! Other music is featured on other nights as well, which makes them a unique place in the lower Haight that provides a home for creative music. I can say that their beet salad is tasty, so vegans can make this a destination, and they have quality beer on tap and bottles as well. The music is free of charge, so bring some dollars for the tip jar!
author: David B.

description: I love this place! The ten dollar chicken special is awesome!! Food is super good! Pint of beer, two pieces of chicken, mash potatoes and beans with ham. Yum!
author: George K.

description:
Had the corned beef hash today, which came with eggs and choice of toast for less than $10. It was good, but the beef chunks were too big and a little too salty for my liking. Good with the potatoes though. There were also carrots in the hash, which didn't mesh too well for me either. Also got an order of the hush puppies - huge, but a little bland and too dense. Would've been better if they had honey butter! My sister had the french toast, which looked good, but I didn't try so I can't say for sure. Next time, I'd like to try the orange spice french toast.

Cash only, but there is an ATM right next door if you forget ($2 fee though).
author: Kathy L.

description:
omg this place might just be "the best breakfast in s.f."
fast friendly service (note: I have only gone here on the weekdays in the afternoon), and not bad on price. The amount of food you can get for 10 bucks is amazing!
author: Joann M.

description:
Great service, good breakfast. 

We lucked out and got a table right away on a Saturday morning. The waitress was fantastic and even re-seated us at a bigger table when the rest of our party arrived.

They were on it with the coffee - I never saw the bottom of that cup.
author: Brad S.

description:
Do yourself a favor and don't, just don't, get the French toast orgy. Or get it and give the leftovers to a homeless guy outside. If you don't end up with any leftovers then question yourself and go to a gym or something.

I felt like I am committing a crime when they brought that "huge" plate. You can easily fill 3 people with that amount of food. Regardless, it was pretty good and I'll be back at Kate's Kitchen to explore more of the menu.
author: Gokhan T.

description:
Giving them 5 stars because I like them so much - even though there were a few issues @ dinner. Have always LOVED their breakfasts, so decided to try dinner. The food was really good (fried chicken, meatloaf, grits) and the service was very attentive.

The only issues were minor - the collards that came on the side were really spicy, without warning; and the beets in the "roasted beet salad" didn't have a roasted flavor  or consistency - but these were minor compared with everything else.

However, if you go on a Tuesday night, please note that there's live music which is really loud. Last night, it was a guitarist/singer - he wasn't bad, but he was playing & singing so loudly that it was impossible to have a normal conversation. I really wish he would've held back - in a small space, with tables so close to where he was sitting, it was awkward. We found ourselves having to raise our voices so we could hear each other.

But the good stuff so far outweighs the bad - their big breakfasts are AMAZING & I'm looking forward to going back.
author: judah m.

description:
I've been coming to Kate's Kitchen for 10 years for their breakfast (French toast orgy). Now they are open for awesome dinner, too! Woah, I knew it would be good, but the southern cuisine they serve up just blew my mind. Everything from the meatloaf to the fried chicken to the collard greens with bacon was fantastic.

Come for the breakfast. Come back for the dinner.
author: Peter C.

description:
I would of never known about this place if it wasn't for Groupon. (I'm a total groupon whore.) But anyway, I was pleasantly surprised at the service an food. It was pretty good. I've now been several times and each time has been pleasant. I didn't give a 5 star rating ONLY because the online menu is missing so much more that they offer and they aren't open later on Sundays. Like, I never knew they even had eggs Benedict until I actually came into the restaurant. They really need to update their website, along with restaurant hours. I'm a person who likes to look at the menu online first, just so that when I go somewhere new I have an idea of what I want an can be ready to order. But with other menu items I had no idea they had, I was stuck trying to read all the hand written 'other things' when i was seated. 

Customer service has always been great, and even when I tried to use my Groupon at the wrong time of day they honored it and were very sweet about it. (Thank you!) The pancakes are really amazing. I didn't know they were even cornmeal so it was a pleasant surprise when i ordered them for pick up and i get to the house expecting just a good regular ass pancake an man, i was like Oooh Heeeey girrrrl! Really good, even semi cold lol. 2 thumbs up!
author: Veli R.

description:
A couple of friends came into town and wanted to try some corn beef hash, so we decided to go to Kate's Kitchen after we did some research. They stated they had the "best corn beef hash". So we went in, the service was slow, we didn't know who our waiter was. After we finally ordered, we watched the busser clear a table by putting his hands into the dirty glasses to pick them up,getting his fingers grimy and wet from the germy water. He then went into the kitchen and, without washing his hands, grabbed our food and brought it to us. When we asked him about it, he said very rudely "I didn't touch the food or anything." Then he returned with my friend's eggs and slammed them down with attitude. Obviously we were very turned off and it was just a really bad, gross, experience. 
On a positive note our waitress was very nice and understanding. I was appalled because I have worked in the restaurant and hospitality industry for 25 years and lived in the Haight for 15 years. I have never seen this kind of behavior in a restaurant. Um hello? Restaurant rule 101: don't bus a table by putting your hands into dirty glassware and running hot food to your guests! Gross! Needless to say, we will not be coming back.
author: Jade R.

description: A lot of food for a good price. I had a Farmers Breakfast, great potatoes, crispy bacon and a lovely English biscuit. Cozy location and great service.
author: Guadalupe D.

description: We tried going to Memphis Minnie's, but they were closed due to a problem with their smoker.  Disappointed, we tried Kate's as an alternative.  We had one of the best meals since living in Europe.  Fresh juices, fresh ingredients, daily specials, homemade biscuits, and hearty portions made this an awesome experience.  We will definitely be back!
author: Lisa W.

description: The wait staff was super friendly, but the food is terrible. I got the hash (which is a plate of grilled corned beef, carrots, fennel, onion, and potatoes with two eggs on top ... NOT a hash). The veggies were both burnt and hard on the inside, so the grill is probably WAY too hot. The corned beef was dry and mostly flavorless. The cheddar chive biscuit was decent, but came nowhere close to recovering the meal. Basically I ate my two over easy eggs and had to leave the rest. Super disappointed and not planning on coming back.
author: David S.

description: Have been here about six times over the past 5 years, nothing special just average breakfast type place. The reason for only two stars is the last visit my egg sandwich had a mystery chunk in it, it almost cracked my tooth.  What is it?  Best guess is it is a piece of burnt/broken ceramic from an old plate?  Lost my appetite
author: John C.

description: The absolute best breakfast I've ever had! The French Toast Orgy was perfection! HIGHLY recommended!
author: J A.

description: It looks likes Kate's is no longer open Friday nights for dinner.  Still our #1 breakfast spot.
author: Alison K.

description:
I like girls with the Name "Kate" .
"Winslett", or Even "Katy Perry" or even "Kate Gosselin" 
that lady with a whole bunch of kids, minus Jon..
I even had a crush of a girl name "Kate" when I was in elementary school,
 but nevermind that....

ME and my companions love to score and support small businesses.
And places like Kate's Kitchen is comfortable enough for us to fall in love
with in.

It seems as if a place many locals would gather, 
I'm sure it's popular among the hipsters, and fight club participants
and even wistful laundry land goers int he area.

The server was awesome, kind, and quick, good eye contact
which sparks for me because I like to peer into the souls
of people I am talking too.

If your pockets aren't as deep you would like this place.
The food was good, yet it did seem as if it was lacking 
something little bland. But it was filling.

It was a Wrap, with eggs, bacon, and something else, it was on the broad,
and came with country fried potatoes, which were a little scarce but
good none the less. My friend ordered some corn beef hash...
and commented on the taste being different, than any corn beef
he has ever had...note to self, never try the corn beef?

The best part was the service that and the hot chocolate, 
which never ever lets me down.

Thanks, Kate.
I might come back in visit when I am in the area.

Bonus - They have Gluten free Pancakes!
Pro-tip - Cash Only!
author: Michael R.

description:
Inedible. Clearly not tasting their good before sending out. We ordered the biscuits and gravy and the flour was not fully integrated into the gravy and they must be using powered onion because nothing tasted fresh about it. The kitchen was more interested with their phones and the server just standing there waiting for tickets to come up. 

It may have said it on the menu but we didn't notice it was cash only until paying the bill and had to run to the ATM. Maybe a sign better denoting cash only.
author: Tim and Sam T.

description:
I really wanted to like this place...

1 star for the portions being big
and another for a clean restaurant.

The waiter sucked and didn't check on us and acted like he hated us and his life...
, but the host was welcoming. 

The food is pretty bland, typical american style food. The coffee tasted burnt...like starbucks house coffee.
The French toast orgy isn't what its cracked up to be and the sausage that "they're know for" is dry and tastes like a beat up burger

Cafe Flore on castro is a better choice.
author: Rater 1.

description:
The food was great here - we were in a big party and had a range of things. The French Toast Orgy was amazing as was the Farmer's Breakfast. Unfortunately our experience was soured by the attitude of the waitress who was incredibly rude to us. Admittedly it's a small place and when 12 of us walked in it probably caused a bit of stress! We offered to sit on separate tables but the staff said it would be fine and asked us to wait outside while they rearranged things. When we came back in they had put a line of tables down one side of the restaurant, facing the wall. We really wanted to be able to talk and so apologised (several times) and said we would sit on separate tables after all. Some of us offered to help put the tables back but the staff said they would do it although when the waitress in question saw what we had decided she said 'Are you f*cking kidding me?'. Nice. It then took about 15 minutes for her to take our order despite the fact we represented about 80% of the customers in the place at the time.

When the bill came we had been charged 20% tax. Did I mention we are all from the UK? Luckily it's not our first time out of our own backyard. When we questioned it her response was 'Well whatever, just leave what you want'. 

Hopefully this was a one-off as I can see from previous reviews there are lots of happy long-term patrons of Kate's Kitchen. For the food, I would still recommend it.
author: Sally B.

description:
I've lived in the Lower Haight for several years now and somehow never tried Kate's Kitchen.  I'll never try it again.

There's a line out of the door on weekends, but playing hooky on a Friday with my daughter we walked right in.  Fine place, a little rough around the edges, but inviting and the service was friendly.  Good music, strong coffee, and a vegetarian-friendly breakfast menu.  I was ready to become a fan.

But whoa, the food was gross.  That's not exactly true:  my girl's french toast was fried right, a little tough because it seemed to be made of a baguette, but the orange flavor was good and she was happy.  But sweet baby Jesus, I ordered the cheesy biscuits with gravy, and I can say without question they were the nastiest biscuits and gravy I've ever had in my life.  I just vurped thinking about them.

Frankly, they weren't biscuits by any definition of the word.  The server brought these two hulking, fifty pound blocks of over-floured cake to the table and dropped 'em, BAM!  The whole restaurant shook.  I took a bite and my eyes stopped blinking because the cake had sucked all the water out of my body.  They seemed to have been seasoned with onion salt and sand.

Thankfully, a good gravy can save any shitty biscuit.  Here, however, I received a two-gallon trough of greenish-grey phlegm that tasted vaguely of re-hydrated mushrooms.  Or something.  It was as thick as oatmeal and impossible to dip.  In fact, I tried to dip one of the boulder biscuits into it and a giant slab of the biscuit ripped off and cleaved a hole in the floor that went down to hell.  I chucked the biscuit into the firey pit and an instant later Satan threw it back up.  Even Hell can't take those goddamn nasty biscuits.

Kate's "biscuits" and "gravy" cost $9 bucks, if I remember correctly.  For another $4, you can go to Safeway and get a can of pre-made biscuits and a package of white pepper gravy that you can use to wash the flavor out of your mouth.

One star for the kind service and the coffee, one star (barely) for the french toast.
author: Cody V.

description:
It's nice to find new little spots in the city. Not in the sense that this place is new... but it's new to me. We had just finished getting our visas (Brazil trip, woohoo!) and we were looking to score some brunch. My good friend Miker (shameless plug/see his reviews here: http://www.yelp.com/user_details?userid=xObzTAC6gsFH6XKhc9yRYQ) suggested we try out Kate's. A less than 10 minute trip lands us right into Haight. Awesome sunny day, feelin' good. Let's do dis ting.

Once you walk in, you really know you're in San Francisco. The environs just scream classic Bay Area. Surrounded by lots of local folks as well. We were able to quickly find seats even though there was a good amount of people in this kinda sorta hole in the wall. Lot's of breakfast and lunch options and they have their specials listed in chalk on the wall. 

First off, I want to say that the service was kind, friendly, and prompt. Big thanks to our waitress and server. Food was ordered and brought to us in a timely manner. The food itself? I really really wanted to love it. I liked it though. I ordered the Big Men's/Man (I don't remember which one it is) Breakfast with some gluten-free pancakes (since i'm a health nut stickler like that, sometimes). The pancakes! I enjoyed them a lot, no complaints there. Thick cut bacon was a treat as well, as always. The sausage patty and eggs... small servings and sort of dried out (especially the sausage). I asked my friends how they liked their food. They said it was ok. My friends had the corn beef hash and they noticed the potatoes were somewhat on the burnt side.

All in all? Good to decent eating experience. Prices and extremely reasonable and the service is good too. I just wish the food side of things was a little better. Also, bring cash as this place is cash only. Not a complaint (well, maybe a little) but more of a PROTIP.
author: Eric A.

description:
I've lived in the neighbourhood for almost two years and this morning for some reason  felt compelled to finally try this place. Every time I walk by there's a crowd waiting but at 10am on a Sunday things moved reasonably quickly.

The space is cramped and the layout of tables is quite curious - saw the servers rearrange people multiple times and struggle to squeeze between chairs. If your waistline is larger than 36" there is just no way you can comfortably navigate the place.

The food was an incredible disappointment. How does one fail at a two egg breakfast? The home fries were woefully under-seasoned and I left them almost untouched, and let me tell you, I am not one to turn down potatoes in any form. I also left behind the huge chunks of onions and peppers. There was no white toast option (what kind of a greasy spoon doesn't offer white toast?) so I settled for whole wheat, which somehow turned out to be a mealy AND dried out bun. I  overheard the servers ask almost every single diner if they wanted a box to take home their glaring leftovers - either the portions are too big, or the food isn't great, or maybe it's both. If I were the manager I'd take note of that red flag. The coffee tasted like burnt water. I honestly could have made a more exciting and flavourful breakfast in my microwave. The worst breakfast I've eaten in San Francisco for sure. 

It just goes to show people in this city will wait in line for just about anything.
author: Kat F.

description: BY FAR MY FAVORITE PLACE TO GET BREAKFAST.  The cornmeal pancakes...everyone loves them.  They seem less loving than five years ago but technically the taste the same.  Whatever.  This is my true favorite am meal spot.  The rest is minor leagues.
author: Robert C.

description: It's just a typical greasy spoon. Everything was just okay with a few puddles of grease, but hey- sometimes that's just what you're looking for.
author: Katherine J.

description:
Kate's Kitchen has been on my list to try for ages and today I was finally able to scratch it off the list.

Let me preface by saying that I ordered wrong. I was going to get the cornmeal pancakes but then I changed my mind at the last minute and ordered the biscuits and veg gravy.  It was "okay" but nothing I would order again.

I will go back to try the pancakes soon. The fellow behind me ordered a heaping bowl of oatmeal with fruit and it looked scrumptious.

I will say the service was amazing as our waitress was very sweet and attentive.  The fresh squeezed OJ is a big win.

Don't forget...cash only!
author: Vanessa L.

description:
This place is such a cute place to have brunch on a saturday morning. Wait was not bad and It was a delightful experience.

They give a lot of food so you don't feel hungry. They have great drinks. All of their juices are freshly squeezed. (even tomato juices. 

I will definitely recommend this place. Good for groups as well.
author: Irem G.

description: Probably the best breakfast I have ever eaten.  I ordered the Big Guy's breakfast.  The staff was prompt and friendly.  Everything tastes homemade.  I would recommend this to anyone traveling to San Francisco
author: Ray M.

description:
Disregard the dinner hours listed which states until 9:3Opm. Stopped by a couple weekends ago at 8pm on a Saturday and the lights were out.  Called yesterday to see if they'd be open and tried to make a reservation.  They don't take reservations. I was assured there would be no problem on a Saturday night.  We arrived at 8pm and tried to sit.  We were soon approached and told the kitchen was closed at 8pm on a Saturday night.

I'm a restaurant professional and have been in the business for over 2O years.  I have come to the conclusion that the 9:3Opm closing time for dinner service is the policy.  But, the employees who actually work the dinner shift have made their own separate policy.  And that's to get outa there!
author: Bruce L.

description:
I was torn between giving this place a 3 or a 4 but I erred on the side of not being too generous today.

I honestly picked this place because it was the slowest breakfast place at the time when I was in SF and I was just so hungry I didn't care where I ate.

They the wait list outside and you put your own name on it and how many are in your party, and they call you in based on that. The table I was seated at with my friend was right next to a couple. These tables were so close that you would have thought we all knew each other and were sitting together. It was highly uncomfortable. The venue is a little close for comfort anywhere inside. 

The atmsophere is definitely fits its location. Very "hipster" I apologize for lack of a better word right now. 

They do have vegan and gluten free options.

My food was sort of sub par. The "house fries" which are actually cubed red-skinned potatoes were amazing. My toast was very burnt, which I felt they could have invested time to just redo my toast. My eggs were good but they were scrambled and its hard to mess that up. And my sausage was disgusting and it looked like it wasn't real meat. 

The reason I give this place a 3 is because the staff was very friendly. Our waitress came by just enough to make sure that we were taken care of but she wasn't overbearing.
author: Jenelle G.

description:
Great service, nice place, and excellent breakfast food!

I had the standard breakfast with homemade sausage and a biscuit. The portions are generous and everything was cooked perfectly, including my eggs. The sausage has a lot of garlic, I think, and the biscuit has a sprinkle of cheddar cheese and some other herbs.

My wife had the French Toast Orgy that she loved.

The OJ tasted freshly squeezed.

I'll definitely go back!
author: Tomas P.

description: We beat the line for Sunday.  The cornmeal pancakes were unusual but delicious, especially when you order it with bacon and cheddar - the bacon is mixed in the batter and the layers have shredded cheddar between.  Also the meat omelet which was not all meat but includes their homemade, kale, butternut squash. We had the omelet with their cheese and green onion biscuit instead of toast and that was TERRIFIC!
author: Alan K.

description:
I used to think Kate's Kitchen was one of the city's best kept brunch secrets, but I've definitely noticed the wait getting longer here every time I go now. I have yet to be disappointed by any of their dishes, and I especially love the cornmeal pancakes and M&M sandwich. 

My only gripe is that it's cash only. I understand this is SF, but how can you expect us to spend $20-30 per person and not accept credit card? 

Pro tip - Use the Scout Mob app and get an order of Hush Puppies for free! (Not sure how long this deal will last).
author: Leslie S.

description: Extremely crowded. So crowded that I couldn't finish my meal in comfort. Table for two was a table for four with two strangers. Corn beef has was awful: it was more like a medley of half cooked vegetables with some corned beef mixed in. Gluten free biscuits are nasty and theirs was no exception. Had to go through the kitchen to reach the bathroom, which was just ridiculous. Never again.
author: Bastijn M.

description:
I think the 3 1/2 star average is a very accurate rating; unfortunately we are not given stars in halves and so having to choose between 3 and 4 I choose 3 for my recent breakfast experience at Kate's. Nothing I tried was bad, but the only really great thing was the cheese and green onion biscuit. And even though that thing was quite tasty, it wasn't the best I've had in the city. Besides the biscuit I also had sausage gravy (to accompany it), a side salad and some of Sir Nicholas' scramble.

As far as atmosphere, the tables are really jammed in there. There is basically no room between two tables which makes it a little awkward to get out if you happen to be sitting at one of the interior tables. The service was friendly and the wait wasn't unbearable. However, if the wait was longer than about 15 minutes I don't think that I'd be up for it. 

Cash only so be sure to bring your dinero.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
When I lived in SF this was the go-to early afternoon brunch spot.  For those days where it was noon and you were still in process of getting up...

Still make the trek out a few times of year, food is still great. My personal favorite - orange spice french toast.

Minus one star for the cramped seating / and one rude server experience.  Servers, thank the great cooks for your tips.
author: G B.

description: The food was fantastic and the environment was perfectly casual. I arrived hungover in my sweats and comfortably read and ate alone at the bar that has a view of the kitchen. Staff were incredibly friendly and did not rush me out when I wanted to have a second cup of coffee and read for a bit.
author: Megan E.

description:
This place is worth making a trip no matter which corner of the City you are coming from. My partner and I got in a bit late and were looking for a late(r) dinner. The menu looked a bit heavy for late night, but who can resist the call of fried chicken? We were not disappointed. I ordered the fried chicken and he had the meatloaf. Both were tasty, clearly all elements on the plate were homemade and it was completely satisfying. And to top it all off, in a city where high price tags have become common place (hello trendy $6 toast?!), the prices at Kate's were more than reasonable. 

As someone who works in the wine industry, I was a little disappointed with the wine list. BUT... then I flipped it over and read the descriptions of producers and got a really good understanding of why Kate's pours the wines they do and all was good in the world again. 

So while the dinner was really great, the breakfast menu on the big chalk board caught our attention all through dinner. So much so that I returned the next morning for breakfast. Turns out that the chalk board is only a small portion of the breakfast menu. The "real" menu had even more scrumptious options. The very friendly server (as was the woman the night before) was quite accommodating and let me order a smattering of this and a side of that. By the time my food arrived I looked like the recently-broken-up-with star of a romcom who drowns her sorrows in carbs - plates everywhere!

Savory biscuits in a unique sausage gravy. A fantastic hash with huge chunks of meat and vegetables. And the breakfast item that was my whole reason for being there - cornmeal pancakes with BACON and CHEDDAR CHEESE!  Savory pancakes? Who knew? 

Kate's is definitely a place we will return to when we are in the City. YUM!
author: Jack G.

description: Nice breakfast place with great standards and exceptional, huge green onion biscuits. Service is always friendly and quick. Only downside is that the coffee could be better and parking is sometimes an ordeal.
author: Richard D.

description: YUCK!! Maybe it's because I ordered delivery but the food here was HORRENDOUS!! I ordered the Habanero Burger with no onions and collared greens. The burger had onions in it, the beef patty was dry and the lettuce was soggy and cooked. It tasted horrible. Maybe it's because I'm from the south but collard greens these were not!! No flavor and the texture was just WRONG!! Also, the greens got the delivery container all soggy and broke through when I lifted it up and I had to scoop it off the table. But they tasted nasty regardless...
author: Jonni L.

description: Pros: cornmeal buttermilk pancakes with lemon curd, crispy bacon, the service, and reasonable prices.  Cons: the acoustics and chicory coffee.
author: Leigh F.

description:
I'd rate this a casual 5 star place!  It's a homey, welcoming & friendly place!  Went on an early Friday evening.  Very friendly waiter who helped us decipher the code on the wall.  Enjoyed our conversation.

Onto the food:  ordered the salmon caesar salad to share...just amazing!  My husband who is not a fish eater loved the salmon, and it had the skin on which was cooked perfectly!  Next, for dinner I ordered the meatloaf with fried onions, mashed potatoes & collard greens.  I was hoping to take it home for lunch the next day but it was so good I ate the whole darn thing!  My husband ordered the chicken fried steak.  It was the best chicken fried steak he's ever had.  A tender steak with the delicious breading, over mashed potatoes with all kinds of fresh veggies in the delicious gravy.  Yup, he ate the whole thing too. 

We will definitely be back!  Can't wait to try breakfast!  

Cash only!
author: Donna W.

description: Ordered take out from here, and boy was it mediocre. Maybe it's my fault for getting takeout, but every item I got was bland, dry, and a chore to eat. I got the breakfast special that included two pancakes, back , sausage, and home fries, and honestly, I didn't care for a single item. Even the maple syrup on the side was lousy. I definitely will not be coming back - for take-out or dine-in.
author: Noah C.

description:
Been going to Kates kitchen for god, like 15 years?  This is a comfort food place and I have to admit, I come here for one thing and one thing only:  the bacon cheddar cornmeal pancakes (BCCP).  That's it.  I have ventured offpath a few times in history, but always end up regretting it as there's just nothing like the BCCP anywhere else.  And so, I have come to terms with my single-minded obsession here. 

One thing that  could use improvement is the coffee; it's a bit hit-or-miss.  It's always a very thick, strong cup but sometime it's just lukewarm and on occasion has tasted a bit burnt.  This is a minor quibble.  

This is also one of the best breakfast deals in SF, which gets it an extra star for outstanding value.  

The wait usually isn't that bad or is nonexistent by the time we usually get here (after 1:30).  

Service is good and I tip over 20% due to how cheap the meal is.  

They recently remodeled the place to, so it's pretty pimp and has better layout and, you know, feng shui.  

Somehow that mural of the US with all the stuff going on just never gets old.

Overall 4.5 stars, but rounding up.
author: Goolie G.

description: Oh woua!! What a good surprise! I went for breakfast and I end up with way too much food, but damn it was good. The taste of their food is great and their plates are full and enormous. I'll definitely go back, why not for lunch? They only accept cash, but it's ok, they have an ATM right next to their front door.
author: Debbie S.

description:
I love Kate's Kitchen! The atmosphere is fun and quirky. Really cool picture of North America on the wall. The food is awesome. The many assorted pancakes are delicious. Also the french toast orgy (besides the fun name) is sooo amazing! 

Also it is very busy on weekends, get there early!


The service could be better but you can't be perfect!
author: Aimee E.

description:
So, I think I just died and went to french toast heaven!!!

Breakfast at Kate's Kitchen was absolutely delicious. I was torn between the orange spiced french toast and the pancakes, but am SO happy that I trusted my gut and went with the french toast. 

Now, I'm normally a pancakes kinda girl, but the french toast at Kate's has changed that for me. They were RIDICULOUSLY good! I think I found the best french toast in the city. The french toast was light and the orange wasn't overwhelming. I also added strawberries on top which added some sweetness. Also, they get huge points for using real maple syrup! 

The boy ordered the New England flannel hash (corn beef hash) and potatoes with a side of toast. He enjoyed it and said it was really good but it was a lot of food! We ended up taking that to go. 

So far, Kate's has one of the best breakfasts that I have had in a long time. I will definitely be coming back!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Hearty meals, friendly and competent wait staff, good vegetarian options....this place is legit.

They are currently running a ScoutMob special for free hush puppies with your meal. That was enough to lure me in.  The puppies were soft, warm, and delicious.  I had the veggie scramble with cheese onion biscuit.  It was all quite tasty.  The coffee was good too and my cup didn't go empty.

Highly recommend.
author: Alex G.

description:
On "Sex and the City", Carrie Bradshaw figured out that there are two kinds of women in this world - the simple girls with the straight hair and the Katie girls. Ah yes, misty water-colored memories...K-K-K-Katie, like Barbra "I Did a Drunk Gorgeous Goyish Guy" Streisand in "The Way We Were"..."People ARE their principles!"..."Katie, it was never uncomplicated"..."Your girl is lovely, Hubbell".

So you hate the movie. What do I care? I think a Katie girl must run Kate's Kitchen. There's that streak of insufferable integrity in their greasiness. How else do you explain the humongous chunks of real corned beef in the $8.50 New England Flannel Hash? I'm so used to the canned Mary Kitchen style that it's a shock to taste actual corned beef like you'd have at an Irish wake. It's tasty in a you-know-it's-bad-for-you sort of way.

Too bad they put way too many pan-fried potatoes in the hash. As a rule, I never complain about potatoes on my plate, but honestly, it was just too much relative to the corned beef chunks. The sunny-side eggs were also a bit rubbery, and I do like them gooey to sop up the hash. But hey, I still loved the authentic corned beef, and that's what really matters in life.

It's an old-style place with red checkerboard tablecloths, lots of folk art, and a big agricultural map of the U.S. of A. like you used to see in the World Book Encyclopedia circa 1964. The server was a nice girl and came with my coffee refills frequently. Oh, I'll come back for that French Toast orgy and other unnecessary challenges to my arteries.

"See ya, Katie"..."See ya, Hubbell....Ban the Bomb. Millions of..."...Memories may be beautiful and yet..."

FOOD - 4 stars...not perfect but real corned beef...the far more premium-priced Campton Place is the only other place I know that serves it the same way
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...an old-fashioned place
SERVICE - 4 stars...speedy and punctual
TOTAL - 4 stars...the grease doesn't fall far from the spoon
author: Ed U.

description: Food took forever, waitress said verbatim "for f*ck sake, are you kidding. That's an unreasonable request when someone is busy. F*ck" and continued to say "f*ck" several times as she walked to the back. What caused this? We asked if she could split our bill since there were four of us... upon asking who is in charge, she said "ugh I am, and I'm busy." I dont know who in the hell taught someone to talk to customers like that but I will never go here again.
author: Connor E.

description: as a hungry tourist I was delighted to find this place for my breakfast one morning while wandering the streets of San Francisco. The staff was quick, professional and very friendly and the food was like home made.
author: John V.

description:
Was around the area this weekend and decided to stop in for brunch after searching on the awesome Yelp application on my phone. We got here around 2:30PM, so the place wasnt too packed.

I ordered the meat omelette, which came with bacon bits and veggies. One would think a meat omelette would have more meat (like sausages) but the only meat in it was bacon and the rest veggies. It came with potatoes and toast. My BF ordered the big guy's breakfast which came with 2 pancakes, 2 eggs, 2 bacons, a sausage patty and potatoes. The sausage patty was pretty bad: really stiff and no taste whatsoever.  

All in all a decent place for breakfast/brunch but nothing too estatic or out of the ordinary. The table across from us ordered the biscuits which looked really good, but our tummies couldnt handle anymore food!
author: M W.

description: great place for brunch! Love their french toast selection
author: Kathy P.

description: Yesterday was my first time at Kate's Kitchen and I looooved the cornmeal pancakes with strawberries, bananas, and lemon curd.  The lemon curd is so good you almost don't need the syrup.  Also their homemade patty sausages were delicious - a little dry but lots of flavor.
author: Jay S.

description:
I got the breakfast burrito, whatever it's called.  It's giant, came with a bunch of potatoes.  

Staff was very kind and attentive, even for a take-out customer.  I'd come here again.
author: Dong T.

description:
Love this neighborhood gem. 

Their cornmeal pancakes are rich, sweet, and soak up syrup so nicely. The Mindy Hash Browns (hash browns layered with cheddar cheese, scrambled eggs, and bacon) is also always a hit. Come early and put your name down because weekend waits get long (45-1hr at peak), and don't forget to stop by the ATM before (this place is cash only).
author: Minjae L.

description:
1. Thursday Kate's run out of hamburger meat. 
2. they must have gone to costco because what i got on friday was two overdone costco specials-hold the cardboard. 
3. management refused to refund.
author: Laura E.

description:
Second time here, second bad experience.

Ordered the hush puppies (pretty good) and the Meatloaf/Mashed potatoes sandwich.

A wrap arrives at the table, didn't think much of it.... got a bite in before I realized that it was actually a breakfast burrito. 

I thought to myself,  "well fuck man, I wouldn't want to work on labor day either,  I'll let this one go". I finished the breakfast burrito, mushy and unpleasant. 

Two hours later, it's toilet city for me, Population; 1. 

Fuck this place.

Shout it from the mountain tops!

Also, the "cash only" thing is only acceptable for cutty-ass Asian spots... get with the plastic fantastic, Kates.
author: Carson L.

description:
This place was amazing! I had the fancy grilled cheese with tomato and pesto. It was one of the best ones I've ever had. My friend had the city salad and she said it was wonderful! It was very fresh and pretty. Her mom had the spicy chicken sandwich. Her only complaint was the chicken is served cold, instead of hot. However she said it was great and had blue cheese which gave it a nice twist. I also enjoyed a glass of fresh squeezed orange juice while my companions enjoyed hot coffee and a homemade lemonade spritzer!  The service was fast and friendly and the price point was nice! 

We will definitely make this a regular stop when we are in town!
author: Katie P.

description: Definetly the go to spot for breakfast in the Haight. Breakfast sandwich is amazing, cornmeal pancakes are sublime.
author: Trevor M.

description: I've been frequenting Kate's for breakfast for nearly a year now. I love the breakfast menu, particularly the Big Guys and the Corn Beef Hash. You must be patient during the week when it gets busy as they have a very small staff. Really good comfort food for an excellent price.
author: Duke D.

description: Soo good!! The place itself is super cute.  Has a very homey feel to it. The food is great and reasonably priced. Perfectly cooked eggs and the bacon...O the bacon. Enjoy!
author: Sarah F.

description:
Hi Kate, 

This is your old friend David.  I just want to thank you for the absolutely superb lunch you were able to serve to us.  And thank you for providing such a cozy and warm setting (albeit one that requires a once-over with Windex or a few sanitizing wipes).

And thank you for the orgy.

No no, it's not what you think.  I'm talking about the French Toast Orgy, one of the delightful and amusingly named options on the menu here.

To be fair, I didn't order the orgy, but I did taste it.  It was my lunch companion's idea.  I stuck with a more traditional option, the meatloaf sandwich.

Actually, the French toast orgy was still pretty traditional, aside from the name.  But it was big.  And delicious.  Big and delicious are adjectives that make it a winner in my book.

But the meatloaf sandwich is better, even if doesn't have a witty name.  Perhaps thinking of an innuendo-laden name for meatloaf might be in order?  

I'm taking suggestions.

Love,
David
author: David G.

description:
Santa gave us an early Christmas present today. Since +90% of San Franciscans don't live here, we we're pleasantly surprised to get seated with no wait (a new record). 

The staff and food we're delicious. Their house speciality is the jelly and green onion and cheddar biscuits. Highly recommend getting two. Also didn't hurt that I negotiated the price down.

There was the random crazy guy that tried to sit down at our table, but I chalk that up to San Francisco living.
author: David M.

description:
Delicious! I've been coming here for 3 years now when I'm in SF visiting and it never disappoints! The coffee is always made to perfection and the food is SO good. I love the Pumpkin french toast with chocolate chips, the Corned Beef Hash and the french toast orgy. 
Irene was my server and the reason (other than the food) why I love this place so much. She is so sweet and makes you feel welcome. I recommend this place to all my friends and family! Love it!
author: Patricia L.

description:
Our server was a doll.

The ambiance is friendly. Lots of things to look at. Liked the huge mural of the United States (a depiction of the US glory days with no defining red vs. blue stuff, more pure and nice).

The food is meh.

Patrick ordered pancakes.

Dude, if you order pancakes, you expect your standard buttermilk right? Fluffy and light? Yeah, well...no. These were heavy, mushy cornmeal. You'd think they would alert you on the menu that you were in for cornmeal pancakes but no. Apparently some people love these - OK fine - but they should at least give you a heads up that's what you're getting.

Disappointing.

I had eggs. My breakfast was fine, nothing exceptional. 

As I said: sweet people, nice service, cute atmosphere, but meh on food.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Ah, the french toast orgy. I was duly warned, but had to try. After seeing a mountain of fruit and french toast pass, I decided to order the french toast on the side, in hopes of preventing a soggy mess with the yogurt. Which was delicious (and not too expensive!). I had a fresh veggie drink to go with, and I was set. Friendly staff, and locals brought us so we knew to bring cash and come early. 
Great breakfast place!
author: Adriana K.

description:
This place reminded me why I don't make brunch at home more often. It's not because I can't cook. But I'm usually really tired and on the weekend I would rather pay someone else to make brunch for me. 

This place is more affordable than some brunch places - but that's for a reason. 

It's not a long wait to get in - but that's for a reason. The popular places are crowded because their food is better. 

We had the hush puppies because I had a ScoutMob deal I wanted to use up, but they were basically just deep-fried cornbread. Sort of like cornbread donuts. Not a terrible thing to eat, but not at all what a hush puppy should be. Sadface. 

The special meat omelette was pretty tasty, but the "home fries" were just sort of mushy overcooked red-skinned potatoes with spice rub sprinkled on. Bleah. 

Their egg sandwich has a silly name - a garney flarney or something - and it wasn't very good. It's not hard to make an egg sandwich with bacon and cheese taste awesome, but this was downright disappointing. The roll especially was strangely textured, like it had been frozen and microwaved, so the bottom was kind of stiff and the top was too soft. Again, bleah. 

The service wasn't terrible, but we had to ask for more water. 

I'm with the people who said "meh". 

The best part of the place is the awesome mural on the wall. I would consider going back to try their French Toast and see if their coffee is any good, if I had a friend in town who would appreciate the mural and wanted to walk along Haight.

And thanks to this experience, I'm resolved to make brunch at home more often. Especially egg and cheese sandwiches. With or without bacon.
author: Sam Z.

description:
Kate's is my addiction!!!

Hands down, the best French Toast anywhere, and the Granola w/ fresh fruit is beyond!! Top it all off with a stellar cup of coffee and you've done it all!

(Ps, Irina's comment re: the French Toast orgy is spot on!! ;)
author: Lisa F.

description:
Love this place. I've been coming here for at least 10 years or at least since  spaghetti westerns closed across the street.   It was the first place I've ever had cornmeal pancakes.  I'm more of a sweet rather than savory/salty breakfast guy so I usually order the texas french toast or cornmeal  pancakes with lemon if they're available.  I usually go early so rarely wait in a line.  Coffee is fantastic and service has always been great.

The reason for 3 stars.  Cash only.   On more than 1 occasion, I've decided to go elsewhere since I only had a debit card and did not want to use the shady ATM next to the restaurant and pay over  $5 in fees to get cash. Not sure how they'll survive over the next 4 years remaining a cash only establishment.  Directing customers to a shady ATM that charges $3 in fee's doesn't seem customer friendly.
author: Mike T.

description: Amazing. Veggie scramble was delicious, and they're coffee has great flavor. Worth the wait on the weekends, and perfect for a brunch on weekdays.
author: Hannah M.

description:
I found Kate's Kitchen while searching for a breakfast spot that wouldn't break bank. The last two times I ordered the Big Guys Breakfast and it was great. I really like their coffee as well. The service was attentive and my cup was never empty.

The Big Guy is a a couple of pancakes, a couple of eggs (any way you like'em), bacon, sausage, and homefries. Probably not the heart healthiest choice, but man is it good!
author: Mark J.

description:
Bad Sunday brunch strikes again!

Alright, it wasn't BAD, but I would say 'meh.' Won't be returning.

Wait was short for us when we came in around 1240 this Sunday because a number of people didn't have their full parties. My boyfriend and I were seated within 20 minutes of arrival.

After being seated with our menus, no a single person acknowledged us for a good 20 minutes. What the heck!? Why seat us if you don't have servers ready to help us order?

Nothing on the menu sounded that great to us, but we settled on corn beef and hash and the farmer's breakfast...both with cheddar and green onion biscuits.

I also ordered the hushpuppies because I was intrigued and didn't know if we'd make it back. The were served with honey butter and dusted with sugar but very bland. They were dressed up to be sweet but were not flavorful.

The first thing we noted about the food was NOTHING IS SEASONED. It's one of those places were they expect you to load up your seasonings. What? Put some salt and pepper on my eggs, please. 

The most flavorful thing about our meal was my juice. The blueberry, strawberry and apple blend was great. Recommend.

Nothing on our plates was memorable. The home fries were soft and not crispy at all, the biscuits lacking in any sign or taste of cheddar. 

At the end the waiter handed us the wrong receipt that clearly wasn't for our table. A $12 bill for a two-person meal? Come on. Were you even looking? We had to flag him down to get him to notice.

Slow service. Meh food.
author: Angela R.

description: Grr! I live across the street and I often come here for breakfast! And usually I love it! Today they had some lady working, not my typical efficient, friendly guy. She was awful. She let me sit and wait and wait and wait to be served. When she finally got to me she asked if I was ready to order and I said yes. She took my drink order and walked away without the rest of my order saying she wasn't in a hurry! Umm yay for you I happen to have things to do. I received my breakfast hash browns were burnt and greasy and my eggs were runny and gross. Since she never checked on me there was nothing to do but pay and leave. Seems simple enough until I needed change for a $20. I got to sit and wait 15 minutes even though I asked the bus boy for change. I like Kate's typically but I will not go back if that girl is working. I will wait for my guy.
author: erica s.

description:
Two words: Lauren's Special.

That's all I need on a Sunday Brunch. It's an amazing sandwich, with sausage, egg, cheese, avocado, tomato, onion, and aioli! It's delicious, everything you want, all in one amazing package. It's really the only thing I get when I come here!

Also, if you're feeling crazy, get the buttermilk cornmeal pancakes with strawberries, bananas, and lemon curd. It's life changing! I never thought I'd like these things together, but I love it! You can't go wrong with a sweet and savory meal like this one.

The place is small, lots of tables though, and a giant board that has an extended menu. There's always a wait, so just write your name on the list outside the door. You'll get seated in about 15 minutes. It's usually that quick. Service is awesome, they're attentive and always ask if you need a refill on your coffee. This is definitely my go-to brunch spot.

Maybe I should stop saying how awesome it is so no one else finds out about this place, and I can have it to myself... Eh, too late.
author: Andrew T.

description: This place has the best mimosas in town.   At $15 a carafe, you can't beat that! Simple, good breakfast staples and lunch offerings. Yum!
author: Kara L.

description:
I used to love eating at this place when I DIDN't live in the neighborhood, now that it's three blocks away I'm getting fat.  

Top two favorite breakfasts in the city for me.  

I love the big hashbrown plate - great greasy cure for a hangover. 

The french toast orgy is aptly named - and i'm kinda horrified that I can actually finish one (see first sentence). 

What I love about this place is that it takes things that you expect to be standard for breakfast, and they someone make the experience and the food unique and special.  That's right... eggs and pancakes and potatoes but in a unique and special way.  And there are several things that they just get.  Of COURSE I want real maple syrup.
author: Eric N.

description:
I've been about 3-4 times now, and have never been very impressed. I don't think I will be returning.

pros:
+ price

cons:
- wait
- the french toast orgy, while impressive looking, is very bland and flavorless.
- cash only
- uncomfortable chairs
author: Captain B.

description:
Kate's is the bomb. They have the best pancakes I've ever had. Most of them are cornmeal and they also have oatmeal ones. They load them up with all kinds of delicious toppings and they are all just absolutely amazing! 

French toast orgy......it's an orgasm in your mouth and impossible to finish on your own because it's HUGE. Loaded with yogurt, granola, fruit & syrup, it's just simply amazing. The fruit orgy is just as good if you wanna go lighter on the carbs and eliminate the toast. Same thing minus the toast.

I love Irene's wrap, and I love Irene!! She's their most awesome hostess, sweet, funny, wild and super attentive all at once, and her wrap with the habanero salsa is off the hook.

Everything at Kate's is good and original. They are not your typical breakfast spot as they have their own unique touch to all their creations and all their dishes are fresh, creative and just plain good. Oh and they have great coffee and fresh squeezed juices. Kate's is definitely one of my faves.
author: Irina S.

description:
Mmmmm! If I live close, I will have breakfast here everyday! Big portions, reasonably priced, good food!

They only take cash... Bring quarters for parking!
author: Mariaela G.

description: I used to come here all the time when I first moved to SF and I thought it was the best breakfast ever. I came here recently after not having been in years and I was expecting to have my taste buds blown to bits... but no. Apparently I have experienced bigger and better things because I was not that impressed with my meal. The hush puppies were kinda bland no matter how much pooh butter I put on them. The fruit orgy was not as mouth wateringly sweet as I once remembered. The flanched farney garney or whatever it's called was just good not great.  However, I do like that the portions are not overwhelming and the prices are fairly inexpensive.
author: Jessica F.

description: Used to be a great hangout place but became very greasy recently for some reason... Kate please fix this, we love you!!
author: Baptiste P.

description: Awesome breakfast, super friendly and fast staff. Mimosas in a karate, genius! Good corn beef. Hush puppies weren't so flavorful but still good.
author: Kim B.

description: Good food but this place takes forever.  My party of 3 went when it wast even busy. My advice, don't go hungry. However, generous portions, lovely home fries, ( I can tell food was made as it was ordered) the grilled cheese is fantastic. The BLT was completely  cold by the time I got it - isn't the toast part supposed to be a bit warm? It felt as if I got it straight from the cooler. But maybe this is just a different style that I m used to. I would go back again, but not go when I m starving. Just half- starving. ( ps. Cash only)
author: Zita M.

description: Wonderful friendly service with good prices. I will be back for the French toast and more.
author: Lauren M.

description: This place is cool the food was good its really small and there is a wait.  Not that bad in price and you get a good amount of food. Potato and the basket is good
author: Victorious R.

description: Food is acceptable and it's great that they have gluten free options. The gf biscuit is practically inedible unfortunately but the pancakes were ok. Service is always good though.
author: Anastasia V.

description:
Plain and simple: We love this place!!

The staff is great and usually the same people. We usually come during busier brunch hours but we have never had to wait long (or at all). 

We have ordered a wide variety from the breakfast menu and has always been nothing short of delicious. Kate's is very inexpensive and they are very generous with the portions. The neighborhood is great and parking is not impossible (even though we usually walk).
author: Pork N.

description:
I recently moved upstairs from Kate's and I've had my eye on this place. So for my friend's birthday weekend, we had a group of 6 and we forgot to put our name on the list even though we had asked the host for a spot. He got us right in anyway!

Then, we all ordered our breakfasts, they came out super fast and were so delicious and reasonably priced! I ordered the Man's breakfast which was under $10 and really made me feel like a man! I subbed their special pumpkin pancakes too and everyone at the table wanted a bite...or two!

Will be back many times, see you soon Kate's!
author: Cory N.

description:
I had yet still another tasty and interesting meal at Kate's Kitchen this morning. I went with the "Irene's Wrap" off their specials board, which was basically a breakfast burrito, with a nice roasted habanero-tomato salsa. 

After I had already ordered, I noticed the "Pumpkin French Toast" also off the specials board; I thought it said "Pumpkin Pancakes" (which they also offer) so I just skipped over it. Mind you, I had absolutely no complaints on my wrap, but that French toast sounds excellent and I hope to get back again soon to try it out. 

Say "Hi!" to Irene if you do go there, and thank her for the wrap (her hip-hop needs some work, though).

(If you would like a little more detailed take on my breakfastary trip this morning, click on my profile here and check out my stupid little 'blog that is linked there. I have been chastised by the Powers That Be yelp* that I am not supposed to post a link in these reviews... duly noted... or dully not.)
author: Brian M.

description:
YUM YUM YUM YUM YUM...I still have my wide smile on from breakfast.  I had the corned beef hash, which is really cubed CHUNKS of corned beef with roasted red potatoes, and a cheddar, dill biscuit. SO GOOD at only $8.50.

My hubby got the special pumpkin french toast; it had thick gooey slices of battered bread....*drool...*

I would steer away from the Herbal Berry Iced Tea though, it tasted suspiciously like Celestial Seasonings' "very berry" and was frankly underwhelming.

Other then that though, the food makes up for it. BE SURE TO BRING CASH.
author: Alice L.

description:
Stumbled to this place on my first morning in SF. It was actually 12:30 in the afternoon and I was starving. Things were getting desperate and I had no idea where to go, was just walking. But always check out a place that's simply a woman's name. Boy was I happy I followed that rule.

It's a small diner with many tables and not much elbow room. Didn't care at all though. The food was fresh. The flavors excellent and the service fast and friendly. Nothing to complain about. Oh, and the prices were spot on perfect. Even for San Francisco which is consistently way over-priced. This place was perfect. $24 for 2 full breakfasts and coffee and juice.
author: Charlie R.

description:
Not great at all. Especially when compared to other breakfast spots in the area. 
My waitress (not all them, just my one) was kinda grumpy, unable to crack a smile until I was leaving!

My food arrived quickly and wasn't expensive. But it was bland, dry and boring. I ordered the scrambled egg, home fries and bacon. The bacon was too well done, the home fries not chopped small enough (huge dry hunks with no seasoning) and the scrambled egg more like an omelette cut up into big pieces. It really could have used some flavour... Either tomatoes, peppers, onions or avocado would have helped it hugely.

I wouldn't recommend this place, especially considering there's so many better places in the neighbourhood.
author: Ej S.

description:
This was my first time in San Francisco and after mapping out most of my trip, Kate's came up as a good spot to grab some breakfast before hitting up Haight St. 
The inside is small, quaint and welcoming. We were seated with smiles and looked over the menu. Basic breakfast items.

I ordered the FLANCHED FARNEY CARNEY - eggs over medium with bacon. I was told they were out of whatever bread it was served on, so i got the biscuit instead. The biscuit was dry and had pieces of rosemary in it (what an odd combo). My home fries were burnt but replaced with an edible serving, no questions asked.

I did try my boyfriends cornmeal pancakes. They were different but good. My taste buds were battling each other "are these pancakes or cornbread" type of thing.

The OJ was refreshing, not too sweet and not tart at all. 
Would I go back? Probably not...but it was decent enough for a quaint hole in the wall.
author: Andrina H.

description:
This place is great! Aside from the longish wait (nothing, however, compared to some other places), I have very few complaints. 
The food is great! The biscuits and gravy are artery-clogging amazing. The cornmeal pancakes are the perfect blend of sweet and savory, and they usually have some vegetarian scramble with a ton of great veggies.  Also, the prices are unbeatable. It's like I am ordering breakfast anywhere else besides San Francisco. 
The coffee is kind so-so though...strangely salty.  Oh and no booze.
author: Kathryn H.

description:
Boy... was I disappointed with this place.  I was so excited our hosts brought us to this place.  I read all about this place - of course on Yelp - and couldn't wait!

The good thing about this place?  The coffee... it was one of the best cups of coffee I had ever had.  

The bad thing about this place?  The food!  I had two eggs over medium with hash browns and bacon.  Not any of it worth mentioning. 

We ordered hush puppies for a brunch appetizer... wish we hadn't.  Tasted like corn meal and grease.  No other flavors come through.  Yes.... I know that hush puppies are friend and made of corn meal... but you expect some flavor - no?!

My friend got corned beef and hash - read all kinds of good comments about this too.  Evidently from people that have never had good corned beef and hash.  Just not much flavor.

Not sure if this is an east coast/ west coast thing?  But I did not enjoy this place much.  Not sure it's a coastal thing either... I have many 4 and 5 star reviews from my trip.

I will skip this place next time I'm in town.
author: Mike B.

description: Minnie's hashbrowns with the eggs were really good but this place gets crowded pretty quickly. Service was great. Nice brunch spot on Haight.
author: Xteethx B.

description: This place is awesome! I was walking down Haight last Friday and a spotted a Jazz quartet illuminating the sound of the busy street atmosphere. I decided to check the spot out, and sure enough the food was amazing. The wait staff was super nice, and the Fried Chicken was superb. I also shared a Kale salad with my lady, and it was supreme- dressed with I think blue cheese crumbles, cranberries, i forget what else, but it was memorable. And every Friday they have great jazz. I recommend it!
author: Jack J.

description:
Meh to Bleah. I'll start by saying the woman who waited on me was very good. It was very uncomfortable standing in the middle of the place waiting for some acknowledgement, all the while the man expediting in the kitchen just stared at me. I hope the runner was having a bad day because he was definitely giving off a weird vibe. Love being asked if I need anything else right after he watched me take a bite of a hushpuppy. No water. Whatever.

About those hushpuppies. The best part about them is that they were free with a Scoutmob offer. The only flavor came from the oil they'd been cooked in and everything else that had been cooked in it plus the pile of powdered sugar. No corn flavor. No salt. A weird musty flavor as if the mix used is old. The "Pooh" honey butter made me a little nervous since it seemed entirely possible it's made from the plain butter that comes back to the kitchen.

I stayed basic since this was my first visit and ordered the Farmer's breakfast w/ the homemade pork sausage, cheese-onion biscuit, substituted grits for the hashbrowns. The eggs were cooked to order. The sausage is dry, but  the grill cook still hasn't learned not to press down on patties with a spatula while they're cooking. Consequently, they were absolutely dry.. The grits had absolutely no salt and very little flavor. The biscuit had no cheese, large pieces of green onion tops, no salt, no flavor.

While I've had my share of meals where the kitchen has a heavy hand with salt, no salt is worse. Everything needs a pinch of salt to enhance flavor. The one thing that had plenty of flavor was the hibiscus tea.

The best part was that I actually got a great free parking place on Haight just 1.5 blocks away. Learned my lesson...go to Trader Joe's to replenish eggs and milk and make breakfast at home.
author: Lydia S.

description:
I had the veggie sandwich of the day. The bread and grilled eggplant was great.  The home style fries were good too.

The biscuits they have are great! They are a bit dense so if you get the side order try to share.
author: Vinay A.

description:
Great neighborhood brunch spot, though there's a line almost any time you would want to eat (and I usually don't believe in lines). Finally went at 9am on Saturday for a quick breakfast. 

Fantastic fatty side of hash, it's the real artery clogging deal. Pancake is good, as are eggs. 

With tea, $27 for two
author: Aki N.

description: I went before noon on a Saturday and was seated immediately. The food is delicious and the portions are quite large. Very affordable!
author: Steph M.

description: This is by far one of our favorite brunch choices in the city. Their fresh squeezed juice and unique menu items are worth waiting in the long line that usually starts on the weekends. My personal favorite are the cornmeal pancakes with fresh fruit and lemon curd but the French toast orgy is a close second.
author: Amanda C.

description: Breakfast or dinner, this place is great! Good food, big portions, decent prices, and great menu for people with gluten allergies and/or vegetarians. The wait times can be hit or miss for  weekend morning, but usually not more than 30 minutes on a bad day.
author: Bianca E.

description:
Great place! Lovely comfort food for brunch at good prices. Went there at around 12nn on a Saturday and was seated within 15 minutes.

I got the veggie omelet with a side of chicken-apple sausage and thick-cut bacon! So good! Shared a French Toast Orgy with a friend and it was delicious.

Can definitely recommend this place!
author: Belle G.

description:
Passable brunch dive with an obnoxious attitude.

When we sat down and said a friend was coming, the head waitress went nuts. She started accusing me of lying. "You lied saying your friend was parking so you could get a table."

"NO! I was parking. Do you know how hard it is to park in your neighborhood?"

We ate and i ordered coffee. The owner and the head waitress tried to kick us out before I could even finish my coffee.

"There's the bathroom," said the owner to my friend, "But you should leave soon!"

Seriously, I wouldn't have gone there if my friend didn't recommend that dump. And we all had to sit in two separate tables for an 8-people party.

I told them I would give them a 1-star review as promised.
author: Q L.

description: Had the daily veggie scramble with tofu on New Year's Day. It was amazing mixture of cheese, roasted tomatoes, and squash. The flavors popped and every bite was spectacular. Service, coffee, ambiance, and everything else were wonderful, as usual. There was a short wait to get in, but well worth it. Dinner is fantastic too, usually without the wait. I love the mashed potatoes and the kale salad.
author: Sacha I.

description: The place is small so it fills up quickly. The pancakes are great. I definitely recommend the bacon/cheese hotcakes. Downside was no Coke or Chocolate Milk.I tried the homemade ginger ale but wasn't my style. Service is good and prices aren't bad. They have a sticker on the front window that says people love us on Yelp which I thought was pretty cool.
author: Kyle M.

description: Terrible service, great food. They forgot 2 orange juices, our side of toast, side of biscuit, side of jam, 15min after our entree arrived. The restaurant was not busy either.
author: Khaled B.

description:
This place has decent, unremarkable breakfast food. If you're just ordering the cornmeal pancakes, I might bump this up to a four-star review -- but only if you can deal with poor service and long waits. Anything else (french toast, breakfast sandwiches) is bland by comparison. 

I used to go to this place for take out quite a bit, but they got my order wrong so consistently that I got fed up with them, and don't think I'll be going back. Once, my breakfast sandwich was served to me as just an egg on plain bread -- missing cheese, bacon, and veggies -- and I didn't notice until I got home. My fault for not checking? Perhaps, but they were screwing up my order 2/3 of the time. This place just isn't good enough to justify the long wait and sloppy service -- I'll be looking elsewhere for my pancake fix.
author: Phil N.

description:
I feel very lucky to live a block away from this lovely spot. 

The atmosphere is fun and cozy. I get a warm, fuzy, summer-campish feeling when I eat there.

The menu has a wide array of delicious brunch options, and prices are cheap. Picky eaters of all kinds will likely find something they want here. I personally am a huge fan of the amazing juice menu, which is a little more pricey, but with reason.

The wait can get long, so I'd advise getting there a little early to write your name on the list if you plan to eat with a party of 3+ on saturdays and sundays.
author: Mia M.

description:
The corned beef hash and eggs I had was perfect, and the rest of the menu looked good too.


The coffee however, was burnt; it literally tasted like a stoner's ashtray.
author: Damon K.

description:
I love Kate's Kitchen! The unpretentious, Vermont-esque vibe. The friendly staff. The continuous coffee refills. The fact that they have (delicious) gluten-free banana walnut pancakes, gluten-free biscuits (!!), and some of the best corn beef hash I've ever tasted. 

One piece of advice - On the weekend get there early. There's always a line but it moves pretty fast for such a busy place. Even if you're the 6th name on the list, take heart and a short walk and come back. The servers are on point. I've been here many times and in my experience you'll likely only wait 20-30 minutes at most. 

Actually - I lied, one more piece of advice: bring cash (there are ATMs a-plenty nearby too)
author: Robyn B.

description:
I took my partner to Kate's Kitchen since they boasted several Gluten-Free options.  Since he has been diagnosed with Celiac Disease we have been on the hunt for great places to eat that can accommodate his dietary restrictions.

We ordered the gluten-free oatmeal cakes for him.  He's very sensitive so we always ask about the chances for cross contamination depending on the food preparation environment.  The waitress was very nice and said she would go and ask for us to make sure.  Soon after, someone else came out and let us know that they actually add a little bit of gluten to the oatmeal to make the cakes.

Yes.  You heard correctly.  "We add a little bit of gluten..." to our gluten-free oatmeal cakes.  We kindly asked them to stop calling them gluten-free.

So instead we ordered an egg scramble and a gluten-free biscuit.  They assured us that the biscuits were free of gluten.  When the food came, it came with home fries.  My partner then asked if they can check how the home fries are prepared, since we have encountered places that actually dredge the potatoes in a flour, or dust the potatoes in flour.  They came back to let us know that there is no flour there either.

Awesome...let's eat!

So my partner digs in to the scramble, only to find that there are strips of tortilla throughout the scramble.  This was not listed on the ingredients on the menu board.

We are accustomed to asking about food preparation and the presence of gluten in the food we order.  It's appalling that after we had asked about pretty much everything we ordered nobody at Kate's Kitchen clued in that we cannot have flour tortilla strips in the scramble.  

Brunch ruined...my partner left Kate's Kitchen hungry and angry.

Dear Kate's Kitchen,

Please do take seriously your customers' dietary restrictions.  It is insane that you call your oatmeal cakes gluten-free when you consciously add gluten to them.  For my partner, gluten is poison.  You are intentionally poisoning people when you tell them something is gluten free, when you know that it is not.  Please stop putting gluten in your oatmeal cakes, or stop calling them gluten free!
author: Carl B.
