description: Drip coffee only. Hearty food. Great service. We had the Lauren's Special which I would describe as a breakfast burger. Very good but big servings. Would try French toast variations next time.
author: Selina B.

description: I really enjoyed this place while visiting back in March. I reminded me of home which can be comforting before heading out into a new city that you've never been to. My waiter was really friendly, everything tasted fresh and was cooked perfectly. Thanks Kate's kitchen.
author: Cass L.

description:
I really like this place for brunch emergencies. Service is fast and very nice. 

The corned beef (flannel) hash is pretty freakin awesome. Tons of food for a pretty good price. Just the right amount of beefiness. 

the French toast orgy is a major fake out. The menu says French toast, smothered with fruit, yogurt, and honey. Over the years I have been trained to expect BERRIES with my French toast. Nothing beats a good French toast covered with fresh berries. We all know that. However, this one comes with a hodgepodge of gutter fruit. There is a time and a place for melon and it is not at breakfast on my French toast. The fruit selection is bizarre and low quality: honeydew, grapes, watermelon, and pineapple. WTF?!

Bottom line: go savory and you can't go wrong.
author: Winston L.

description:
We had an incredibly unsatisfying lunch here with some friends. 

I had seen a line out the door last time I was in the neighborhood, so I thought it would be a sure thing. Although, I hadn't checked the Yelp reviews. 

The menu is quite honestly...boring. 
But, after walking around for awhile, we were all starving. 

My guy and I decided to share two dishes: a short stack of cornmeal pancakes, and an egg sandwich. 

We requested the egg sandwich on whole wheat bread, which I'm really glad we did, since it was probably the best part of our meal. 

The potatoes that came with the egg sandwich were awful, no flavor, and not even properly cooked. 
The egg sandwich was fine, I think it would have been really hard to screw this up. 

The cornmeal pancakes were bland and completely flavorless. 
I've had cornmeal pancakes before, and have loved them, but these were a waste of money. Seriously, how hard is it to get decent flavor in them? 

When the server asked how we liked everything, i said I didn't really like the pancakes. He asked why, and i told him I thought they were pretty bland. He didn't offer to bring anything else out, nor did he comp them, (even though we didn't even eat half of them.) 

All in all, a waste of lunch in the city.
author: Amanda G.

description:
a hangover must!!!

i ordered the kaiser roll with egg and sausage. i also got their iced tea. we were deciding between 2 restaurants, but this one had waiter service and won the war. :)
author: Kailey O.

description:
I'm never felt so un-welcomed and had such mostly bad food. 
Ok, so we entered at 2:15 on a Friday. The first thing the waitress does is look at the clock before saying a word to us. (I should have taken that as a clue and left) She said they were open and we sat. I held my menu the entire time, and read the specials board, while the waitress came to the table 4 times and asked if we were ready! Finally she said, I'm not trying to rush you but the kitchen is closing in 15 minutes. (You WERE trying to rush us!!! And tell us before we sit down that we don't have much time. Although, I think 15 minutes before closing is plenty of time to order our food. 

It went down hill from there. 
Food came up fast. Was NOT good. Hard, stale biscuits, soggy under-cooked hash-browns, Nothing was salted, my friend has a very restricted diet-she got his order wrong even though he went over it with her several times in detail, chairs up on the rest of the tables in the dinning room before our food arrived, waitress dropped our check 5 minutes after our food, was changed and waiting for her money at the table behind us, owner stood in the kitchen with his arms folded staring at us to get out, waitress never said thank-you, etc..... there is more actually. 

Luck for the waitress, my friend is also in the restaurant business like me, and grabbed the check and paid for lunch. Giving her a very nice tip, I'm sure. Much more than I would have given her. But he's overly generous like that.....
author: A J.

description: Came here for brunch with my friend who lives in San Francisco. Got there before the rush and was soooo glad because by the time we were finishing there were a ton of people waiting outside. Coffee was great and so was the ambiance. I had the orange spiced french toast. It was really yummy but didn't taste that much like orange. Husband got the manly man breakfast and there so much food we ended up taking it with us to go and he can definitely eat!!
author: Emily D.

description: Kate's is the go to breakfast place on the weekends, so arrive early to get a choice of where you want to sit.  The seating is tight, so please don't bring a lot of baggage, bulky backpacks, etc.  The attentive staff is courteous and polite.  This  was a return visit after a month hiatus and the waitress remembered me.  This time we ordered the flannel hash.  This generous serving comes with 4 half slices of toast, eggs cooked your way, a platter filled with big chunks of corned beef with potatoes, onions, carrots, and celery.  It was an interesting combination.  We should try to eat more vegetables and this meal was a tasty filling. The coffee brewed correctly comes with several refills.  I'll be going back as my favorite so far is the Mindy's hash browns.  The potatoes come out extra crispy with bacon, eggs, and cheese.  If you want a comfortable weekend/weekday wake up, Kate's should be on your list.
author: K C.

description: I really wish this place would pull it together. I've lived in the neighborhood for about a year and have only been here a handful of times, for good reason. The food is decent (have yet to understand the breakfast hype), but they need help in making this a better dining experience. Every time I come for dinner, they overwhelm me with commentary on how much they are limited to do. Both times, I've felt like I was invading or not really supposed to be here. The waitress panicked when I even looked at anything other than the dinner menu. (I was looking at the beverages, but turns out those were limited "dinner-only" options, too.) The place is always a ghost town and the food takes a long time. No need to come back here again.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Best cornmeal pancakes I've ever had in my life! I highly recommend the pumpkin ones and the French toast is awesome too.
author: Avery R.

description: I like the ambiance of this place quite a bit: cozy, casual, what I look for in brunch places.  Ordered the standard 2 egg breakfast -- the potatoes were pretty tasty, I did enjoy the bacon (nice 'n crisp), and the jam was just okay -- had kind of an interesting texture to them -- it was okay.  Wouldn't mind coming back, but not sure if I'll go out of my way to do so.
author: Mel G.

description:
Nothing beats a cheap yummy "breakfast" (at 2 pm) when you're hungover. Very casual, if slightly hectic, atmosphere. 

I highly recommend some of the specials. I had an omelet from the specials once that blew my mind. Their egg sandwich type things are also pretty great and nice on your wallet. I also noticed they were recently named one of the "favorite places" in SF on google. Good for them.

Watch out for some the the "quirks" here though. To get to the bathroom you have to go through the very busy kitchen. Pretty funny but potentially not the best idea... Also the waiting staff can be up and down. Last time I went in though, my waitress was super friendly and bubbly. Always nice way to start your day...

Oh yea and watch out for the hush puppies. Highly UNrecommended for hangovers
author: Alejandro D.

description:
AMAZING coffee!!  Who knew this cafe's regular house brew could be so tasty?!

My friend and I got the oatmeal pancakes, as recommended by all the yelpers and the Veggie Scramble too. 

Oatmeal pancakes were good, but it didn't knock my socks off.  Veggie Scramble was pretty darn good.

Their biscuits are nothing exciting... actually not really good at all since they're a tad dry and hard.  My old roommate used to make awesome cheese and onion biscuits... and I'm sorry, but Kate's Kitchen doesn't come close.

My friend and I came on a Friday morning and there was no crowd, no wait.  Hooray!  But I hear they can get pretty busy on the weekends.
author: Tran T.

description:
A recent emigrant from the city of San Francisco, I visit it as often as I can, and always have trouble deciding which of my favourite restaurants to visit.  There is so much to choose from in the city, and every visit I can only visit one or two on my list.  That said, when it comes to a Sunday brunch, I always make time for a stop at Kate's Kitchen.

There are plenty of tasty options on the menu - the veggie omelet for one, or the thick slabs of french toast, the dangerous hushpuppies - but what keeps me coming back (other than that wonderful coffee!) are the oatmeal pancakes.  So moist, so beautifully textured, so light - it's like a warm bowl of oatmeal served in pancake form.   Beautiful.

If you live in town, you have no reason not to make this place a standby - especially if there's a ridiculously long line at Zazies, as there always is - and if you don't, it's worth a visit.
author: A B.

description: The best pancakes ever!!! There may be a line but it's worth the wait!!!
author: Danielle G.

description: Get the orgy. But dear god I hope for your sake you've got a severe case of the munches. It's a lot of good food.
author: Luke S.

description: Amazing breakfast place! Authentic southern feel, great and friendly service. The hush puppies were amazing!
author: Jules M.

description:
I debated reviewing Kate's because it is my all time favorite breakfast spot and I will be so bummed if it ever has a huge line of people waiting on weekends. I LOVE that I can go here on weekends for a delicious, well priced, perfectly made breakfast and not have wait 2 hours or even 20 minutes for a table. The waitstaff is always friendly and do their best to be attentive, although they sometimes seem to be understaffed. 

I always get the veggie scramble since the ingredients change frequently, and it's fantastic. Fresh veggies in scrambled eggs or an omelet, usually with goat cheese or cheddar. The roasted potatoes are great, they are always my downfall as I eat way too many. My favorite element to this place? Their kiwi strawberry jam on toast. PER-FEC-TION. 

Cash only!
author: Patricia J.

description:
Went there for Sun brunch and here is the reason for the single star:

1. After putting down on name on the wait list I asked the hostess if she could give us an estimate of how long it would take. She said she had no idea! 10 min or more like an hour i asked, the response one again was I HAVE NO IDEA!

2. Our order was delivered wrong twice. The first time we got the order of another table and the second time we got what was supposed to be our order! They did bring the right meal to our table at last.

3. Both meals lacked flavor. The French Toast Orgy literally had ONE TEA SPOON OF YOGURT! 

4. We were given our check in the middle of our meal without being asked for. And the servers made a few attempts taking our half way through dishes from the table rushing us out the door! Unprofessional and impolite!

Yes I understand you are busy and you might need the table but maybe you should give us a little time since it took you so long to bring us the right meal! Also a few extra bucks is not worth giving your customers such an unpleasant dining experience. 

Sorry but not going back!
author: Maryam M.

description:
We went here for breakfast early morning mid-week. The food was a little burnt for our taste and the service not so friendly. The biscuits were the highlight of the meal. 
Over all, it all just felt a little off. It feels like it should be amazing, the menu looks inviting, the decor is adorable and yet the over all experience is a little blah. Fine for a quick bite but don't expect your dreams to come true.
author: Genevieve S.

description: Kate's has always treated me right. Great service, really great food. The french toast is superb. After a night of drinking, or if you are just craving solid diner faire, Kate's is great.  Best for groups of 4 or less.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
Our official SF guide took us here for breakfast - though we explicitly asked for a place that served mimosas and bloody Marys. As headed toward Kate's we popped our heads in some potentials but found no libations, so by the time we hit Kate's we had given up on the idea and just wanted to eat.

I am really glad we waited. Of the utmost importance about Kate's is that they have menu item named after me (Lauren's Special), which, of course, I ordered. Two, their chairs are wicked comfy. Three, their flavored (unsweetened) ice tea was the incredible (berry). Reminds me of what they serve at Pita Jungle - I have to find this brand, it is soooo good.

The server was patient with one person in our group's somewhat difficult diet limitations (though I suppose that's pretty common in California). Food came out pretty quickly, though the waitress seemed to actively ignore us for 20 minutes after we were clearly done eating (hard to do in such a small place and considering she literally walked right by us several times to get to the kitchen).

But the food was great. My poached egg was perfection and the potatoes were yummy too (boo to no Chalula or Tapatio, come on, is this California or what?). Their house hot sauce looked like watered down Tabasco - and I find Tabasco to be pretty watered down anyway. But some people at the table tried it and said it was a-ok.
author: Lauren V.

description: The breakfast food was really good, though the pumpkin pancakes don't really taste at all like pumpkin. The server was on top of our order though the place was packed. Definitely a good spot of you have a group 3 or less since it is a small hole in the wall. You also get to watch the cooks work which is usually a good sign of quality.
author: Nick A.

description:
This place is on my hit list when I visit, simply because they have the best corned beef hash on the planet! Don't be fooled about other places that claim to have good house made hash, this place offer big chunks of tender corrned beef w/ tasty homefries and your choice of egg any style w/ toast.

They have some fresh juices as well; the veggie one has zucchini, broccoli, among other misc. tasties that is good for you as well!! ;)

You can either try their gluten free biscuit or cheese, green onion biscuit. 

Gluten free pancakes as well!!

Cash only & open til 2:45 pm.
author: Bob G.

description: We have ordered delivery from here and wanted to go and sit down, despite the bad reviews. We went on a Saturday afternoon and thought we would be in for a treat. I ordered a pretty standard southern breakfast, grits, eggs, biscuit and bacon. My grits were not creamy and tasted like they were instant grits...but, worse of all was my biscuit. It was hard and was not soft and fluffy in the middle and tasted as if it was reheated on the grill. After or meal was over we place or card down and tried to pass it on to the host, who was not busy. Our waiter was running around like crazy and seemed to be the only one working. The host said he couldn't take our card and we would have to wait for our server. So we did...when he came over he told us the only take cash. That's fine, but why couldn't the host take two seconds to let us know that?!? We will not be going back.
author: Cassie F.

description: Average hot food. Definitely not ordering corned beef and hash again. Bland potatoes and dry corned beef. Green onion biscuit looks better than taste. Dry BUT the cornmeal pancake is worth it. Only reason it has three stars. I'm not a sweet toothed but I love my cornbread.
author: Candice H.

description:
Best Corn beef hash in the city?
It says on the menu.
I had to try that and I did.

I was in the neighborhood about 25 years ago.
It was all black neighborhood.
The Church Street Muni station was pretty bad back then.
So as the Safeway wasn't really safe.

There was a diner called " Church Street Station" where "Home" is now. 
I used to go there for $1.99 Breakfast Special include 2 eggs, 2 bacon and 2 pan cakes, was a great deal. 
And they was a Gay-bar called "Hideaway".
I used to play Pacman there.
There was a great Blues music bar right on the corner of Haight and Fillmore.
There was a little candy store called "Thomas's Hot dog and Ice-cream"  on Fillmore between Haight and Waller. I used to go there a lot.

Oooops, this review is for the Kate Kitchen.
My Corn beef hash was REALLY GOOD!!!
But I was overwhelming by a bunch of all those white people in the area used to be all black.

I am just sayin' the neighborhood has changed.
There were NO White people's family with baby carts, period.
I mean, I didn't see any White people back then.
But, in the Kate Kitchen, I saw all white people in here.

I haven't been the area too long.

Time changed, People changed.
SF changed.
Clement St become Asian Street.
So as Irving St.

Is it possible the Grant Ave will change to nice and clean?
I guess not.
author: Nobu K.

description: Atmosphere is a little grimy but really great food for a great price. Fresh oj. The orange spice is awesome in the pancakes
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Food was awesome, wait staff attentive and got us coffee refills. I had a hash brown omelet and loved it. The browns weren't too soggy or too crunchy and not super greasy. Just right. Only way it could be better if they took cards.
author: Bee C.

description: I loved the atmosphere at this place. I went to Kate's about three times and my friend and I were unfortunately sick from the food two out of three times. I would love to go back if the cleanliness or food prep conditions improve.
author: Christie H.

description:
There are tons of places in San Francisco that serve the same-ol brunch:  you know, pancakes, omelettes, eggs benedict, french toast, corned beef hash, etc.  Some are pricey, some are inexpensive, some are seriously greasy, and some attempt to be gourmet.

Kate's Kitchen is the place I take friends who want something unpretentious-but-a-little-different:  With Kate's Kitchen, an effort has been made to make breakfast just a bit more special, and it's all in the touches.  

My husband enjoys the New England Flannel Hash, which unlike other places, in no way resembles dogfood and instead has a lovely marriage of good corned beef, potatoes and actual vegetables.  

I opt for the Orange Spice French Toast, served with real maple syrup (I ask for the butter and powdered sugar on the side)...delicious, different from other french toasts, something my taste buds really appreciate.

I have also gotten their Cornmeal Buttermilk Pancakes with lemon curd, and they are TO DIE FOR!!!!  YUM!!!!

My mother favors the French Toast Orgy, which is the afore-mentioned  french toast topped with a very healthy pile of fresh fruit, then slathered in yogurt, granola & honey....it's a HUGE serving, and my mother could barely make it through half, despite her best efforts!

There are also many other delicious options to excite the palate: Flanched Farney Gaeney (egg and cheese sandwich), the usual "Big Guys Breakfast", oatmeal with fruit and nuts,  Cheese & Green Onion Buscuits served southern-style with either sausage or veggie gravy, and they even have Hush Puppies!

The Cons for this place are few but deserve mention:  Kate's Kitchen doesn't take reservations, and it's rather small...so this isn't the kind of place I'd bring a large party.  If it's just me and maybe 1-3 other people, sure, I'll definitely go...but since I hate waiting in line for a table, I'll go a little later, past the lunchtime brunch rush.  But you can't wait TOO long, since they close at 3 pm!  

If you're claustrophobic, this might not be the right restaurant for you, since it's pretty tiny and very cramped.  The chairs are also rather uncomfortable for those of us with an ample posterior.

Parking can also be a dog in this neighborhood, but you never know when you'll have good luck and find a space nearby!

But overall, this place is one I happily go back to time and time again!  Kate's Kitchen is a great place to take your date the morning after, or your parents while they're in town if they don't like fussy high-end brunches but still want something a little special!
author: Amy L.

description:
- food: creative yet average
- atmosphere: eclectic
- staff: conscientious
- price: okay deal

additional info:
- the biscuits are pretty dense and a little bland
author: J. B.

description:
Another overhyped brunch/ breakfast place. Pancakes are okay.
It's relatively cheap and the portions are generous. But the food is not great.
Lots of average tasting starchy food, grease and gravy to fill you up, it's not my idea of "good" food. If I'm going to clog my arteries, the food should be awesome. This place is not.
author: Luis C.

description:
Aaron I. said we had to go here based on what he heard from friends.  After making room to park by bumping two cars i was sardined between,  we exited the car with applause from spectators.  

We were immediately seated, the vibe was tight with nice beats and a local crowd.  I immediately scanned the menu for detox food and was pleased to find many options- like the "fruit orgy"..cute.  I went with the "colorful vegetarian scramble" from the specials board and had a side of fruit.

Lila, our server was incredible from start to finish and BTW very easy on the optics.  The portions were perfect and very easy on my tequila drenched stomach.  This spot has it down packed with all the elements and has found a home in my weekend brunch rotation.  Daisuki yo!
author: omar b.

description: Disappointed. Ordered the Vegiscramble off the chalk board. When food arrived it was full of eggs (NOT on ingredient list) also home fries were cold.  Big thumbs down here.
author: Harry P.

description:
I am going to give this place 5 starts, for I've been there 3 times so far and it's been always great. Food is very tasty, prices are very affordable, and the service has always been fast and friendly. Worth mentioning the blonde waitress we had last time, who was just fantastic: warm and friendly but not overwhelming. Just the way it should be.
Location is great and I like their interesting maps on the walls. Recommended.
author: Leon S K.

description:
A friend raved about Kate's biscuits and breakfasts so Saturday a friend and I headed to Kate's. The biscuits were amazing. I did not know a biscuit could be so hard you could not cut it with a knife or a saw. If you're looking for ammunition for your slingshot, Kate's is the place. Order a half dozen biscuits and you can kill elephants with them.
I ordered my eggs over medium and the cook almost managed to cook them over hard. The bacon was okay. The potatoes sucked.
Will I go again? Yes, if I'm starving, the grocery stores are sold out of all their food and no other place in Northern California is open.
author: John A.

description:
If I'm going to wait in line for breakfast, I'd rather head to Upper Haight and stand outside the Pork Store Cafe.

The portions at Kate's are incredibly large and represent good value. It's just difficult for me to get very excited about the food.
author: Miriam W.

description:
Worst service, and the food has gone downhill!

I used to love Kate's kitchen aeons ago, but it is not what it was.

Today I went with a companion.  I asked both servers working the  tables nicely for a cup of coffee, which never arrived.  Although they forgot to give me my coffee and never gave me a refill on water or a chance to order another mimosa, they remembered to charge me $1.75 for the coffee.  When I asked (very nicely, again) for it to be taken off my bill, the waiter didn't apologize or say a word but curtly took the check and my cash.

And speaking of cash, what restaurant in 2014 can't get a Square or something else and take credit cards?  

Finally, my hash browns were burnt.  So burnt, they couldn't be eaten.  Charcoal burnt is what we're talking.   I left half my plate of food as completely inedible.  

My companion similarly ate less than half her plate of food.  "The biscuit was the only thing worth eating," she noted.  

We eat out regularly around the Castro, Haight and Mission, and this is the worst service we've encountered.  This was not an isolated incident of bad service, either.  The last time I went, I had a lot of trouble getting my check and gave up on getting a refill (which I would have happily paid for, if only I could have gotten it).  

Today we spent over $30 for two plates of food, most of which we couldn't eat, a cup of tea and a mimosa.  Not worth it, especially with so many other excellent places  like Kitchen Story or Squat and Gobble or Boogaloo's.
author: carole m.

description:
Delicious and cheap!!!  $11 for breakfast and tea!!!  And there were left overs!!!  I will be back!!  
CASH ONLY
author: blair k.

description: Only been here once, and I had the bacon & cheddar cornmeal pancakes. Amazing. Definitely want to come back.
author: Eduardo R.

description:
i love kate's kitchen.
the veggie scramble changes every day; i've been there over 10 times, and never had the same scramble twice. the cornmeal pancakes are also delicious. i love the texture.
the service is consistent, too. in all the time's i've been here, i've never had a bad experience. 
the only downsides are that it's cash only, and there is often quite a wait. come before 10 on weekends.
author: Cami J.

description:
My waitress was very sweet and friendly. My food was good it wasn't vomit inducing but it wasn't oral bliss either but at least it was healthy. 
The place is small and it didn't look like it had a restroom. I got there in the afternoon so I think I was the last order so I didn't have to wait for a table. 
I ordered a veggie omelet and a homemade ginger ale and waow! I knew it was ginger but it took a second to get used to, still I liked it. The menu seems to be very healthy and not too heavy on meat dishes and they offer gluten-free items if that's your thing.

I knew the kitchen was closing but I wanted to order something to go after I was finished with my meal to take to my friend and the owner/manager was not accommodating at all. It was a veggie sandwich so I don't see how fire was part of the equation. He proceeded to tell me that the place closes at 2:45 and his cooks had been there since 7 a.m. and it was almost 4 p.m.  Still it's 9 hours and I don't think an extra 3 minutes would have killed anyone and it would have been another sale but I guess my money wasn't good enough. 

In general I got a negative vibe and major side-eye action from the owner/manager. My thoughts are if you are so close to closing time then don't take my order to begin with.  But if you do and I ask for something while I'm still eating and it doesn't require fire what's the big deal? 

Overall I liked the service from my waitress hated the attitude from the manager/owner. Would I go there again? Only if I was starving and hungover.
author: Y M.

description: Wife and I are visiting from Atlanta and we learned of Kate's from Yelp as well as the clerk at our hotel.   The food was excellent, she ordered the French Toast Orgy and I got the egg and cheddar sandwich with the homemade sausage.   Service was quick and friendly, but we are on vacation and were able to arrive between the busy hours.  The add a little chickory to the coffee and for those of you who have traveled to New Orleans, this is cuts the bitterness and just makes for a smooth cup of joe!  If I was a local, I would definitely make this a mainstay in my restaurant listings.  I recommend it to anyone visiting San Francisco!
author: Mark S.

description:
Just fine. Nothing special at all. I would certainly never wait in line for this place. 

Basic breakfast done, well, basically.
author: David L.

description:
Ridiculously tasty food, good pricing -- definitely good value for dollar. Feels like a good breakfast spot should.

I hope their coffee is always that strong.

The down side is that the tables are packed in, so it can feel a lot more crowded than a normal restaurant, and that also means that the service might not be great. If you're there at peak times, it's not going to be as enjoyable as at a more laid-back hour, but I don't know if that would stop me from going.
author: Tim R.

description: Give Tony lots of credit for managing the almost full restaurant with speed and kindness. AND the food is terrific. The veggie scramble was great. I felt so lucky and parking wasn't a problem either. I will go back many times. My favorite is Dotties and to love Kate's means a lot. Yum! Thank you, Tony.
author: Alison R.

description: I think the only downside of this place is the wait. Besides that the food was delicious! I had the corn beef hash and cornmeal pancakes. The corn beef hash isn't your typical one you'd get from a breakfast place. It's real beef, peppers and onions and potatoes! It was a pleasant surprise. The cornmeal pancakes were also amazing. I'd definitely get them again. The staff was friendly and helpful. I liked the decor and cozy feeling as well. Can't wait to eat here again.
author: Leah F.

description: I wanted to like this place, I really did! But, unfortunately I'm not a fan. Three stars is generous. However, other lower haighters may like it. It's so close to my house. So I've given it a couple shots. I'm a fan of iced tea. But, they don't have regular ice tea they have some red herbal tea. Hibiscus or I don't remember! Just give me  some green or black iced tea! I need caffeine! I like pancakes. But, no blueberry buttermilk at this place! The have cornbread pancakes. It was similar to eating cornbread with syrup! I get wanting to give people new and different options. But, classics are classic for a reason. NO GRANOLA on my french toast! These things are weird in a bad way.
author: Heather B.

description:
I recently saw Inception. Great movie, one of my favorites of the year. The concept is planting thoughts in dreams. An intriguing prospect. And I think Kate's Kitchen does it.

Years ago, we are talking five or so, I came here. I vaguely remember having one of the best brunches ever. Something about French toast combined with a parfait. I couldn't get it out of my mind. Is it even possible? Had inception taken place? I had to find out.

Waking up after an epic, epic evening with Kyau & Albert and Simon Patterson, brunch was on. Joined by my food partner in crime aka adventurous sister, we arrived at Kate's hungry. Very hungry. We were going to need every bite of an appetite.

Oh it's real. French toast. Yogurt. Granola. Fruit. It's call the French Toast Orgy, and my stomach still has that morning after flow. Bro and sis devoured this beast, and a rocking veggie omelet on the side. Good thing we saw each other last week, there wasn't much time for talking. Just eating. And smiling.

Best, and most appropriately named, brunch dish ever. It's no dream.
author: Jason B.

description:
Good food. Their breakfast special is pretty boss. 

I'd be all about giving Kate's 5 stars instead of 4, but the prices could be a little better.

Read some long review on here about how being made to wait and getting the wrong drink here ruined somebody's birthday. Re-evaluate your life.
author: Brendan M.

description:
We were waiting for a friend that lived in the neighborhood to get home and had a little time to kill so we decided to get a snack and something to drink when we happened upon Kate's Kitchen. It wasn't lunch time, but there were several diners inside and we figured that was a good sign. We split an order of hush puppies and each had a glass of tea. The hushpuppies were great and I made a mental note to go back again someday for something more substantial.

The next time I was in the area it was breakfast time and we decided to actually have a meal here. There were lots of people hanging outside waiting for a table this time. We put our name on the list hanging outside the door and joined the wait. 

I thought the French Toast Orgy sounded interesting even though it wasn't something I would usually order. I decided to try it anyway and it was fantastic! The orange spice French toast alone was very flavorful and it was piled high with fresh fruit, plain yogurt, and granola. There was enough on my plate to easily serve two hungry people. I can't remember what my friend ordered, but I do remember that she was happy with her meal too. 

I've been back a few times since and now I usually split the French Toast Orgy with whomever I'm dining with. If no one wants to split it, I have them give me less French toast because I hate wasting al that food. I've taken several people for breakfast at Kate's Kitchen and everyone has loved it.


I've tried lunch here too and had the M & M Sandwich, but I was not so impressed with that. It was edible, but didn't taste nearly as good as it sounded on the menu. I'll stick to breakfast at Kate's Kitchen because they really know how to do breakfast.
author: Debi T.

description: First morning on a SF trip, we wanted a great homemade breakfast from an authentic locals place. After a little research, we settled on Kate's. Took a bus from our hotel onto Haight and found this hidden gem. Server was friendly and welcoming and the fresh, scratch breakfasts we enjoyed did not disappoint. Love this place!
author: David M.

description:
Although relatively straightforward, it's a charasmatic little joint with decent food.  I had a mediocre chicken/sundried tomato omelette, but holy Jesus lord were the cornmeal pancakes delicious.  I was saving them for the "dessert" of my meal, but luckily I tasted a bite early on, so that I ended up eating them completely to avoid filling up on the omelette.  

One of my two friends had the french toast orgy, which was monstrous.  Great idea for a breakfast item.

Our wait was very short but the tables were rather cramped together and the service was nothing to write home about--a bit harried and surly.
author: David R.

description:
Came here for breakfast! So many delicious-sounding choices.

FRENCH TOAST ORGY. They didn't lie when I received my plate. Yogurt, granola and various fruits on top, french toast on the bottom. I was supremely full and overall satisfied. It was an orgy in my mouth.

Very cozy place, decor is very homey, staff was nice and friendly, lovely breakfast place.
author: Laura F.

description: I've never met a restaurant in the lower haight that I didn't like, and Kate's Kitchen is no exception. The food is tasty, the service is great, and I couldn't ask for more.
author: Eliza D.

description:
Wow! Really Kate's?!?! You took a piece of happiness away from me today...

I live in the lower Haight and have seen the lines outside this place for years, but have never had the chance to try it.  Today, my best friend and boyfriend asked me where I would like to go for my BIRTHDAY brunch. I chose Kate's, and was very excited about eating out at a new, local spot  with my two favorite people.   

After we signed up on the very long wait list, I began perusing the menu and there were several tasty items that I couldn't wait to try (I get really excited about new food).  The only menu that you can see outside while you are waiting is RIGHT by the door that has to be opened each time the host/busser comes outside to check someone off the list and take them to be seated.  Each time the girl came out, I could plainly see that she was irritated that I was in her way.  ForGIVE me for wanting to see a menu that is new to me while I wait in your enormously long line.  (Strike one for having the outdoor menu in a bad location that entices dirty looks from frustrated employees)

There were several names on the list, when they were called, they were no where to be found, including a party of 6.  We thought this would work in our favor... yay!

After waiting forty-five minutes, a member of the staff calls our name. I was so excited I gave a little "woohoo!" out loud :) .  Yaaay! Time to eat! The girl brings us in and gives us our table.  We start looking over our menus, and I notice three staff members talking next to our table, and then one of them points at us (strike two...don't POINT at your patrons. That's rude on OR off the clock...common sense here...come on!).  

A minute later the girl who has been seating people comes up to our table and says to us, "I'm sorry there is a party of six who called ahead and this is their table.  Can you please go outside and we will call you in 10 or 15 minutes?"  

WTF? Are you serious? You give us a table then you make us get up after five minutes, after we've taken our coats off and go back outside? Wow, really??  Who DOES that?

Oh wait...isn't that that party of six whose name you called earlier that wasn't even THERE? That showed up 30 minutes AFTER we had been standing outside waiting? Wow... (big strike three, get us excited and then let us down.  Boo!! ) 

Okaaay.  So we go back outside and we continue waiting for another 10 minutes.  

When we get called back inside, the staff is not apologetic about giving us a table and then taking it away.  Its a little disappointing, because ONE sincere apology would have made such a difference.  When a mistake is made, you would think that the staff would try to make up for it with a good attitude, or smiling or apologizing.  Naaaah...not this time around.  (strike four)

We order an orange juice and two coffees and they bring us an OJ and coffee and a mystery juice.  My friend says to the girl (same girl who asked us to leave our table and wait outside) "Im sorry, we didn't order a grapefruit juice." the girl looks back at her and says "Oh honey, that's not a grapefruit juice! Its an apple juice." 

Really? Well it sure ain't coffee, HONEY!! I didn't even CARE they had brought the wrong thing.  Who cares?!?! Its just a juice!! What I DO care about is the tone of voice that you use to talk to me and hers.....was NOT cute.  Coming from an old crotchedy waitress chewing gum the "honey" would have worked...but she was younger than us and it came out sounding soo condescending.  (strike five)

Even though I'm irritated at this point...I am being NICE because I am really trying my BEST to still have a nice birthday brunch. Really really trying.   

Then, our waitress is rude and ignores most of what I say to her. Even if you are busy, all you have to do is acknowledge your customer so that they can relax and know you will take care of them.  Its hard to convey her attitude in words, but she was acting like a teenage girl that is mad at her mum.  When the mum asks her to clean her bedroom, the child just continues pouring her water and ignores the parent.  THAT is the attitude that came across. Bratty! ewwwww (strike 6)   

It is hard for me to even talk about the food because I was so distracted by the out right rude staff.  I have worked in restaurants on and off for the past 14 years and I know what service is suppose to be. When you go to a restaurant, how can you relax and enjoy the food and the overall experience when people all around you are acting like douche bags??? What's the point of eating out, if you can't have a good time?! Why should I PAY to be treated like CRAP and ignored!? WAAH!! :( Makes me so sad!! 
 
Biscuits were dry, gravy was bland. The egg sandwich thing (Lori's special?) was pretty tasty but was NOT worth an hour wait and NOTHING is worth being treated the way we were.  

I will never return to Kate's and I feel sad that I wasted my time and money here today.  Happy Birthday to me! Thanks Kate's!!
author: Jenn T.

description:
hush puppies with "pooh" butter-- absolutely fabulous

Strong coffee and corned beef hash!!!  YUM  YUM  YUM
author: Lisa M.

description:
Delicious, small place & servers are more friendly than most in San Francisco. It's worth the wait to be seated since that's what you'll have to do on a weekend brunch hour. Just remember the demand on the weekend & don't be one of those people who takes up at table for 3 hours... The wait staff will hate you. 
The cornmeal pancakes & French toast are fantastic!
author: Kimberly R.

description:
This is one of my two favorite breakfast places in the city. The pumpkin pancakes are a dream, and all the pancakes are great, the egg scrambles always have interesting ingredients, and the hot cereal is a delicious multigrain. They are always great about substitutions (fruit for potatoes, etc), and leaving things out that I can't eat--they've never made a mistake in the many years I've eaten there. Servers are friendly, and with low turnover you get to know them over time. And the price is right.

Weekend mornings are always busy, so get there early!
author: Nancy S.

description:
This place is great; it has a low-key, neighborhood vibe.  Price point was very good too. 

The food is top-notch and "homestyle," if you will.  I wouldn't be surprised if everything was prepared on cast iron skillets.  

The service is what you want if you're in Lower Haight, I imagine.  
Our waiter was prompt and pleasant, but not hovering or obtrusive.  

The cheese and green onion biscuits are a must to order.
I had the farmer's breakfast, but I had a couple bites of the meat omelette, and it was awesome.
author: Stuart V.

description:
Kate's has great food at a great price. I live in the neighborhood and I go to Kate's often. However, today I was annoyed by two things:

1) Someone brought a dog into the restaurant and no one asked her to leave the dog outside. (see picture 47).

2) On a $14 check, my change was a 5 and a 1. I don't mind leaving a 30% tip or more on an inexpensive check, but I will not be manipulated.
author: Connor M.

description: This is my second time here and it is possibly my favorite restaurant. Thinking it was just a regular bfast spot I wasn't too excited when I went I was pleasantly surprised. Everything. Is soooo good
author: Saycsar F.

description:
great deal and great food.

Simple and easy (just like me)
author: Matt V.

description: Best breakfast in Lower Haight, except they don't serve hash browns on the weekend.
author: David L.

description:
Now this place has to be my favorite breakfast joint in the city! From the outside, it kind of looks like a hole-in-the-wall eatery. That's because it pretty much is. This place is pretty small but compensates by giving me what I need in a breakfast/lunch diner. 

First, the food here is really good quality. Everything here tastes very fresh and delicious. Second, the portions here are quite filling. Third, the food here is exceptionally friendly on your wallet. One of the more expensive dishes was priced at around $9.99. This dish is almost too much food for me to eat! Try going to Toast or Eats. $9.99 is going to get you one of the smaller, less filling entrees. You can walk out of this place at around $12 WITH a delicious beverage. I love that.

You have to try their banana walnut pancakes!! I mean, try any of them. They are all so amazing. Also, any breakfast with their fruit is great. The French Toast Fruit Orgy is fantastic! My only complaint about this place is that they are a little shysty with their maple syrup. All you have to do is ask for some more, but I always feel weird asking. I think it's bc maybe they're trying to get people to stop smothering their food in sugar. Maybe? I'm not sure. This complaint isn't big enough for me to knock them down a star though. 

Thanks Kate's Kitchen!
author: Greg S.

description: I usually don't give bad reviews, but this staff managed to seat us in the worst part of the restaurant, people came "way" after us got served their food first. And when our food finally came both of our plates were missing key items from our dishes!!!
author: Stella B.

description:
My friend lives right down the street so usually about 5 of us come here for breakfast when we are in an extremely hungover state, and I've been here about 4 times-- so I keep coming back for a reason right?! I have never had a bad experience, except for the time when my boyfriends breakfast looked way bomber than mine (you know those times you order something then when all the food comes out, you wish you had gotten someone else's.. I hate that!) But regardless, everything I have eaten there is quite delicious. 

SO I guess my advice would be this: if you're hungover, and are looking for some very satisfying food (and don't really care about much personal interaction with your waitress because it IS a very busy place) than this place is where it's at.
author: Breena M.

description:
Are you ready to wait in the long line just for brunch or for the pancakes?...if not, don't bother coming to this place..it would be about 20% most of the time that you would have to wait for than 20 minutes (and more!!) for seating. 

anyway, most breakfast and lunch combinations are decent. i believe they try to make everything simple and easily connect to your soul/comfort food. instead of spending 2 hours and about $20 to make  your own breakfast, why not going to Kate's and let them serve you the perfect and simplest breakfast...

however!!!!...credit to  kate's pancake and Hush puppy that make the meals interesting..for next customers at Kate's, it is all about pancake here darlings.get them all or at least one..and totally suggesting to try hush puppy and surprising honey butter...i asked them the at least 3 times for that butter...anyway,...it's all Kate's.
author: Yada S.

description: This place is really good. We got there around eleven and luckily enough for us, they serve breakfast all day. But after I saw the menu, I was coppin some lunch! I ordered myself an aggie sandwich and it was the best decision of the day. It had roasted beets and avocado! Fierce. The staff was extremely friendly and just seemed. Like good people in general. It made for an excellent atmosphere. I will stop by again given the chance
author: Sean H.

description: Ordered the hash brown omelette. Hash browns were burnt and the egg way overcooked. I guess it could be good depending on the day, but this day it wasn't. Oh well, hey, the orange juice was good! Next place please.
author: Bill H.

description: Reasonably priced, good service, solid food (the bacon was nice and thick; the sausage wasn't my favorite; eggs were all well prepared; pancakes were really hearty and delicious).  Have been now a few times and will be quick to go back.
author: Smitty S.

description:
This place had a lot of pro's and con's and it should be known that the 3 star rating I'm giving it, is a high 3. Come on Yelp...give us half stars!

Pro's
*They were open. Lower Haight was a ghost town at 10am on a Friday.
*They were cheap. A place down the street wanted $10 for an omelette. Shouldn't we be getting paid to eggs during the egg crisis? 
*Very quick with getting your food out to you. Looks like they get a lot of business and it being a small place, need to get you in and out of there.
*I had the Lauren Special and it was pretty tasty and for only $8 bucks.

Con's
*Only 2 girls working, I got lost in the seat yourself policy and saw 3 different tables who sat after me get waited on first. 15 mins before a hello was given. 
*The Lauren Special was served on a HUGE bun making eating it near impossible as it was served. Had to disassemble it to enjoy.
*Potatoes were cooked at real high temp I'm guessing so plates don't have to wait on them and they were not that good.

Not bad, not great but the price and the availability might allow me to venture back.
author: Tony C.

description:
Kate's Kitchen was the best way to refuel after Bay to Breakers. The wait is short. The staff was very accomidating and attentive. I will definitely come back here.

Kate's is very cozy and homey. Great for breakfast.
author: Ryan B.

description:
Really good food and coffee.
I always get the big guys breakfast and split it.
Really good prices as well. 
Perfect for a good lunch on a nice day !
Nice and friendly staff.
author: Vera A.

description:
Super fun ambiance. Good food. Nothing on the menu was terribly exotic ... but hey, that's okay, and perhaps a bit refreshing.  

Highlights: perfectly done bacon and corn meal pancakes
author: Ian S.

description: This place USED to rock!  Especially the french toast Orgy-the french toast orgy I had yesterday was completely dry bread at the center and w/o taste.  So disappointed!  The collard greens my sis ordered were terrific.  Also bring back the cholula.  Waiter was w/o personality (but thats ok, I don't go out to bfast to make best friends w/ my waiter).
author: M M.

description: I ordered the Flanched Farney Carney with Aunt El's homemade sausage. Two very delicious sausage patties. My nephew ordered the corned beef hash. Whoa - that was good. There are chunks - not diced up - pieces of corned beef. So tender too. Friendly and attentive staff. Thanks Yelpers for the recommendation.
author: Shy O.

description:
The french toast orgy was good, but not great. Without the orange spice on the side it was pretty bland. But the portions were HUGE and the granola added a nice crunch. 

A pretty casual place; servers aren't overbearing which I like, but they also don't refill your water etc. unless you ask. 

Cheap & convenient for weekday brunching.
author: Richa A.

description:
Lovely poached eggs for breakfast!

This is a nice local joint, but always busy. Took away 1 star because of the wait. 

Delicious, tasty food; reasonable price.
author: Averil W.

description:
Wow. Not only does this cute little joint have an exciting menu, but they have exciting prices to match - and by 'exciting' prices, I mean cheap.

Amongst our choices were the french toast orgy (which has fruit and granola piled on top of it), pumpkin choc-chip french toast with whipped cream, a yummy meat scramble and a veggie scramble (complete with crunchy bits of fried tortilla in the mix). All of the items on the menu are under $10 (most are between $6.50 and $8.50) and you get big portions. Be prepared...

The ambience is very homely and simple, and there is a huge mural on one of the walls with a map of all the different types of farms across the USA.

Be warned: Kate's normally has a line out the door, but as we went on a weekday (Monday), we were fortunate enough to only have to wait for them to clean a table that had just been vacated as we arrived.
author: Melanie B.

description:
One word - Pancakes!!!

I'm a pancake connoisseur and have been on a mission to find the best pancake in the city. I haven't found a place that beats Kate's Kitchen yet. Not yet.

I have been to Kate's quite a few times now. Have had their omelets, hush puppies, biscuits and gravy and all the three types of pancakes they serve. Here's the LD:

Hush puppies: not impressed. Lacks flavor.
Biscuits and gravy: to me a big disappointment - also tasteless
Omelets: really good, but not anything to die for
Potatoes: also not amazing
Pancakes: the best I have had in the city so far!!!

They serve three types of pancakes: oatmeal, cornmeal buttermilk, and pumpkin. You can choose different toppings like banana and walnuts, banana and strawberries, nutela, and, oh, cheddar! I have tried all different ones, and keep coming back to the oatmeal with banana and almonds topping.

Today I decided to take my two friends to Kate's, we dealt with the usual line (not too bad) and we ordered the Big Guy breakfast, which consists of two pancakes, bacon AND sausage (to my friend's amazement!), eggs and potatoes. It was a real feast! 

After lots of coffee toasts, lots of laughs and food entertainment, it hits me what keeps bringing me back to this place: the fabulous service provided by Irene, the friendliness of Hassan (the owner), the very good price (and flexibility to add or make changes), and, of course, the out-of-this-world pancakes!!!!
author: Simone W.

description: So good, love most everything especially the sweet stuff.  The standards are a bit bland, so try something unusual.  The biscuits are excellent.  Weekday mornings are a great time, no wait usually.  Good strong coffee.
author: Patrick S.

description:
The place to go for a cheap, good breakfast in a hip cool spot of the city. I used live right up the block and so on a lazy Sunday morning this place and their strong ass coffee always got me going. 

Pretty much everything on the menu is great. I love love love the pancakes with fruit! Their fruit is exceptional and the pancakes are HUGE!! The other special that many people grab is the Big Guys Breakfast...9.95 and you get pretty much everything but he kitchen sink so bring your appetite if you are ordering this one. Great to get over that Saturday night hangover...like I had a few weekends ago. Kates is a great spot. Be aware on the weekends there is sometimes a wait because this place fills up and is on the small side. Staff is super cool and laid back even with the rush...which always makes for a more enjoyable adventure at Kates! 

As I type I am trying to figure out the next time I can swing by good old Kates!
author: Heidi S.

description:
I really like this spot. The service is good. Irene is marvelous and even remembers my name!  The food is tasty, like that one friend of yours who can really cook making you breakfast after you've been out all night drinking.  They have homemade strawberry jam and I enjoy it.    They have a good deal on breakfast before 10 am. 

On the weekends, it can be really packed, and forget about getting a group larger than 4 people in.  The cash only thing bugs me to no end as well.
author: Stephanie E.

description:
I don't know if there's a reason to come here other than the french toast orgy, but that's a pretty damn good reason. Kate's is a pretty good spot for brunch. Service is good, it's decently sized and it's not too expensive. Actually, I probably would have only given Kate's 3 stars because some of the stuff I had there wasn't that great, but the french toast orgy had to bump it up a star. 

Imagine this: You take a loaf of french bread, slice it up, turn it into french toast. Lay down a foundation of these french toast slices on a plate, pile on a huge load of fresh fruit, dump a whole glob of sweet and tart yogurt on top of that, cover the whole creation with a layer of granola, and then serve it with a side of maple syrup. That's your french toast orgy. It probably tastes better than it sounds. I think the best thing about it is that you end up eating a whole lot, but a lot of it was fruit and yogurt and granola, so you don't feel too heavy afterwards. Good stuff. I may have to head over here again soon.
author: Saunders C.

description:
If you're an aspiring nihilist, this place should meet all your expectations.

I'm not sure how the concept of corned beef hash became so bastardized in this town, but it's clearly one the city should discard as a whole.

First off, everything should be shredded, oversalted and dripping in grease.  I'm not talking about extra virgin coconut oil either.  I'm talking about shit that gave the cow your about to eat a heart attack.

Secondly, what the fuck are you thinking putting carrots in the corned beef?  I mean, seriously, what's your problem?  That's not funny.  That's not funny at all.  The only vegetable that should ever touch greasy-spoon food is onion.

Naturally, the service is slower than Christmas, the space is too small, and you get to wait in the street.

Oh, and it's cash only, so they can save that extra $10 in fees a day and make your life more adventurous.  On that note, just as I thought I wouldn't be taping balloons full of lighter fluid to the basement rafters, I went outside to find the ATM.  Getting money out of this thing is like a Google interview question.  Not the softballs by the first 7 guys...the weird one by the French PhD at the end.  Try it, you'll see.

Anyway, if you're 22 and dress like Joan Jett, you and your fellow clones will love it.
author: JJJJJ M.

description: This place is overrated.  The food is nothing extraordinary and way too overpriced.  They charge $2.00 for a burned piece of toast full of butter which I did not want  nor *need*.  The beet salad had at most 4 tiny pieces of beet that did not taste very fresh either and a few pieces of avocado.  The dressing was too much and then on top of the mixed green leafy greens tons of shredded cheese right out the bag!   Really??  I could have made something way more elaborate at home in less than 5 minutes and they charged me $8.95 for this???  Then the coffee was a bit too dark for my taste and the background music Beatles all f--- day long???? Seriously???   Oh, and the kicker ONLY cash!  never again, so but not thanks!!
author: Sebastian S.

description: You must try Kate's K before leaving SF. The best and authentic breakfast we have ever eat in our Wild West trip. Peace and eat.
author: YO L.

description:
The cheese, etc biscuts with gravy was delicious! A bit of a wait but worth it 100%!
Four stars for being sat after people whom came after us. Still very good.
author: Pete M.

description:
Yum, yum, yum!  I'd had this place bookmarked for a while but hadn't made it down there.  Didn't want to deal with the crowd.  Today, Christmas-Eve-Eve, we hit Kate's up around noon.

Only half-full (half-empty?), two nice servers, and attentive coffee refills.  Then comes the food.

We started with the hush puppies.  My first experience with any hush puppies but a great way to start!  Added the pooh-butter but still needed something.  Added a small sprinkle of salt and the flavors POPPED!  Sodium-Schmodium.  This was delish!

The boy ordered the Meat Omelette.  I had the Veggie Scramble with a side of bacon.  Both of us had our plates with biscuits.  He loved the biscuit--me, the bread lover, I wasn't as keen.  Loved the strawberry jam though!  His omelette was good but I don't think it was anything to write home about.  Good, don't get me wrong, but just not anything special.  

My veggie scramble was incredible!  Snap peas added some crunch and forest mushrooms added a flavor that a simple white mushroom just couldn't have.  Again, lacking a little in salt but that's why they put a shaker on the table!  Really, this scramble was a great change of pace.

Good, hot coffee.  Sweet, fresh orange juice.  Uncrowded day.  I can't wait to go again to try Bacon Cheddar Pancakes!
author: Melissa Q.

description:
About 7 groups ahead of us when we got there on a Saturday morning, but wait was short and food came out quick. Small place so it was a bit tricky to get to our table, but the food made up for it! Didn't try the juices, but looked delicious.  Overall, great experience.

Would recommend and would go back!
author: Shauna G.

description:
You certainly can't complain about the portions here - the pancakes were bigger than my head!  The cornmeal pancakes were OK, the bacon and sausage overcooked, the eggs so-so, and the potatoes average.

So basically if you need a place that "does the job" for breakfast, this does the trick.  But next time I'll just head around the corner to Squat & Gobble.
author: Corey C.

description:
Went at Friday, at 11am and sat down immediately, got the last table in the back.  Ordered the French Toast Orgy, orange spiced french toast of bagette bread (6 slices) covered with fresh fruit, yogurt, granola and honey, $8 and tons of food, I couldn't finish it.  Friends ordered the specials, an omelet with sausage and veggies and fruit on the side, in a good sized bowl, not a cup, $8 and the avocado scramble with veggies with fruit on the side, english muffin, $8, a pumpkin buttermilk cornmeal pancake and a lemonade spritzer for $33.  Everything was good, the pancake, phenomenal because it really tasted like pumpkin and was enough to split between the three of us.  

In a dicey part of town with aggressive homeless people asking for money.  I wouldn't walk alone.  Nice to have the Walgreens next door, saved my life when I needed to buy last minute lactose pills, so I could enjoy my breakfast!
author: Deb N.

description: 5 Stars for the cheddar and chive biscuits, but everything else is very mediocre.  My scramble needed salt and my friend's pancakes were almost sickeningly sweet.  The good news is that the prices are dirt cheap.
author: Sarah K.

description:
THEY DON'T USE ORGANIC EGGS BUT SAY THEIR FRENCH TOAST IS STILL ORGANIC!  This will make a lot of people sick and I don't think they understand why. It's like saying- I have TB and I spit in your food, but only on the left side. 

me: do you use organic eggs?
waitress: let me check.. (2 mins later). no, we don't. 
me: um... so your "organic french toast" listed on the board isn't organic.
waitress: the bread is organic. 
me: i'm allergic to antibiotics and non-organic eggs would send me to the hospital. 
waitress: i've never heard of that (walks away). 

snooty bitch. i'll never eat here again.

And the potatoes were bland too.
author: Heidi J.

description:
No complaints here!

Walk over, put your name on the list by the door, and get seated.

I got the corned beef hash with eggs over easy and a biscuit.  Oozy eggs over crispy potatoes and tender bits of corned beef? I am so totally there.

The BF got the NL West omelette, which was full of sausage, tomato, pesto, and other goodies.  And, of course, melty, gooey, delicious cheese!

We were both very happy with the food, which came quickly, and the service, which was friendly.  I'll definitely come back!
author: Cathy Y.

description: A favorite local spot we had to check out. I found the short stack to be good, the biscuits and gravy were not good and also hard, and the wait was long. They seated eight people after they arrived before us.
author: Courtney G.

description:
Heaven in my mouth, each and every time.

I've never had to wait, and the service is always shiny, happy people.

Really, I can't even single out anything to recommend, it's all so good!  But the honey butter is special indeed.  I want to slather myself with it, lick it off, rinse, and repeat.
author: Dmytro A.

description:
I wanted it to be great. The interior is so shabby. The staff is all dressed in their most comfy clothes. Someone painted a huge mural of the United States on the left wall, a reproduction of an oil painting that may have hung in your mother's 4th grade classroom. They have gravy in both vegan and sausage variety. 
But it was rotten. I could barely read the menu or the chalkboard with the specials scrawled on it. My scramble had high hopes and vast flaws. The gouda cheese hid behind the flavor of my undercooked eggs. I wish the veggies to egg ratio had been higher. I had to eat my sister's food, which was an egg / cheese / sausage sandwich -- the sort of meal that is good due to it's pure richness. 
I will grant Kate's Kitchen the clemency of their green onion and cheddar biscuits, but their savory flavor is not enough to make me come back, and even less to make me wait in line.
author: Netty L.

description:
Oh Kate's, you make me smile. Any place that can serve up corned beef hash the way Kate's does should be proud of itself.  The meat, my god, it's not your usual tiny cut from a tin can meat.  They have large chunks of beef, large chunks of potatoes, carrots and onions.  It really is SO good.  I had my hash with two sunny side up eggs on top and I loved it.  The runny yolk, the beef and poatoes, it was like heaven in my mouth.  

You would think that it would be crazy greasy and a huge gutbomb, but it wasn't at all.  In fact, after I ate I felt totally fine and not sick or overly full or anything.  That is a good test in my eyes, because so many breakfast spots I eat at make me feel ill and overly full.  

Definitely check this place out if you are in the neighborhood.  The pancakes looked amazing and I would have loved to try them if it wasn't for my gluten intolerance.  *sigh* 

Kate's was great.  I was in SF for 4 days and I ate there twice, that's saying something.  I would have given Kate's 5 stars if they served Mimosas.  ;)
author: Liz D.

description:
Are you a French Toast lover, that wants to spice things up a bit? Try their French Toast Orgy! Imagine French Toast topped with yogurt, fruit and granola. It's decadent and delicious.

Kate's is also extremely affordable and has a relaxed casual atmosphere. Get out of your breakfast rut and check out Kate's!
author: Lauren T.

description: Solid cheap eats.  Service was great considering the one server was covering the entire restaurant and she as hustling.  We went for a veggie scramble and breakfast wrap.  Both were satisfying but unremarkable.  I'd go again in a pinch but won't be out disappointed if I don't make it back.
author: Rich L.

description:
Kate's Kitchen has set the standard for me when it comes to corned beef hash.  I never even knew I liked corned beef very much before Kate's.  I love that they serve you nice big meaty hunks.  It is simply divine.  I keep ordering corned beef hash at other breakfast joints and they are ok but they pale in comparison.  

To be fair, maybe the corned beef at Kat'es can't even be considered "hash" because it lacks that mushed up consistency of most.  Who knows, I'm no expert on what is right or traditional.  What I do know, is that the stuff at Kate's rocks!  It is not overly salty the way so many corned beef hash dishes taste.  I used to live nearby and now I wish I'd gone more often when it was within walking distance!

I've also ordered several scrambles here with eggs, potatoes and a variety of meats and veggies.  They have always been top notch as well with creative ingredients.  I have not tried the pancakes but I have no doubt they are tasty too.  

I love the dining experience here.  It is bustling and busy and full of the smells of good food.  Kate's achieves some dynamic and amazing hybrid between the feel of a local greasy spoon and organic health food joint.
author: Laura B.

description: Super super delicious! Not only was it really cute and cozy in there but the menu was priced very well for what you get. I ordered off the specials (white board at the back of the restaurant). It was their cornmeal buttermilk pancakes with a fresh strawberry banana and lemon curd topping. It was absolutely fantastic!not only that but it was only 7 dollars! Can't beat that. I will be back
author: Sammie W.

description:
So, I really enjoy biscuits.  I don't know why.  I just do. 

When we were looking for some place to brunch on New Year's Day, Kate's caught my eye because someone said they had biscuits.  With friends from out of town, Kate's it was.  

Showed up at around 11:00 on that first day of the year, and the place was mostly full.  Had the corned beef hash and eggs con biscuit.  Although they claimed that the hash would be the best in SF (as most brunching places do -- including those outside of SF), it was disappointing.  Just didn't have any kick to it.  Plain.  Just down right plain.  

The biscuit?  Plain.  

Eggs?  Plain.

The service, as other folks report, has much to be desired.  Given that one of the windows was open and it was cold inside, it would have been nice to have our teas "refreshed."  It wasn't meant to be.  Also, at the end of the meal, we didn't receive a check: the waiter just told us how much it would be.  Although I was cool with that, it raised the ire of one in our party, who requested to see the check.  

Oh, Kate.  Wish you were great.  Next time, I won't take the bait.
author: Marc P.

description: Fantastic! Excellent gluten-free options and we loved the pumpkin cornmeal pancakes!
author: Megan R.

description:
Meh.  I've had better, much better.  My gf and I go out for breakfast a lot.  I mean, we really like it.  It's one of our favorite meals to go out for.  We're still decently new to SF, and pick where we go based on yelp reviews quite a bit.  If you google 'best breakfast sf' there are a few spots that consistently pop up, and Kate's is one of them.  I'm not sure why.

Our service was effective, but not necessarily friendly (or unfriendly for that matter) or attentive; just effective.  The food was definitely nothing to write home about.  My gf's veggie scramble was fine, but frankly I make better at home.  It was late morning, and I went with lunch food; red beans and rice.  What a mistake!  I grew up in south Louisiana in the heart of cajun country and make killer red beans.  I really don't know what I was thinking, but these were sub-par and almost flavorless.  Actually, now that I think about it, they were actually pretty terrible.  Their biscuits were not good either; dry.

Maybe we ordered the wrong things.  Maybe those who've rated this place highly work there or simply don't know good food.  I don't know, but I highly doubt I'll be back to find out.
author: Joshua B.

description:
We went to Kate's last Saturday for brunch. I was more in the mood for lunch fare so I ordered the self-proclaimed "fancy grilled cheese," which was fancy, I believe, because of the tomatoes in it. Or the pesto. I'm not sure which is fancier. It was good nonetheless, and it was served at the non-fancy price of $6.50.

My boyfriend ordered banana pancakes with walnuts, one of the many cornmeal pancake specials for the day. I didn't try them, but they looked delicious and he was happy. My other friend ordered a meat omelette that looked gross to me, but only because I don't eat sausage or bacon. Come to think of it, I didn't ask him whether he liked or not, but he had been to Kate's many times before and ordered the same thing, so I'm gonna put him down for a "Yay! I'm a fan" vote.
author: Adam B.

description: A normal breakfast place in San Francisco!  Sometimes you just want eggs, bacon and pancakes without all the fusion ingredients (seaweed pancakes, aioli biscuits, etc.).  That stuff is great but good ole breakfast food is nice as well. Service was awesome. Hard to get in during the weekends I've noticed so I went on a weekday.   The cornmeal buttermilk pancakes were awesome.
author: Kris W.

description: Was just ok. The under staffed crew had too much attitude. It was a little akward being around servers who look like they hate their job
author: Mr. M.

description:
Having eaten at Kate's Kitchen twice now, I'm definitely a fan, and will be coming back. While weekend brunch may be a bit hectic, showing up at or around 10 (which isn't that hard, really), guarantees a short wait time for a small party. 

During my first visit, I had the big guy breakfast, and fancying myself a larger-than-average-human-male, I was nearly bested by the enormous pancakes, the pile of eggs, home fries and a role that came to my table. If I didn't eat fast, I would have left with a doggie bag.

This morning I had the corned beef hash, which may very well be the best this city has to offer. While everyone claims that their X is the best in town, I will vouch for Kate's hash as the new standard bearer for this particular dish.

Food is affordable, servers are attentive, kind (dare I say stylish), and they keep your mug full of hot coffee.
author: Chikodi C.

description:
Two Hunks in a Truck moving company loves this place!! 5 stars because we can EAT!! 

Menu:
basic, easy to choose, fun to read. "French TOast Orgy!"  that's just fun to say and think about...it looked amazing and i wanted it (all over my body... i mean plate) 

Atmosphere: can be loud, busy, very open so get to know your neighbors.  

Service: fast, we had a nice server, quick with the grub.

Portions:  phat! hardy! i was overwhelmed at first. 

my order: 
shared Cornmeal Buttermilk Pancake (blueberry) they are huggeee. 
shared Grits- my first and not my last of this ghetto booty food. jk
Farmer's Bfast w/ fruit instead of potatters!

you'll look around and see that a majority of people dont finish their plates.  im not one to waste food...and maybe it's my high metabolism from the moving company that helps me finish everything.  we even stole some untouched biscuits from the table over.  so full, so satisfied.

5 starts for good food, big portions for small price, fast service.
i feel this place is more of a 4 to 4.5 star restaurant and i want to help them get there.
author: Zach S.

description:
This is one of our favorite brunch/breakfast places in the area.  Cheap, great food and easy-going atmosphere.  For the price... can't be beat.

This time, we shared their meat omelet special, which was delicious and filled with all sorts of great veggies as well as a fantastic homemade sausage, and their pumpkin chocolate chip french toast.  That second dish blew my mind.  SO freaking delicious.

Only note... I wish they had put the honey butter on the side for the french toast.  By the time I had gotten to the french toast, the butter had melted all over the toasts and made them all soggy.  Don't get me wrong, it tasted great, but it sure made everything heavy!

Good coffee, too!
author: Evren O.

description:
I like this place for breakfast. It's nothing out of the ordinary but they do serve real maple syrup and have some yummy homemade jams to serve up with toast. My favorite was the kiwi.

Today I had the meat omelet which was done just right. Served with potatoes that were a little under seasoned. Also ordered an orange juice and was happy that it came out in a big glass, not one of those puny ones like most diners. 

It's a casual place that serves up the standard diner breakfast fare but with a homey kind of feel. I like it.
author: Foodie F.

description: This place has gone downhill. The hush puppies used to taste better. The order was supposed to include 6 and for some reason they brought out 4, then came back with 2 more saying they forgot to include 2. Egg special was so-so. Edible but not much more. Pumpkin pancakes had no discernable pancake flavor that we had to ask if we got sent the right pancakes. Overall, not worth the wait.
author: Joyce K.

description:
The pancakes here are a MUST!  Don't forget to ask your server for the fruit preserves that come on the side.  They're homemade and taste DIVINE!  My favorite is the blueberry, but the preserves also come in strawberry, peach, apricot, and some spicy (jalepeno?) flavor that was actually kind of gross.  

The pancakes themselves come in very unique flavors, and the menu changes fairly often.  Kind of pricey at around $8-$9 for two specialty pancakes, but they're decently sized.  

I also tried the hush puppies and was not impressed.  They tasted of old canola/corn oil.  Our entire table shared an order of hush puppies, and no one went back for seconds.  Stick with the pancakes.

Oh, and remember this place is CASH ONLY.
author: Christine K.

description:
I really like Kate's.  It's cozy, the food is made with care and the portions are immense.  I dig the amount of fruit them put atop brunchy things, like pancakes.  Seldom am I delighted by lots of fruit, I guess I'm finding alot of brekkie places that cut up a single strawberry and a few piece of banana and call it good.  

The french toast is delicious, but I strongly recommend setting aside the menu until after you've read through all of the daily specials on the chalkboard.  Else, you might miss something like pumpkin-chocolate-whipped cream zomg so delicious :)

I don't prefer cornmeal pancakes, the texture and taste is kinda weird to me but the lemon curd and fruit made it good.  Just a heads up for anyone who wonders why the pancakes taste different.  

Skip the beneigh/hush puppies unless you truly are a fan of cornmeal.  

The coffee. *cough* Eeeee!   Okay! I get that Kate's has a unique and locally-roasted brand, something very different.  It sets them apart from the norm, they're proud of it.  I'm occasionally okay with chicory but most mornings I'd rather not and they do not have an alternative to their alternative chicory-coffee blend. 

Has anyone fully deciphered the 1337 speak sentences painted on the wall?  I'm missing the first few bits.
author: Ben S.

description: Everything about this place is great. The food is incredible, the menu is unbelieveable and the waitstaff is all fantastic. Don't miss out on this place!
author: Carly K.

description:
Quality: 3/6
Service: 4/5
Value: 2/4
Total: 9/15 = 3/5

The atmosphere was nice, and the staff was friendly, but it was overpriced and not as good as I had hoped.  We tried Kate's Kitchen for brunch.  The Biscuits & Gravy was too thick and mushroomy, and it didn't come with any sides (I ordered a side of potatoes which was the best part of the meal).
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Kate's Kitchen is a good brunch spot.  In any other city, it would be a 4 or 5 star in almost any other city, but in SF it's good, just not great.  I've been a few times, as a friend of mine used to live right around the corner, but not in a while.  Every item I've had there has been good, but never anything that's made me say "Damn, I need to come back here soon and often."  However, it is a great alternative if you don't want to deal with the long lines at either Pork Store Cafe or Dottie's (my two favorites and well worth the wait at either).

On that note, best thing I had there was a special corned beef hash.  It was very good, and not from a can, something I appreciate for sure.  I saw another review that said they didn't like the big chunks of meat, but that was precisely what I enjoyed most about it.

One more time, I will reiterate that Kate's is a good, serviceable brunch place in the grand scheme of SF, but not really a run out of the way to go there kind of place for me.
author: Ben N.

description:
So I have been living in Upper Haight for years now and only now happened upon this gem of an establishment this past weekend. From the fresh menu selection that changes weekly to the amazing wait staff, I was thoroughly satisfied with my experience. If you ever do do to Kate's, you want to have Caitlin as your server. She  has the entire menu memorized with great comments and opinions, which is perfect if it is your first time and you are having trouble deciding on what to order. Though I didn't order them, Caitlin seemed to be a BIG fan of the hush puppy's...maybe next time

I had the hash and eggs, it was nothing at all like the traditional hash one would expect, more like the ingredients of a beef stew cooked like corned beef hash...that's the best I can do to describe it. 

Overal, a wonderful experience and a new breakfast destination if I ever find myself in the Lower Haight.
author: Shaun L.

description:
I've been to Kate's kitchen twice.  One was on a super crowded weekend morning, the other was during the week.

Both times I've been extremely underwhelmed.  I thought the food was overpriced and rather mediocre.  I had the corned beef hash, and didn't particularly like it. 

What really got me was the service however.

My wife ordered the pancakes.  When they showed up they were covered with powdered sugar.  She doesn't particularly like powdered sugar and was surprised because the menu seemed oddly specific calling out both the butter and the maple syrup which also came with and on the pancakes. 

When she asked for them with no sugar, she was told that she should have ordered them without sugar.
