When she pointed out that the menu said nothing about smothering the pancakes with powdered sugar she was told 'people who eat pancakes know they are covered with powdered sugar.'  Now folks, I've eaten pancakes my whole life, and with rare exception, they've been sugar free.

When the new pancakes arrived, they were thick, heavy and tasteless.

No thanks to Kate's kitchen.

(For actual amazing pancakes, try Al's Cafe in Bernal).
author: Bob R.

description:
Went for a late breakfast on a weekday.  Got:
- Biscuits w/ vegetarian gravy was a really good starter
- French Toast w/ bananas and strawberries was great, and not too sweet like most other french toast
- The homemade lemonade spritzer is really fresh and crisp

Overall, a good staple breakfast place to go back to
author: Hardik C.

description: Delicious brunch. Reasonable priced, good service, cozy atmosphere. Just be sure to get there before 11am on the weekends, otherwise you'll be on line out the door.
author: Greg S.

description:
this place makes me sad that it isn't closer to where i live or work...just one of life's cruelties, the savory crispy homefries, the oozy yolky eggy goodness in their sandwiches, real chunky corned beef hash, the mound of french toast orgy temptation is making me all hot and bothered as i think of it now. 

the lines can be long, and the seating tight...but well worth it if you aren't on a diet. otherwise, if you are on a diet...go find yourself a celery stick.
author: Phuoc K.

description: I really liked the food, I just wish they served regular soda!
author: Ryan S.

description:
We had the french toast orgy and hash plate.  Both were pretty much perfect.  Coffee was excellent and arrived quickly.  Our server was speedy and generous with his lovely smile.   I was hungover and megatime hungry. I left refreshed and satisfied.  Man I'm having good breakfast luck lately!

Edit: the jalapeno relish is amazing.
author: Sarah S.

description:
This was the first place I heard that I had to try in SF.

The food was good, but I I think I was expecting more waffle house style food (more butter, grease and less teeth).   I did my best to finish off pancakes, eggs biscuit and coffee and didn't come anywhere close to finishing.  The portions were crazy!  But I guess if you walk and bike everywhere you can eat a huge breakfast.

I like the staff and the diversity of people in the place...I could have used a bit more elbow room but the people didn't look like they might injury me if I accidentally bumped them, which I'm sure I did.
author: Targi B.

description:
There's always a line, but it's not anything spectacular. I think there are just a lack of breakfast places in lower haight.  Ate here twice, once I went right when the place opened on a weekend so no line, however, the staff were eating first and made us wait outside for 15min after the place was supposed to open. This would have never happened on the East Coast lol. Got the regular breakfast, it was average.  Second time wait for at least 30 min on Sunday around 11am, got the corned beef hash, it was a little better than average.  Also tried the cornmeal pancakes and green onion scones, those were okay as well.

Again, not worth the wait. If you want to wait, go to Just for You or Boogaloos.
author: Skye W.

description:
I came here for lunch and had the Spicy Chicken Sammy. The bread was dry, and the sandwich wasn't the least bit spicy. I also didn't expect the chicken to be cold, but I think I misinterpreted 'herb-roasted' to mean recently roasted in herbs. They're also cash only.

The service was nice though, and the orange juice was fresh.
author: Vishay N.

description:
Another one that I wish I could give 2.5 stars instead of 3.  The majority of this review is my fault as I was lame and trying to be healthy, so I ordered a salad.  Blah Blah. Salad was OK.  I ordered it with chicken and the chicken was thin, dry, and not delicious.  The salad itself was good and fresh, but the chicken was pretty poorly cooked and presented.  My man ordered eggs and potatoes.  I definitely ate half the order of his potatoes (which were just ok, lacking a lot of salt) and his eggs looked ok. He's pretty boring when it comes to food variety (hahahaha, j/k) so I didn't try the boring scrambled eggs. 

The service was great and there was no wait (which I hear there's almost always a wait), but we also didn't arrive til 1 or after. Nice, relaxed atmosphere, with some cool art too. CASH ONLY.
author: Jenny W.

description:
4.25 Stars!

Blueberry cornmeal pancakes...So. On. Point.
author: Eryn K.

description: well considering the price it is not the best place.   choices are ordinary, and nothing special to notice.  service is fast and good tho.
author: Shuting Z.

description:
Breakfast, the most sturdy of meals to start off a good day. My friend was in town and we stumbled across Kate's Kitchen due to the idea of having Hush Puppies in the morning. She completely sold on the idea, me feeling a little nervous for my aching stomach. My tastebuds require copious amounts of coffee in the morning and very little else but we decided to give a few things ago.

This is not a tapas bar but we ordered like one. For the food:

Hush Puppies
*Small fritters fried just right, not burned and served with whipped honey butter. I would have like plain honey minus the butter but they were still a sweet surprise.

Corned Beef Hash
*Carrots, there are carrots with the big chunks of corned beef and potatoes. An egg served medium was placed atop everything and oozed its yolk goodness into it.

Orange Spiced French Toast w/fruit, yogurt and granola
*I do believe that my 4th quandrant of my stomach opened up with eating a few pieces of this. I'm not sure if it was plain or vanilla yogurt but there was a slight bitter taste to the dish. A little fresh honey would have done it just right!

I liked this cozy little quick brefassis place in lower haight and may go back if in a hugely hungover stupor! Their servings were too big for my mini stomach : ( Prices were dirt cheap considering all of the food you're getting and the decor is fun with a huge map of the country on a side wall.
author: Morgan M.

description:
I've visited Kate's a few times for brekkie recently, and I love it. It's sparesly decorated inside, but cute. You can't go wrong with the cornmeal or oatmeal pancakes with fruit. The specials on the chalkboard are great too. Good coffee. The waiters are friendly and the owner was a cool dude. 

The space is a little tight, and the wait can be annoying, but a walk in that area is always an interesting experience. You may need to find an ATM, because it's cash only.
author: Joy P.

description: This place is awesome. Ya the wait is a bit long, but it goes fast. They only take cash. It is the best breakfast place I have ever eaten at in the City! Get the French Toast Orgy or one of their seasonal omelets.
author: Jason M.

description: This is a soild breakfast place. Yes, it's a greasy spoon, but in the old-school Mel's diner type of way. Their food is great for hangovers (not that I would know), with large portions that fill you up. Three solid stars, which could be four if there wasn't always such a wait...
author: Danielle L.

description: This perrennial favorite of mine for a weekend brunch has a cool staff, good food and great prices. I love the North America map on the wall with "what grows where". The oatmeal pancakes are always good, but nothing beats the fruit & granola orgy or the french toast orgy in terms of taste+price value. The crowd is always interesting and the location is very central to start a fun-filled day around town.
author: Parin K.

description:
Going out to breakfast on the weekends is the best, especially if there's no wait time.  Get to Kate's before 10:30 and you shouldn't have a problem.  Otherwise, the brunch crowd starts up and you'll be poking around the Walgreen's next door for an hour until they finally call your group.

I don't drink coffee, but my breakfast buddy claims that Kate's has the best house drip in the city.  Their fresh-squeezed orange juice is excellent as well.  

Though Kate's is super popular, I feel like the food is just okay.  Breakfast buddy would kill me if he knew I just wrote that, but it's true.  As far as breakfast goes, everything's pretty standard, meaning it's good, but I'm not  screaming from the mountaintops about it.  I do give them a nod for serving crispy bacon rather than grisly strips of fat.  That I like.  The grilled cheese sandwich with tomato and basil is definitely underwhelming.  I order it a lot anyway because it tastes just as good as anything else at Kate's:  just okay.

Make sure you stop by the ATM on the way over because Kate's is a cash-only joint.  I learned this the hard way the first time I came here with breakfast buddy, who conveniently had forgotten his wallet at home.  And the next two times after that.  Shady.
author: Christy J.

description: This is a looong overdue review.  So, breaky food is one of my favorites and they do it right here.  I had the eggs, potatoes and toast and I can taste the flavor of good ol fashion american breakfast food.  Big portions and all the fixings you need.  This was a one time shot for me, so if you're in this part of the city and want grubbing AM food, you will be happy here.
author: Desiree G.

description:
Kate's Kitchen came highly recommended from a few friends of the SF breakfast circuit. Kate's was described as having one of the "best" breakfasts in the city. Well, after making my way over to Kate's I can agree. She really is "one" of the best... *ahem* one of a hundred best breakfasts in the city. Too bad it's not in the middle to upper echelon.   

There is no pretense upon arriving at Kate's. It's sort of a hole in the wall grease spoon breakfast house. A few tables, a few chairs, a few servers. Nothing fancy and nothing exciting. 

I ordered the "meat omelette" which consisted of bay shrimp, onion, garlic, tomato, and spinach. On the side came potatoes and toast. The omelette arrived and appeared unappetizing due to its rather large oil slick that puddled in the lower side of the plate. Either Kate's last name is Gilroy or she is deathly afraid of vampires because the garlic in this omelette was so overwhelming it usurped any and all flavor from the other ingredients. Furthermore, the shrimp were tiny and scarce and the potatoes were burnt and cancerous. When the entrees title says "meat" omelette and contains bay shrimp in quantities you'd think came from a "bathtub sized" bay I call bs. 

The French Toast Orgy aptly named for it's cornicopia of flavors and messy chaotic appearance was nothing amazing. It's a typical French Toast but topped with granola and yogurt *yawn*. This French Toast should be called the cialis infused "swingers over 80" French Toast because it was dated and stale. If only Kate's pepped it up a bit with thick slices of egg battered cinnamon whole wheat toast, coated in macadamia and hazelnuts, topped with enough fresh fruit to sell on a street corner, blanketed with vanilla Tahitian butter, and accompanied with nutella and coconut maple syrup dipping sauces... only then would it be a true Orgy of greatness.

In summary, the food lacked flavor, variety, and quality. If it was 3am and I was drunk without any concept of money or a palate then sure Kate's would be a great spot, otherwise try something much better like... Brenda's, Mama's, Dottie's, Crepevine, etc....
author: Rhett S.

description:
This is the first place where I tasted cornmeal pancakes. They are great!!!
Kate's also has an ever changing menu of breakfast plates that you can't help but be adventurous to try.  The french toast is the BOMB!!!
And, they have great freshly made sausage.
author: lashawnte b.

description:
Chose a different place if you want your breakfast/brunch to be relaxing.

I met up with two girlfriends who I hadn't seen in awhile.  We all ordered food, which was good, and coffee, which was passable.  We took our time eating, and were enjoying our chat when we were kicked out by the manager.  (We hadn't been there more than an hour).  I understand that the place was busy, but that was just poor customer service.  The manager's behavior could have been much more gracious.  Furthermore, I heard the manager scream at the waitress not to come over to our table so that we would leave faster.        

There are too many other good breakfast and brunch places in the city to have to put up with this one.
author: Amelia B.

description:
Went here for brunch this wknd after seeing the crazy awesome reviews for their French toast orgy. So you can guess what I got :) My friend got the vegetable scramble which was excellent. My FTO was def good but WAY too much food. I stuffed myself trying to finish half of it, and the kid at a table next to me ended up taking his home. (I wouldn't really recommend that seeing as granola really doesn't keep well once mixed with honey and yogurt, but maybe that's just me). The stand out was their coffee - chickoree blend that made me think of camping so strongly my friend and I made plans to ge next week. 
Ending review: Go. Now. Enjoy.
author: Robyn P.

description: Great live music on Friday night. Friendly cook and waiter. Immediate service. Aptly named comfort food. Sensible prices. Lovely decor. Will be back soon.
author: mark s.

description:
My friend and I went on a Sunday a little before noon.  We had to wait around fifteen or twenty minutes- not bad for standard Sunday brunch time!  He got the French toast orgy ($8.50) and I wound up getting their "meat" omelet with chicken mango sausage (amazing!) and a bunch of veggies.  My omelet also came with toast and potatoes, not bad for $8.50!  Fred's French toast was insane looking- it had fresh fruit, yogurt, and granola on top with actual maple syrup.  

The place is super cute and small.  It's cash only, so make sure to be prepared.  It's definitely a great deal for the amount of food you get!  I'd recommend it, but make sure it's not raining so you don't have to wait in the rain to get in! :D
author: Cersei T.

description: It had been a while since I had been to Kate's, but the biscuits and gravy still rock!  Also, I had forgotten how super cheap this place is.  I'm re-in love.  Only downside...cash only.  I'm not in love with that.  You're 5th star is just 1 Visa merchant account away, Kate.
author: Luke M.

description:
Medicore everything. The food is hit or miss with some dishes are fantastic and other are really lackluster. The Meat Scramble special was particularly mushy, but the french toast is great. Crispy and delicious. The hush puppies were so dry and mealy I had to drench them in the delicious pooh butter to get them down.

The service is equally crap shooty. There are some great staff here and the food is prepared quickly, which is nice. But the other day I was told by the make-shift host that my party of 2 could not have the open window seat as it is reserved for parties of three. And not more than 5 minutes later, that same host sat a party of 2 at that very table. Clearly not an oversight or mistake as only a few minutes had passed, and while I'm sure there's a rational explanation for the obvious double standard, it still left a very bad taste in my mouth.

Will I go here again? I doubt it. I've been 3 times, each instance telling myself to give them another shot, but I've done my due diligence and Kate's Kitchen has come up short.
author: Jarrod B.

description:
Oh No You Didn't ...just order: 
 
-Hush Puppies 
-Side of grits
-Buttermilk Pancakes
-Coffee to wash it all down

Oh yes I did...guuuurlfrien'!

Kate's is one of the better brunch, greasy spoons, featuring a wall of specials, cozy seating and a Southern fusion breakfast menu. Portions are on the Incredible Hulk side, so order more w/ head, less with stomach and eyes, unless you've been trapped on an Island for the last five years of your life,  with a lipstick wearing, pet volleyball you've named Wilson. 

Warning: Lines on weekends are huge, so get in early, or put your name in and get coffee at one of the three area cafes.
author: Johnny C.

description:
NOM NOM NOM!

So, it is early and on our way to Mavericks in Half Moon Bay, but food was required or the fainting would begin.  As my friends are a bit picky, we needed a variety of food, inexpensive and MANY options for the ever beloved pancake.

As the competition was at 8am we decided to try out Kate's Kitchen as it is near where I live, but have not yet tried it.  I have seen it many times on my way to other places and yet never had the opportunity.  What I had noticed was that on weekends there was a line out the door which, as you know, is a good thing when it comes to restaurants.

Anyway, here is the breakdown:
Cost: under $13 per person
Decor: cozy in a trailer park kind of way
Service: Prompt and memorable
Coffee: typical, but good
Pancakes: LOTS!

Ok, let's get on to the pancakes, shall we?

Menus are provided, but the more tasty breakfast treats are listed on a chalkboard.  It is a bit hard to read, but it ensures you know what you are ordering.  Most of the listings are the pancake options which are wheat, corn meal and oatmeal.  As for toppings, you can have banana with almonds, fresh fruit, Nutella and a few other I can quite remember.

We selected corn meal pancakes ($5) with no toppings and oatmeal topped with banana, almonds and light powdered sugar($7).
I know many of you are looking to cut back on white flower so I ordered corn meal pancakes which are smokey, firm and without the usual guilt.  I refrained from toppings, but was quite happy with the syrup since it came separately and help me not over do it and drown my cakes.  I guess you can say I am watching my non-girl like figure. 

Moving on to the oatmeal pancakes, I have to say I was VERY impressed.  They were filling, smooth and really had a great flavor.  I would have to say that I will be ordering oatmeal pancakes from now one or at least when available.  The toppings were impressive as they did not skimp on the bananas or the almonds.

So, in summary I will be going to Kate's Kitchen more often and will have to try a the biscuits and omelets as they looked quite tasty.
author: Jai D.

description:
Oh Kate's how I miss you! I was a regular back when I lived in SF and now when I visit, we make sure to have at least one breakfast at Kate's. 
Hush Puppies are the best ever. Pancakes portions are super generous - i.e. you won't finish them.
Sad to say that I've yet to come across a place that can match the food and the vibe here in NYC... 
I will now go and dream about Hush Puppies. Sigh...
author: Bo M.

description: I should give this place another try. My Mindy Special was swimming in oil. The service was great despite the screw up in my table.  They corrected something that was clearly their mistake.
author: Demanding T.

description: Waited 30 minutes.  Portions were large but I've had better breakfasts elsewhere.  Eggs were rubbery, corned beef hash was too salty, tables were unpleasantly sticky.
author: happy t.

description:
I went for a hangover breakfast this morning with my significant other, and we were in a "still drunk" happy go lucky state of mind. Needless to say, even though this place is cute and has decent food, our service was TERRIBLE! The woman who serves during brunch hours on Tuesdays needs to get a job doing something other than customer service- she was very unhelpful, and rude, and seemed to be more interested in reading the paper at the table behind us than actually serve us. I literally thought that I was imposing by walking in and asking for breakfast. 

I mean c'mon, we were the easiest table to deal with- two people, 2 coffees 2 juices and 2 breakfast dishes, put it on the table within a reasonable amount of time and boom! You get a 20% tip.

However, our eggs were not even lukewarm but cold, like they had been sitting out for at least 15 minutes on their own before they made it to our table. I would have been okay with that (I'll eat almost anything) but when I politely asked if I could exchange a dollar for some change to feed the meter outside, she told me she had no change. No quarters, nickels or dimes, even though the place is cash only.

By the way, there is an atm right outside close to the cafe, but  don't expect her to go out of her way to tell you where the nearest one is if you happen to be out of cash and didn't notice it on the way in. Just overall, super poor service.

If only I paid with all nickels and dimes, then maybe she would have change in the future to exchange with one of her customers.
author: Savannah L.

description:
Had the special oatmeal pancakes with bananas and almonds. Fiance had the corned beef hash. They were both scrum-diddily-umptious, but fiance didn't like the bitter parsnips in the hash. 

Went during the week and we didn't get the big lines and big crowds. Waiter was friendly even though he was pretty busy on his own. 

Kinda liked the chicory-infused coffee. It was very toasty and delish.
author: Stan R.

description: I'm disappointed that the food looked better in the pictures than in actuality. I would have given this place 3 stars but it lacked the service to bulster its ratings. We walked in and stood there for a few minutes, no one gave us eye contact or said hello, so we figured we should just pick any table. They were slow to acknowledge us, had to ask for water refills, and had to walk the check to them since they weren't coming to get. The food is okay and very reasonably priced for SF, but I guess having a cheap meal means you don't get a nice eating-out experience too, the service was greatly lacking warmth and attentiveness. There are much better places for brunch, and I recommend elsewhere.  Try Straw instead.
author: Jenn S.

description:
Honestly, five stars.

Cornmeal banana walnut pancakes. Real corned beef & hashbrowns with fresh wheat toast (buttered), and two scrambled eggs.

Across the table from me was a farmer's breakfast, and a tart orange juice. 

The service was perfect, and everything was fresh. You know you really like a place when you are discussing what you are gonna order next time you come in.

Spent less than $15 a person, and had a quick, yet fulfilling Saturday morning breakfast.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Cheap for a reason, it is crappy food. I walked in starving, took a few bites and lost all appetite. The pancakes tastes more like corn bread, the potatoes on my friends dish were burnt and so where their eggs. Nothing really stood out as good, well maybe the fresh squeezed OJ but that's always good if fresh. Their homemade Ginger Ale was AWFUL!

Ambiance is plain, cramped but fine for the lower haight crowd... Cash only really cheap. Spend $2-$4 bucks more and get a real good meal.
author: Natasha M.

description: The five stars is for the veggie biscuits and gravy and the hash!! Both amazing!
author: Neil W.

description: Been here twice and that may be the end of it.  Both times the food has been decent but the service extremely unfriendly.  They will made no substitutions on most plates and then tell you that "I only work here" as their excuse for not wanting to do anything for you. Thanks unpretty and unhappy girl servers.
author: Chad S.

description: Found this gem by accident the other day and am floored. If you're looking for a casual brunch place for some good ol' eggs and hash browns, you've found it. The restaurant offers true comfort food minus the grease and cheap ingredients (like romaine lettuce and overripe tomato). The Farney Garney breakfast sandwich was perfection and the home fries were also delicious. I highly recommend!
author: Bianca F.

description:
A fun, casual, homey environment.  I was able to get a table right away on a Saturday afternoon.  My BLT was great. The hush puppies were pretty disgusting, practically favorless and loaded with grease, but a necessary excuse to eat that delicious honey butter.  When my dining companion bit into his egg sandwich, egg spilled all over him and the table.  Speaking of tables, seating is cramped, so be prepared to learn more about the strangers next to you than you ever wanted.  Similarly, don't come expecting to have an intimate gossip-filled discussion - you will be judged!

The best part of my trip to Kate's was the service.  A cute, bubbly waitress with excellent hand writing (hey- it makes a difference when the check comes!) brought me everything I asked for with an award-winning smile.  Kept me smilin' all day.
author: Kate J.

description: I heard this place mentioned a few times on the Haighteration blog, so thought I'd check it out. It looks a little dingy from the outside, but it is nice inside. Make sure to check the specials board! My veggie scramble was delicious, and I especially enjoyed the biscuit. The pomegranate mimosa was good as well. Service was friendly. Warning: They only take cash.
author: Marissa S.

description: So bummed on this place. The first time we ordered from here and picked it up, they forgot to put about half of the order that we paid for in the bag, everything was over cooked or undercooked and when we called to let them know they said to tell them the next time we went and they would take care of it. Today we decided to give them another chance and we went to pick up the food and we explained the situation from last time yet they said they couldn't do anything about it.... So we paid the 28$ for the Texas home fries, egg sandwich and side of fruit. The fruit was moldy and old and disintegrating. Completely inedible. The Texas home fries is supposed to be potatoes with bacon and cheese and salsa and sour cream. It only came with the potatoes and cheese. I asked for a side of avocado and they literally put 1/10th of an avocado on there. I'm sure they charged about 2$. The bread in the egg sandwich is stale, crumbling and inedible so basically we paid 30$ for a bunch of old food we can't even eat. My boyfriends the least picky person in the world and he won't even eat it. Probably not guna try this place for a third time.
author: Laura S.

description: Oh Kate's, I wanted to like you so much more than I did. I'm always down for Sunday brunch and Kate's had all the makings of a winner. The inside is pretty cramped with tables and chairs everywhere but it's decorated nicely with some fun writing on the walls that distracted us while we waited for our food. I got an egg and cheese sandwich that was just kind of alright. It came on a bun that was too big and dry to put just cheese and eggs on. It needs some sort of sauce or a thinner bun. My girlfriend got some vegetarian biscuits and gravy that weren't that great. Nothing was super offensive, but it just wasn't that good. I probably should have gotten the french toast or the hash that I hear about, but I feel like a good brunch place should be able to nail an egg and cheese sandwich.
author: Jeremy J.

description: I love this place!  Even the oatmeal is delicious!!  But, yes, the cornmeal pancakes and french toast are worth the resultant discomfort of fullness and lethargy.  Love the ambiance and wait staff, too.
author: Audrey D.

description:
Whoa, what happened here?  With all the Zagat stickers in the window and stuff, you'd think this would be an amazing place to eat.  But that's not what my friend and I found out.  

The potatoes I had were served lukewarm in a bland ketchup-like sauce; a bit overcooked too, so it was nice and mushy.  You can't get much worse that that.  Same goes for the eggs I had... pretty unexciting and lukewarm.  The biscuit actually wasn't bad, but again, it should have been served hot.  My friend had a sandwich with coleslaw which I tasted and wished I hadn't.  He did warn me first, so maybe I should have listened.  You, dear reader, have no excuse, though.  Consider yourself warned.
author: Ryan L.

description:
I'll tell you what I liked and what I didn't like.  First of all came here with Grace, Slash, and Devon and we split a stack of 4 cornmeal buttermilk pancakes.  

The pancakes here all start with the same batter and then they top it off with fruit or mix stuff in with them.  We decided on having 2 pumpkin pancakes and 2 bacon and cheddar.. yes that's right, bacon and cheddar mixed right into the batter then topped with more cheese. They look amazing when they come out.. but I'm still not too sure how I feel about them.  I love plain old pancakes and maple syrup.  No fancy cornmeal or whole wheat stuff or fruit toppings.  Just gimme the flapjacks.  So if you're like me and that's what you want when you order a plate of pancakes then this probably isn't for you.  

Instead, if you think of it as a flat, circular piece of cornbread, then you might get a kick out of them.  Surprisingly they still go really well with the maple syrup.  The same goes for the pumpkin pancakes.  Just think of it as a warm, flat pumpkin spice bread and you'll be in love.  

Just don't think of them as pancakes.  

Also the green onion and cheese biscuits weren't mind-blowing.  Biscuits should be crisp and flaky, but these were more dense and doughy.  Also the sausage gravy was a little bland.  

On to the good stuff: the corned beef hash is incredible.  You won't find this in any Hormel can.  This is REAL chunks of crispy corned beef, mixed with red-skinned potatoes, carrots, and celery, topped with eggs any style.  So good.  The french toast is made with thick slices of french bread and is also superb.  

I saw someone order the french toast orgy and it was ridiculous.. just a huge pile of french toast topped with yogurt, granola, and fruit.  That guy finished pretty much everything too.  What a champion.  

So although my particular dish (biscuits and gravy) wasn't that great, I still liked this place, and there are definitely other dishes I wanna try.  Plus the prices can't be beat (42 bucks for the 4 of us and we were stuffed) and it is definitely easier to get here than Dotties.

But Dottie's is still just the best.
author: William S.

description:
YUM!  I found out about Kate's Kitchen from a tour book and they suggested the french toast orgy.  I'm never one to turn down a quirky-named dish, but I mainly was attracted to the innovative grouping of yogurt, fruit, and french toast.  We had to wait a while for a table, but it was so worth it!  The french toast was as appetizing as I had imagined and the serving size was generous.

My only problem was the cramped tables, but it's a small, quaint restaurant; they can't help it.

I can't wait to go back and clean off another plate of french toast!
author: Kym M.

description:
Worst breakfast EVER!  I went in to order 2 breakfasts to go at 8:05 am.  The waitress was pleasant enough and took my order promptly.  I should mention that there was only 1 table seated with 2 people at the time.  I finally walked out of the restaurant at 8:40 am with my 2 breakfasts in hand and $25.00 out of my pocket..  
Unfortunately, I didn't check what was given to me before leaving.   Neither meal was correct and both were barely edible.  The over "easy eggs" were over hard at best with overdone whites and hard yolks.  The home fries were greasy and burnt with very little flavor.  The bacon and sausage patty were both over cooked.  The bottom of the sausage patty was black and hard.  The pancakes were dry and no butter or maple syrup came with them as the menu said they would.  The English muffin was over toasted, not burnt but definitely crunchier than it should be.  No jam/jelly was included.  I would have taken them back, but being as it took them so long to "burn" the meals, I was already late when i arrived at work and discovered the mess.  I definitely will not go there again.
author: Geo T.

description:
Do you like food?  
Do you like piles and piles of food?
Do you like French?  And Toast?  
AND ORGIES?!? 

Go see Madame Kate.  Tell her your kinky fetish.  She will hook you up.

Mmmmmm. . . The French Toast Orgy here is somethin' special: 8 triangles of french toast, stacked up and loaded with fresh fruit and yogurt and granola.  And HUGE!  The waiter claimed he broke a sweat just carrying it over to me last time.  (Hmpf, and I thought it was my sultry, barely brushed hair, sloppily clothed hangover look that was getting him all hot and bothered.)  

Of secondary importance are the following:

OJ is good, coffee average, hush puppies with pooh butter are unique & good, daily special omelettes are excellent.  

But, although I am typically a savory breakfast consumer, I find it hard to pass up the fascinatingly sweet sweet orgy here.

Minus 2 stars for the sometimes long wait (for sure on weekends), the cash only policy, and the occasional lack of fresh ingredients (could definitely taste "refrigerator smell" in my potatoes the last time I was there).
author: Ravena F.

description: Such a mixed bag. The sausage is great, as are the biscuits. The other food is pretty standard. I imagine they waste more potatoes than anyone else in the city--home fries are standard with any order, but portions are way too big. However, the wait for food when you're sitting at the table in a half-empty restaurant is inexcusable, as is the nervous waitress who, rather that figure out whether she can grab you your biscuit since you've been sitting there starving for 35 minutes, tries to avoid your table and your eye. I live in the neighborhood and have seen Kate's get sloppy as it got more popular, and now I think there's a bit of well-deserved lull--not as many lines, not as much buzz. I suggest take-out.
author: Megan M.

description:
I actually watched a grown man lament the number of carbs in the fantastic orange french toast while I hoover-ed my bacon and all I could do was look incredulously at my breakfast buddy.

It reminded me of the Sex in the City episode where Miranda watches her college buddy spit bite after bite of grade A steak into his napkin because of an LA induced eating disorder.

It was AWESOME.

Kate's Kitchen's french toast is so good it gives boys eating disorders.

Now thems some good french toasts!
author: R M.

description: I ordered the French toast orgy an it was HUGE.  Almost couldn't finish it (rare for me), but the meal itself was somewhat boring and uninteresting.
author: Steve M.

description:
I have finally solved the mystery of the hunger crisis in the world. Kate's Kitchen heaps enough food on your plate to feed an entire third world country. It is true.

The "problem" part is that, as a rule, breakfast doesn't even reheat well 2 hours later, let alone the time it would take to transport it somewhere transcontinental. It is unfortunate that we can't send some of the food on our plates to some starving nation, because the portions here are ridiculous. 

5 stars for the food..I am particularly fond of the hash and the french toast orgy (their words, not mine). 5 start for playing Journey last time I was dining here. 5 stars for refilling my coffee without me having to ask...which anyone who has seen me pre-morning coffee will bear witness to the importance of. 

Minus one star for an ungodly amount of non-reheatable food. Such a waste.
author: Drue C.

description:
I had the oatmeal which was a multi-grain with fruit affair that they served with maple syrup.  I rather enjoyed it. I wanted to try the cornmeal pancakes but I wasn't hungry enough unfortunately.  My friend got the meatloaf sandwich which he thoroughly enjoyed. The menu seemed pretty diverse as far as breakfast and lunch go. 

I also tried the ginger ale which they make there but it was late in the afternoon. This meant that it was pretty flat but otherwise pretty gingery.

This place has a lot of potential and I'm looking forward to continuing my research in the near future. They do pack you in though.
author: rob. l.

description:
I'm a big fan of the big breakfast ... eggs ... bacon ... sausage ... toast ... hashbrowns .... mmmmmm .... coffee ...... so its no surprise that I fancy a weekend stop at Kate's.   They do a farmer's breakfast thing that has it all for diner cheap prices and that is usually my order of choice - but today, well today, I mixed it up and went with the French Toast Orgy.  
Oh.My.God.  

This was a ginormous platter of french toast smothered with granola, fruit, yogurt and honey ... absolutely delicious!  

Um and split it ... just trust me.

update:  the new fav = cornmeal pancakes ... short stack is plenty.  be careful when ordering these ... people you're with will undoubtedly start eating off of your plate.  Also, I've been trying to figure out why I just can't give Kate's that final 5th star ... it comes down to bathroom.  I despise any restaurant bathroom trip that requires a walk thru the kitchen ... its just not right.
author: Sarah K.

description:
Being a morning person means I rarely have to do the 'sidewalk-wait' for breakfast/brunch on the weekends.  I actively dislike standing on the sidewalk watching other people eat and hoping the next name called will be mine - it reminds me of teams forming in class for dodgeball.

I waited for Kate's because I was promised hush puppies.  That is the only reason (well, that and I was hungry and lazy).  And Kate's definitely delivered.  Not just the hush puppies (which were completely as advertised), but coffee dark and thick enough to stand a spoon up, pancakes the size of my end table and a mound of fruit/yogurt/nuts/honey/french toast that could feed approximately seventeen people and a small dog.  I finished nothing - too much food...

Our waitress was excellent - a truly nice person and very helpful.

Tiny, LOUD (too loud - they lost a star over it) and vaguely smoky, Kate's is nice but not 'Wow'.  I would not wait on the sidewalk again for it.
author: Suzanne B.

description:
I got the Lauren's Delight or Special anyway, it was a Kaiser roll with a fried egg, tomato, red onion, avocado and some sort or other of aioli and homefries. My boy got the big boy. Yeah, it was one of those breakfasts at 3:00pm, somebody deserved a big boy, heh.

Anyway, it was fresh and tasty, and the servings were seriously ample. The service was prompt and friendly and on a sunday near closing, almost empty of other patrons.

The decor feels fake to me, sort of like someone thought 'this is what sells right now', instead of an authentic vision. But the menu works with the down home theme and that makes it all ok. 

I would definitely recommend a visit and a deeper dip into the menu, maybe come with 2-3 friends with the specific intent to share items. 

Yummy!
author: Miel H.

description:
bleeech. The stale grease smell emanating from the door every time it opened should have warned me to just turn around and leave. 

Don't get me wrong- I'm no stranger to grease. I just put down a basket of fried calamari, corn fritters, fried mushrooms AND an order of fish and chips from Barbara's Fish Trap this past weekend without batting an eyelash. 

There's good grease though, and then there's bad grease. This place was bad grease through and through. The type that makes your stomach queasy, making all sorts of weird, squeaky gurgling noises after you eat, and shortly after, causing massive stomach cramping.

I orderd standard breakfast fare- bacon, eggs over medium, and it came with home fries. Everything, and I kid you not, EVERYTHING smelled and tasted like stale grease and it made me wanna hurl each time I took a bite. the home fries were the worst, as potatoes take on whatever flavor you cook them in. In this case it was stale grease flavor. Wretch. after I left I drove with my windows open to try and shake the nauseous smell off my hair and clothes. Good god I prayed, I promise to never gripe about smelling like Korean BBQ if you can just get rid of THIS nasty smell!

Needless to say I spent the afternoon alone, curled in a tight ball on the couch when I wasn't making gallons of hot tea to flush the evil out, or to the bathroom to well, flush the evil out. 

I'd avoid this place- there's a myriad of other places within walking distance with much better value for your hard-earned money.
author: Mortiche W.

description:
Brunch in the city is one of my favorite things to do...
New finds for brunch are always a bonus....and this is a good one.
Its small enough to feel kitchy, and its big enough that there is usually not a wait over 10 minutes or so.  Their yogurt/fruit/honey/granola thing is unreal...and their breakfast sandwich is pretty delicious too.
author: Lauren F.

description: This is my absolute favorite place to eat brunch. I've actually become somewhat of a regular here. The atmosphere is casual and not too serious, which I like. It has a hole-in-the-wall vibe. The service is why I come back here again and again, that and the French Toast Orgy and the pancakes and the gravy and biscuits, etc. Everything on the menu is scrumptious. Irene is the absolute sweetest server in the world, and always has a warm smile when I come in. Also, it's a great place to eat on a budget. I always leave full and have never had the bill be over $25 for two people. Get to Kate's as soon as you are able!
author: Jessica S.

description:
I ate at Kate's for my very first time today, and I have to say that I enjoyed it immensely. Perhaps the fine company of Mel T. enhanced the overall experience, but I thought it was totally basic diner food. With some pumpkin pancakes. You know, cuz it's San Francisco and all.

But I'm from Milwaukee, so this shit is, like, classy to me.

Our sixteen-year-old waitress was generous with the water and coffee refills and our food arrived in a timely manner. Okay, we did totally luck out and magically arrive at the best time possible. Like, there was one group of two ahead of us and within minutes of our sign-in did the sidewalk fill up with hungry, hungover folks. I'm sure that this no waitin' for 12pm brunch really helped Kate's cause, but the food was totally good, too!

Plus, Mel and I had a fabulous conversation re: the politics of the artist who created the original map painting that the large mural copies, among many other brilliant and heady subjects.  You only wish you could understand.

I do not, however, need to see another pumpkin pancake until next fall because the utter heft and girth of those served at Kate's leave you with what feels like a fucking anchor in your belly, deterring you from jumping higher and/or running faster.
author: Chloe S.

description:
Kate's Kitchen and my torrid love affair with Hush Puppies. 

You didn't blow me away. Another case of having high expectations i guess. I love Hush Puppies, and ever since BlueJay Cafe took them off the menu, I've been looking for a spot that has them. So on a rainy Friday early (I mean EARLY!) morning, my room mate and I decided to head over to Kate's. Dude even before i walked in, i could just taste the deliciousness of Hush Puppies! Drool!!!!....... 

We were seated immediately and of course i ordered the Hush Puppies with pooh butter, along with a side order to cornmeal pancakes with bananas and walnut's,(yes! in my world pancakes are a side order!) and home style biscuits. I couldn't stop thinking about the hush puppies, the wait was agonizing! 

Now here i am, having set myself up for major disappointment. It's like going out on a blind date. You're expecting some one totally hot to walk in, but that's not what destiny or that dude from work who set you up with his "HOT" co-worker, had in mind. I can't even tell you how disappointed i was. The first bite of the hush puppy, and i didn't see stars. COME ON!! it's not supposed to be like this! this is worse than a break up! 

The hush puppies were oily and pretty flavorless. The pooh butter made them better, but you now, it's like that pretty chick you know who wear tons of makeup, isn't that pretty without it. It's just not the same and It can only get you so far. In addition, the pancakes were weird and grainy. I can still feel the graininess in my throat. Ugghhh.... 

The service was the saving grace. Quick and efficient. 
And to top it off, Kate's in a cash only establishment. Great! 
So I'm insanely disappointed, BlueJay still won't bring the hush puppies back and i ended up paying 16$ for breakfast. I won't be back. 

2.5 Stars, but .5 for giving me hope. The quest continues.......
author: Tushar V.

description:
The food here I thought was just ok, the people I went with swore it's the best breakfast in town, but I'm thinking they haven't been out for breakfast all that much.
Maybe I got the wrong thing, the pancakes looked pretty good and huge, but I chose the egg sandwich, which was reccomended to me, and it was just dry, dry, dry. And I had to ask for water about four times. They're on top of the coffee,  I had about four cups within 30 min. I would like to go back and try the pancakes which seemed to be there thing, so until I do I'm sticking with 3 stars.
author: JIll H.

description:
Better than Mama's, better than Dottie's, better than a Belgian waffle with fried chicken on top swimming in biscuits and gravy.

It be de best bre'fess in town, boss!

Horribly hungry or horribly hungover, looking for veggie or wanting to consume meatie, Kate's has got you covered. Their breakfast sandwiches are superb, the biscuits and gravy is sinfully special, and the specials menu always has seasonal stuff to chew on. Three people recently ate all they could -- and took stuff home -- for $35, with tip.

Me love it.
author: Chris R.

description:
I've walked by Kate's many times and have intended to try it for awhile now, but it wasn't until some friends highly recommended it that I finally got the necessary motivation. Although I was almost frightened away by the long waiting list, even at 12:00pm on a Sunday, prime brunching hour, we only waited about 20 minutes or so. 

I have a major weakness for pancakes, and their buttermilk cornmeal shortstack totally hit the spot yesterday. The pancakes were enormous, though--next time I'll know to only order one. My companion got the Farney Garney blah blah whatever it's called, and even though it was a ton of food he managed to polish off the whole plate, plus 3/4 of one of my pancakes. I did manage to try one of his homefries, and I agree with a previous reviewer that they're kind of flavorless. Still, it was a great brunch nonetheless, and I'm already looking forward to coming  back for more.
author: Rachel J.

description: Awful food - the biscuits were reheated from a factory-produced pack and the gravy clearly cooked up from a powder. The grits were worse than anything we've ever had- watery, sheet white and flavorless except for a slight acidic tang. French toast was along the lines of something you'd expect on an airplane or a school canteen. Really regretted this meal- a bad start to the weekend.
author: J W.

description:
Let me start with the positive part of my brunch experience at Kate's... The waitress.  Helpful, friendly, and well deserving of the large tip we gave her (yes my friends, I do over tip despite the size of my nose).  She was the only reason that this place got 1 star from me.

Now on to the negatives (the food).

- Pumpkin Pancakes: tasted like someone mixed sawdust, baking soda, flour and pumpkin pie spice (surprisingly not tasty)
- Home fries: bland... tasted exactly how you would assume luke-warm potatoes with no flavoring would taste like

Actually, come to think of it... the entertainment of watching the cook scream ludicrous things to the servers and busboy's was pretty cool... definitely worth the mid-brunch trip to the bathroom through the kitchen.

So Kate's is on my banned-list.  Being my first review, it is currently a short list...
author: Adam O.

description:
Knowing this place is very popular on weekend mornings, I expected a long wait, but got in in less than 15 minutes.  Plus 1.

I ordered the pancakes with bananas, strawberries and lemon curd.  Anyone who serves lemon curd gets at least 3 stars in my book.  AND they have hush puppies!  I did'nt order them this time around, but I am totally ordering them next time (yes, there will be a next time).

I also ordered a side of bacon, which wasn't very good.  I was excited because it was advertised as "thick cut," but it got to me pretty overdone and not very chewy :-(  only reason it's not getting 5 stars.

Overall: I'm definitely going back.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Good pancakes are a gift from God.  
The cornmeal buttermilk pancakes this morning were as good as pancakes get! Took my dad ( ex cop- likes big food) and he LOVED it...did keep checking on his car outside, but got distracted by the huge servings! Ahhhh wait till you see the marvelous servings!!!
Everything was terrific...fresh baked biscuits- great home-fries- and all very reasonable prices...CASH ONLY....
You betta come there hungry...when you leave you wont need to eat the whole rest of the day....week...month???
I am still stuffed, and completely happy in my pancake haze!
Cute homey interior and fun smiling service! and the pancakes...oh the pancakes...I will be dreaming about that short stack for days!!!
author: Christina M.

description: Just about what I expected from a breakfast place in the Lower Haight.  I had a scramble dish and is was less then mediocre.  Although the service was stellar it was not enough to make up for the food.   I guess I should try a different dish before being too harsh.  THe potatoes were burned.  The veggies in the scramble were less then fresh, and the price was high.
author: Christopher F.

description:
After waiting in line in the cold for half an hour I was let in to an even colder environment. The guy working there was nice and attentive but there were 2 woman waitresses that helped me that were SOOO RUDE!! One blonde lady with curly hair delivered our food, she plopped the food in front of me and I said that's not mine, she said I know! I'm putting it here and plopped the wrong food to people and left. We had no room left on our table since the lady didn't clear our table from small plates we used for our appetizer hush puppies. I took the small plates and left it on the floor, how classy! When another waitress came around I decided to help her out, picked the plates off the floor and handed it to her. She rudely snapped at me, "Can you wait!" I just dumped it back on the floor after she said that. That just ruined my whole meal! I was too pissed to enjoy anything I was eating. 
Hush Puppies- Could be more moist, they just taste like big balls of cornbread, you need to slather a lot of honey butter on it to make it taste good.
Corn beef Hash- The meat pieces in the hash was good, tasty and tender big chunks, but the rest of the hash was not amazing. The best I've had in the city is at Q in the Richmond District!

Overall it was just Ok and I minus a star because my blood pressure shouldn't be going up from RUDE ASS WAITRESSES! If you hate your job then quit!
author: Karen T.

description:
Holy shit, this is a fantastic place for a hangover breakfast.  It's pretty dim inside, which makes it tolerable to be in public with a hangover like nobody's business.  That, and the staff is not overly chatty and let you nurse your coffee in peace.

Sometimes the chef sings along to the radio a little too loud, and the wait time is inconsistent--but the huge portions and SCRUMPTIOUS breakfasts more than make up for it.  One look at the French Toast Orgy and you'll see what I mean.

I'd walk barefoot over broken glass to get here--but thankfully, I usually don't have to.
author: Eric E.

description:
Kate's Kitchen is cute in its simplicity: this is not a brunch spot meant as a continuation of Saturday night's boozing. In fact, Kate's Kitchen doesn't serve alcohol. Instead, they serve up a delicious mix of breakfast and lunch specials that please the palette. 

The restaurant itself is small, so a wait on a weekend morning is to be expected. I enjoyed the "fancy grilled cheese", which lives up to its name with melted cheese, basil and slices of tomato stuffed inside. It was served with a side of potatoes. My brunch partner enjoyed a short stack (with powdered sugar) and a side of eggs. Service is quick and efficient, but not drowning. 

All in all, Kate's Kitchen is a refreshing change from the usual drunk brunch tradition.
author: Bryan B.

description:
2:30 on a Saturday is definitely a good time to go. We walked right in & sat down. Within two minutes, we had large cups of coffee in hand, & within fifteen, giant heaping plates of food.

She got the french toast orgy (we shared, & had to choke down multiple orgasms while eating it), & I got the Flarney Garney with STELLAR homemade sausage patties. I almost started singing "I never met a sausage patty like you before", but bit my tongue.

Hats off to Kate's for having one of the finest brunch spots in the city.
author: Pete J.

description:
K-k-k-katie, K-k-k-katie,
you're the only one I'll ever truly adore!
When the m-moon shines
Over the mountain
I'll be waiting at your k-k-k-kitchen door!

My momma uses to sing that to me, but my momma never served me no french toast orgies, no ma'am. 

why has no one else commented on the awesome cryptic stencilling along the western wall? my friends and i have to decode it anew every time we come.
author: Caitlin E.

description: I would eat here everyday if I could.  Been here plenty of times and never had a bad experience.  Great coffee, good prices, and the selection of food is spectacular.  I never know what I want to order. If you don't like Kate's, you suck.
author: Joe F.

description:
How can you not like a place that uses the word 'Orgy' in two of its standard breakfast offerings AND has something called Pooh Butter?

This place understands breakfast.  Portions are huge and tasty and filled with all the random goodness one wants when they are not feeling at their chipper-best on a Saturday or Sunday. 

The Hush Puppies "beautifly deep-fried balls of cornmeal" are exactly that.  And they come with Pooh Butter.  This is honey and butter whipped together. Everywhere should start serving Pooh Butter.  Land o Lakes and Challenge should start making it.  I usually ask for a side of Pooh Butter even when I am not having the Hush Puppies to put on my toast or on my tongue. 

There is usually a wait on the weekend and they use the "first come, first fit" seating method, but the wait is worth it.
author: Kristin S.

description:
Tea in a glass?  Is that a sin?  Yes, because after a 3 minute steep my tea was lukewarm :(

However, my soup and sandwich were yummy without being too rich or creamy, the service was quick and friendly, and the art on the walls was interesting enough to jumpstart conversation.

We had a 15 minute wait for a party of two at 11:00 on a Saturday.  But from the grumpy expressions and the long list, I think parties of 3 or more spent a significantly longer time waiting.
author: Tessa M.

description:
Yelp continues to classify the Lower Haight as Hayes Valley.  Please, Yelp, get a brain.  Back to the review.

Ever since I moved to San Francisco, and before actually, I've been hearing about the wonder of breakfasts at Kate's Kitchen.  The first time, I believed the hype, but it might just have been because I was so hungry by the time the food came.  I've been back five or six times since then, and while the food has been good, it's not worth the wait.  And if you want to wait in the cold on Haight Street, you're better off at the Pork Store in the Upper Haight.

The food is good, but the menu is pretty small, and the lack of meatless options is particularly annoying at a place on Haight Street.

UPDATE:  11/15/09
===============

Yeah, definitely doesn't qualify for four stars.  More vegetarian options!
author: John S.

description:
I was quite disappointed that I wasn't won over by this place. My friends/old roommates always raved about the food and the fruit orgy but eh, I didn't really think much of it. Granted, I didn't order the fruit orgy because I couldn't bring myself to pay 6 bucks for a bowl of fruit and I wanted something more substantial for brunch. Instead, I got the orange French toast and my BF got the cheese and onion biscuits in gravy.

For French toast it was good. Tasty. But for orange French toast it was lacking. I heard it was supposed to be amazing, but I could barely taste the orange. Boo. And I had to pay extra to get bacon on the side since the French toast didn't come with anything else. (Though, I don't know if this counts as a valid complaint or more of a declaration of my piggy-ness.)

The biscuits weren't too bad. Tasty from the bites I stole. But I could see how a big bowl of gravy and two biscuits would get boring after awhile. 

Overall it's overrated and overpriced. We order all that and some tea and the bill was almost $30. And as for atmosphere of the restaurant...LOUD LOUD LOUD. Not in a good way either. It's chaos. Not great for conversation...Can give some people a headache if you're not ready for it.

Meh. I'll give it one more chance but that's that.
author: Viv C.

description:
The big guy's breakfast is a lot of food for the money, but the sausage is a bit dry.  Cornmeal pancakes are delicious, and some of the best bacon in town.  I'm a fan of the Flanched Flarney Carney as well.  Check the special's board for good stuff.

The best breakfast in Lower Haight.
author: Marzette H.

description:
Pretty eh and the experience mostly just functional.  In tribute, this review will be pretty eh and mostly just functional. 

Small and loud, but no wait and nearby on a Saturday morning was a plus. I had a couple of decent scrambled eggs with really good potatoes and a not so good, rather dry biscuit. She had a fruit bowl and side of wheat toast. We had a glass of organic apple juice each.

I don't remember specifics of price. Apparently, neither did our waitress, who when asked for a check, just gave us a number that I do remember came to 20 bucks with tip. My mental calculation based on the cheap menu prices was much lower but I didn't feel like getting into it.

There are better.
author: jessica s.

description:
Their strawberry jam is crack!

Took a bus to come here for breakfast. It was worth it. The apple juice was super delicious. The meat in their breakfast hash is super fatty and delicious. The carrots, um, not so good. But they didn't ruin the meat in anyway. I just picked around it and only ate the meat.

But it was the jam that was so freaking good. It really taste like strawberries although I know it is just jam. I swear I can just eat that with like 10 slices of bread and I'm super happy! 

Total came out to $20+ for 2 ppl. Well worth it.
author: Jack N.

description:
My answer to "What would your final, pre-death meal be if you could choose?" is at Kate's Kitchen, and it comes in the form of a gigantic pile of orange spice (not too orange or too spice) french toast, yogurt, granola, fruit, honey and maple syrup.  The French Toast Orgy absolutely, 100% rocks. There is nothing fake, girly or wussy about this dish.  It requires a battle plan and a full arsenal of weaponry from the second it hits your table.  But believe me, it can be finished!  You can beat this thing!

When taking on this beast, remember to pace yourself.  My 4'11" friend can usually out-eat me any day, but she rushed and left with a stomach ache and a bruised ego (and the girl can eat).  Don't rush.  Savor.  This is seriously some of the best pre-hike or pre-bike food you can eat--it doesn't put you to sleep.  All that granola somehow balances out the sugar coma most french toast induces.  I've eaten this thing and walked to Ocean Beach and back without hesitation or weariness.

I can't attest to any other dish at Kate's because in the last five years, I've never ordered anything but the Orgy.  It all smells good and looks good, though.  They make a really good hand-made ginger ale.  The prices are incredibly reasonable for what you get, and the waits don't tend to be too long.  Even with ten parties in front of you, the cattle prod is frequently used in the form of extremely efficient service, so the line goes fast.  In this case, the line is genuinely a reflection of very good food, instead of lazy waiters and laggy patrons.

Kate herself?  Wander through the kitchen toward the bathroom to see her in action.  Wow.  No wonder things move quickly.  She is one bad-ass woman.

Don't let the exterior, neighborhood, or even the interior greasy-spoon-looking atmosphere turn you back.  Eat here, and be happy.  Oh, and bring cash!
author: Ara R.

description:
Fresh corned beef hash, fruit orgy, mmmmm!

Can be crowded, parking, no mmmm!
author: Aaron I.

description: One of my favorite brunch places. Amazing cornmeal pancakes. Doesn't take reservations but they do a good job managing the wait. So worth it and you don't have to wait 2 hours like some of the brunch spots in San Francisco.
author: Alexandra B.

description:
The Lower Haight is a place for Indian food, getting your hair cut, beer, coffee and buying expensive tshirts. It is not a place for brunch or breakfast and Kate's is no exception.

Places that are better within walking distance: Home, Pork Store, J's Pots of Soul.
author: Maria D.

description:
Brunch is a sacred rite for gossip and idle chatter over light-as-air pancakes or perfectly crisped potatoes.  Unfortunately, my recent brunch at Kate's did not live up to my (admittedly high) brunch standards.  The regular menu was pretty small, so I ended up ordering the omelette special: chicken, onion, sundried tomatoes, rosemary, and feta.  I can't say no to feta.  The filling was quite good - the chicken moist and satisfying, the onions golden-brown, and although the rosemary in the eggs was a little too strong, I was satisfied.  

It was when I turned to the sides that I found real disappointment.  An eggy breakfast is obviously incomplete without its potato counterpart, and at Kate's, they take the shape of home fries.  Home fries done well are heaven on earth, with subtle flavors of onions and peppers mingling with the starchy potato goodness.  Kate's home fries, however, were luke-warm, mushy instead of crispy, and completely lacking in the fullness of flavor that makes fries more than just a baked potato.

The final disappointment was the english muffin.  I don't have english muffins very often, so i was really looking forward to a crisp on the outside, soft on the inside, nooks and crannies overflowing with golden butter experience.  Instead, I think I was served a kitchen sponge that had been sliced in half, briefly heated, and dipped in oil.

The 30+ minute had me hoping for more, but Kate, you let me down.  I will not visit your kitchen again.
author: Rachel B.

description:
Can someone tell me what it says on the wall?

This place rocks. - the food comes in heaping servings and it all tastes amazing. We had a short 10 minute wait on a Sunday afternoon. The french toast can feed an army! Many of their dishes include unique ingredients and combinations of toppings. There are so many things on the menu to try, I'll definitely come back.
author: Mary R.

description: Today was our first visit to Kate's. The breakfast was wonderful. We ordered the two eggs, bacon, home fries and gluten free biscuit. I had the Mindy but added goat cheese. Delicious!!! The place is really small and we got there early enough to avoid the crowd. You may end up sitting with another party at your table...but turned out that wasn't so weird. Good food, nice staff.
author: Robyn H.

description: Awesome food & pleasant wait staff!
author: B B.

description:
When the best dish on the menu has the word orgasm in it, it better deliver...wait for it, wait for it...and mmmm, oh yeah it does.  Seriously, besides Mama's and Dottie's, you're hard-pressed to find a better brunch in our fair city by the Bay. 

Egg dishes -- most excellent
Coffee -- sleepless nights brand
Pan cakes -- sinful
Bacon -- mmmm magic animal

Suggestion: Put your name down on the list before you park - it can be a healthy wait, especially after 11am on a weekend.
author: Ben S.

description: Nice little spot for breakfast, small & cozy.  I had their orange spiced french toast and the hubby had the fruit orgy french toast.  Mine was great, a little dry but full of yummy flavor (reminded me of a Christmas treat).  My husband's was the same french toast as mine but heaped with cut pineapple, bananas, strawberries, oranges, blueberries, grapes and cantaloupe topped with creamy vanilla yogurt and sprinkled with cinnamony granola.  A little expensive but for the quality and amount of food it was worth it.  To die for !!!  The atmosphere was very chill, the waitress was very nice and very prompt and was always on top of the coffee refills which was mega-strong, btw.  Be sure to bring cash as they do not accept credit cards or at least that's what were told when we tried to pay at first.  All in all a good way to finish our little weekend in Frisco.  =)
author: Michelle P.

description:
Kate's Kitchen has amazing pancakes. I can safely say there are my favorite in San Francisco. They also have hush puppies! Yum.

Unfortunately, the line is ridiculously long and I find Lower Haight to be incredibly depressing. I do plan on stopping in one last time for a pancake indulgence before moving down to LA (where I plan on conducting a thorough search for new favorite pancakes).
author: Abby W.

description: Kate's Kitchen is my new favorite breakfast spot!  You may have to wait to be seated but it is definitely worth it!  The pumpkin French toast was the best I ever had!  As was the delicious veggie scramble! I highly recommend Kate's Kitchen!
author: Rosie S.

description:
I can't believe I'm gonna say it but I will. I loved this place. The food they serve is delicious but I have to ding them a star because their portion sizes were ginormous. Seriously.

Husky-sized portions but tasty food. Definitely get the cornmeal hush puppies with honey (pooh) butter. The french toast orgy is decadent, fresh, yummy and very intimidating. Orange french toast, covered in fresh fruit, smothered in yogurt and drizzled with honey. I've never had french toast like this before and it's a great combo. However, there were six pieces of french toast on my plate and I'm an eater. I will pay anyone $5 that can eat the whole thing. 

My friend got the hash and it was shockingly good. I'm definitely getting it next time. I've never had anything like it before. I've always thought of hash as disgusting cubes of flavorless beef clumped together by some horrible gelatinous goo, served over toast. This it was not. The chunks of beef in Kate's hash are tender, salty and perfect for a hearty breakfast with scrambled eggs. Thankfully, my friend fills up quickly and I got to take her leftovers. It was even good reheated later that night.

Go for breakfast or brunch. You'll love it. It fills up fast, so if you're not too hungover or you have a protest to go to at 10am, it's the perfect spot for a 9am bite sans wait. But don't do I like I did and eat till it hurts.
author: Corey F.

description:
FRENCH TOAST ORGY!!!!  GET IT!

HUSH PUPPIES w/ MAPLE BUTTER!!!!   GET IT!!!

and then try to find your way home as your body and brain suffer from food coma. 

"where...am...i..??...must...lay....down....can't...breathe..."  

love this place on a sunday morning after a night of drinking.  kate's place is small and popular - there's usually a line during primo brunch time hours - go early or prepare to wait.   and cheap, cheap, CHEAP.  always seem to get the same waitress, who is super nice and fast.  

BUT, i swear either i'm really hung over when i'm in there or they play the same CD over and OVER again....i mean, it makes me think i'm going looney...anyone else notice this???   and usually there is an appearance by someone loonier than me off the street, which always makes the experience more "interesting" to say the least.  watch your purses, ladies - someone got their purse snatched by one of 'em last time i was there...ah, i love my neighborhood : )
author: Suzanne A.

description: French Toast Orgy....the dish says it all and delivers.  You can share this easily with two people with some biscuits on the side and fresh, free-flowing coffee topped off by the happy service.  A great way to start your morning or after a walk in GG Park.
author: Greg R.

description:
I've lived in the Lower Haight for almost four years and just recently discovered this place. No really...I've lived about two blocks from it for four years and just started eating there this year. Whaatttt?

Their French Toast Orgy is exceeelllleeent. OMG yum. It's made of french toast with yogurt, granola and a ton of fruit piled on top. It usually feeds me for a day and a half. I've also had their corned beef hash which is huge and comes with great home fries. Double yum.  

Very friendly staff. My only complaint is the way they serve the tea which is in a water glass, not even a coffee mug, which usually makes for a bad cup of tea. 

other than that SUPER yum and fun stuff to look at on the walls too. :)
author: Joy A.

description:
Cons -- the potatoes are completely flavorless and cooked to mush (kind of unforgivable). The special omelet I got was okay, but also a little on the bland side. 

Pros -- I liked the atmosphere and the service was friendly. It looks like the mainstays on the menu are pretty cheap too (though the special I got was normalish brunch prices). The cornmeal pancakes had a unique texture and tasted delicious with the strawberries/bananas/lemon curd. 

Decent neighborhood brunch place, but it makes me miss my options in my old 'hood on Polk St (Polkers, Rex Cafe, Nick's Crispy Tacos, Crepe House, even Bell Tower).
author: Stephanie L.

description:
HOLY CRAP, this is some good food!

Went here last weekend and the boyfriend and I enjoyed the orange french toast, cornmeal pancakes and *not from a can* corn beef & eggs... YUM!

Yes, there's a wait... but if you get there early enough you can avoid the masses which seem to start at 11AM. 

Too bad they don't have mimosas... and the heady scent of pot (the store next door sells cannabis sativa...) kinda confused me that early in the morning oh, c'mon... it wasn't even 11AM yet people!)
author: Nenette Y.

description:
The potatoes LOOKED amazing but tasted so strange.  My party decided it must have been because they were frozen or something because they were distinctly undercooked.  The meat in my dish was severely under-seasoned and tasted like complete mush (I got some egg/pork dish).  Pretty much everyone else I was with said their food was "ok" or "BLAH"

The service sucked.  The girl who took our order repeated it back wrong several times.  Then the person who ordered first at our table received his food last.... twenty minutes after the rest of us.

Don't go here, there are so many better places to eat in SF.
author: Kristy H.

description:
Hashbrowns, toast, eggs are things you can get anywhere.

But the PANCAKES are DELICIOUS!  I think they are made from cornmeal, and have a slight gritty texture, but are still light and fluffy.  I'm drooling right now as I remember how they taste.  

Pancakes get 4 stars.
author: Joe O.

description:
I'm the type that will sit down, empty handed at the buffet rather than stand in a buffet line and the same thing goes with waiting around outside to get into a cramped eatery. Thankfully, my early morning work hours makes sleeping till 9 seem very late so I was able to get in this morning without a wait. hooray!

Food was yummy! The potatoes were really crisp and the perfect amount of spice - no hot sauce needed. Their eggs were fluffy and cooked to the firmness that I like, the jam was nice and sticky and the coffee left a sludge in the bottom of my cup. mmmm sludge

As previous yelpers have pointed out, the portions are huge. The french toast orgy was ordered at my table and I was actually afraid of it at one point. Then I ate a blueberry and suddenly things seemed okay.

Wait staff was super polite, service was timely, the huge amounts of food were well priced. 

Minus two points because I still have not regained all of my hearing in my left ear (so loud) and because seriously, no one needs that much food in the morning.
author: Allegra F.

description:
After months of pleading by a foodie friend of mine, I joined a group of friends for brunch to check out this popular spot in the Lower Haight.

Unfortunately, Kate's failed to meet the hype and the morning was a bust in more ways than one.  On the positive, the portions are hearty and the service is friendly and attentive.  On the other hand, the eggs were slight overcooked, the potatoes were bland, and the pancakes turned out too dense for my taste (turns out Kate's makes their pancakes with cornmeal so it's more reminicent of a flat piece of cornbread than a traditional buttermilfk pancake).  Add to that my entire meal came out lukewarm (almost cool) and you can understand why the meal fell short of my expectations.

After all this, I came out to find my car had been broken into during the hour I was there (They were kind enough to smash out the entire right rear window as opposed to knock out one of the small triangular panes - thanks f**k-o's!) .  What a way to start the morning.

Now I realize that even the best restaurants in the city have their "off" days and I certainly cannot blame the break-in on the restaurant, so 3 stars is a compromise given the circumstances.  I just hope the next visit makes this one a distant memory for the right reasons.
author: Drew W.

description:
Ungh... My friends (whose couch I often crash on on Friday nights) insist on coming here, like, every Saturday for brunch.

Good luck having a less than 30 minute wait. Now, the food is pretty good and plentiful (check out the Orgy), but the wait! Oh, the wait. The wait...

I would recommend sending one lone soldier down to scribble his/her name on the list while the rest of your posse does something better for half an hour. Preferably on a different block (it is not the most scenic part of Lower Haight, unless you enjoy spillover from the projects and the weed distribution center across the street).

I think the biggest reason I hate this place is that they have no soy milk. No soy milk! No soy milk. Even the waitresses (cute indie rock girls, mostly) say, "Yeah, it's weird that we don't have soy milk. Huh...".

My coffee craves soymilk.

So I stopped foolishly ordering it and now just bring my own. BYOSM? Sounds like some sketchy fetish on one of the floors of the Power Exchange...
author: Trey F.

description:
Love the Lauren's Special!  Service here used to suck, but we came back for the great food. Today the service was great!  Prompt, mindful, and friendly. Thanks all!

Would be five stars but I hate the coffee they serve here. :)
author: Kurt O.

description:
Server was nice.  I had come in search of the elusive corned beef hash beast.  It had been spotted at Kate's before.

It was available as I stumbled in at 8 am on a weekday.  The hash came a little bit later - large chunks of corned beef with sweet carrots and bits o potato and some onions, topped with rye bread and eggs.

The corned beef chunks were the largest I have seen in hash.  The aspect that precluded this from greatness was that the carrots were so sweet that they made the dish more of a sweet than savory dish.

Also there was a complete jerk who was nasty to the waitress and seemed to find fault with everything on the menu - they should have given him the boot.
author: Aaron T.

description:
I don't get it.

I'm from the south. 
ain't no grey veggie smothered gravy where i'm from. 
where is my floury, white sausage gravy smooshed all over buttermilk biscuits?
not at kate's. that's for sure. 



thumbs down.
author: jesse s.

description: Excellent local breakfast joint.  Cozy interior, tasty grub, yummy coffee.  In the past they've had some grumpy servers, but my server this morning, Irene, was a real charmer.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Cheap breakfast specials during the week ($5.50 breakfast sandwich, potatoes,  AND coffee!)...superb french toast!

wait staff can be a bit brusque,  but they never leave your coffee cup empty.
author: suzi m.

description:
Kate's Kitchen is the epitome of a great greasy spoon joint in Lower Haight.  She gets 3.5 stars for me.

Likes: Mmmm... The Fruit Orgy is pretty darn good and fresh and the coffee is delish and full-bodied.
Dislikes: The long wait and the cash-only requirement is a downer, but c'est la vie.  Kate, you is WORTH it!
author: Katie C.

description:
Yeech.  My friends dragged me here for a Sunday brunch and it was about the worst breakfast I had in a long time. There was a long wait to even be seated and once we were we got a waiter that was stoned outta his mind.  During the meal he consistently forgot to bring coffee, refill coffee, bring syrup, etc etc.

The food was pretty bland and expensive for what it was.  The portions were big, but big portions of bland food doesn't really excite me.  The pumpkin pancakes were very dry and were barely edible even when syrup and jam were placed on top.  Everything else, was pretty standard fare and like I said, bland.

Next time I'm in SF, I think I'll have to skip.
author: daniel m.

description: Had the French Toast Orgy, was a monstrous portion with too much granola on top. Very difficult to eat and the bread was a bit dry. I would go back, it's just ok greasy spoon.
author: Shannon B.

description:
OK, good things include friendly staff, good menu selection with large portions and a cozy feel to the place. But on the downside loud music (I like Bob Marley too but I prefer being able to concentrate on conversation) and the food itself.

I would say I've only eaten here once but the hash was very disappointing. Yes, lots of it but in my mind a hash has potatoes, onions and corned beef. Quite what blackened celery, carrot and other stuff was doing in there I don't know, and the whole thing was very greasy. Plus, call me Mr Picky but did the toast really need to be shoved into the food - a separate plate isn't too much to ask. The eggs were done perfectly however.

All in all I've had better.
author: Iain T.

description:
I'm sorry, but I really don't know what the hype of this place is all about. I came here for brunch one time and ordered the cheddar and green onion biscuits with sausage gravy.  Looked good on paper, but when I got it, it just looked like gray sludge. Seriously, I have never seen sausage gravy this color before. And it tasted bland. Basically it seemed like they made it from some kind of canned product.  It reminded me both in taste and texture of condensed clam chowder soup. The biscuits were just as bad. Dense, with hardly any cheese or green onions in them. 

My boyfriend ordered one of their scrambles and he wasn't impressed with it either. The amount of food they pile on the plates is disgusting as well. The only reason I give this place 2 stars is because the wait staff was nice.
author: Jade L.

description:
FOOD: TWO STARS (* *)
I had the cornmeal buttermilk pancakes with strawberries and granola on top in addition to the "meat omelet of the day," which contained sausage, gorgonzola, tomates and peppers, among other things.  The pancakes were decent but certainly nothing to write home about.  The dryness I felt while masticating was not readily alleviated by the syrup that accompanies the dish.  The omelet was terrible.
