description: for a city gung-ho on brunch, kate's kitchen takes the cake. affordable prices + super tastey homemade food = can't go wrong.  i've been to the pork store, supenküchen, the grind, squatt and gobble, etc and Kate's Kitchen is definitely the winner.  the only minus is the ambience isn't anything too special, but that really doesn't matter on a hungover saturday morning, does it?
author: Ivan C.

description: i used to come here a lot when i was in college, but i hadn't been back in about 6 years.  i recently went and had a breakfast sandwich with potatoes.  it was all quite good, except they were out of sour cream for the potatoes, and they're potatoes are better with sour cream than ketchup.  it was a weekday, late afternoon, so it was nearly empty.  the coffee was really good and our server was nice and attentive.  the potatoes aren't quite as good as i remember them being, but other than that everything was great.
author: Kate W.

description: at 115 reviews i don't think my opinion for this will count that much.  for me i thought the pancakes were very good and the hush puppies are what would make me consider going back here.  other than that i think, and this is hard for me to say, they gave WAY too much food!  i mean no one at our table came remotely close to finishing their respective dishes.  i love huge portion sizes but this was ridiculous!  if i starve myself for a few days in preparation then i'll go back to kate's.
author: Swarup B.

description: I was told this was one of the best places to have breakfast in the city.   I don't agree.  The food is average.  Nice but nothing to write home about.  I had the orange french toast (couldn't taste any orange) and my friend had the pancakes. However, our waiter was super nice and the place has a cosy feel to it.  Maybe we'll try it again.
author: Sarah T.

description: What can I say, the place is near by my place. It's kinda hard to avoid, especially when my tummy demands to be filled with yummy breakfast food. I gotta say they have a pretty good deal if you come before 10am. I've never tried the flip egg but the Farmer breakfast is always good and consistent.  The place is very casual. I think most of the places around lower Haight tend to be that way. No over the top customer service. French Toast orgy is GOOD and the New England Flannel Hash is ok. Not really my favorite. Most of their dishes have generous portion. It'll definitely fill your tummy up. I would say it's a good place to go for casual breakfast but I wouldn't wait in line for them. That's why I usually go early morning or during the weekdays. It's pretty annoying too when they're full since their tables really close to each other. It has happened for quite some times when I couldn't get out of my chair without asking people who sit behind me to get up and move out of my way! Believe me, I am no fat ass!
author: Perry S.

description: Tried Kate's Kitchen the other day.  Food was ok but the service was really lousy .  The waitperson got my order wrong but what really got me is she never even said hello when she came to the table just looked like she would rather be anywhere but serving us.  She never came back to check and I had to actually go over to where she was sitting with her boyfriend to flag her down.  She did apologize but did nothing really great after that.  Why we left her a generous tip had more to do with "the hell if I know".  Anyway nothing there about the place that would get me back. It's not like I'm looking to make best friends with the staff but to have someone come back at least once to see how things are goin-would be kind of expected and a greeting would a rather common  human expectation.
author: S.C. H.

description: Let me add a big HELL YEAH to all the other folks recommending the french toast orgy.  The other food is great at Kate's too, the decor is fun to look at, they keep refilling your coffee, the crowd there is quite watchable, and the prices are cheap cheap cheap.  What more could you ask for?
author: Bruce S.

description: the wait staff aren't consistently efficient but every meal i've had there has been well executed.  not that brunch is particularly difficult, but that's even more reason to not fuck it up.  their homemade sausage was sagey and dee lish.  the coffee is solid.  i can dig the ambience in there, low key, simple, straightforward, etc.  location rocks my block.  yay kate.
author: beltrand a.

description: It ain't fancy or fresh but it's full o' fat!  I moseyed on into Kate's this Sunday afternoon for a pit stop to find the ol mess hall barer than a hairless chiahuahua.  Maybe it was our untimely arrival or maybe the beauteous weather outside caused the cooks to run off, but the offerings weren't too spectacular.  Now I'm gonna tell you, then menu got me worked into a fever it looked so good!  Butter my behind and call me a biscuit, I had a darn tough time tryin to skinny down what I wanted for brunch.  They had everything hearty and delicious and fattening that I wanted, but in the end, everything was better on the paper menu than it was on my plate.  I got the special breakfast sandwich which was tasty enough, and the cornmeal pancakes we're pretty decent, but in general everything seemed like it had been prepared several hours ago and it wasn't all that flavorful.  The homemade sausage patties were a bit dry and the potatoes were surprisingly bland but at least not oily.  On the upside, Kate's a cheap gal, she only stole 22 bucks for brunch for two.  I dunno y'all, I want to like this place because they serve the type of food that put the meat on my bones but something got lost in translation.
author: Dubs W.

description: this place is much better and has more value for the buck against squat and gobble.    gooble gooble that!
author: Pickle R.

description: This place is good!  Tons and tons of food.... I felt sick after eating here, but that's my fault.  Who else would order the Corn Beef Hash breakfast, as well as a side of biscuits and gravy (even though there was no one there to share it with)??  That's just insane.  I guess I have a death wish because I really really wanted both.  The hash was realllly good, big chunks of meat with home fried potatos, onions, and carrots, with two eggs on top and toast on the side.  The biscuits and gravy weren't the greatest for me - the biscuit was a little bit thick and tough for my taste, and the gravy a little bland.  It was good with some hot sauce, salt n pepper to spice it up.  Good coffee too.... I have also been here on another occassion and gotten the Flanched Flarney Blarney (not sure if I got that right) - which is a fried egg sandwich with your choice of meat - it's pretty good.  This is not my 'hood, but I'd definitely stop in again when I'm over here.  PS - I was here on a weekday at 9 am, so I don't have any comments on the wait time....
author: A B.

description: oh my god, after a long night of drinking, i woke up in the morning and wanted some good a$$ breakfast. all i could think about was corned beef hash. my brother was in town, and i wanted to take him somewhere good, so once again i yelped breakfast spots in sf and came across this place. man, was i happy. i didn't even order corned beef hash because i looked at the specials menu and saw lemon curd cornmeal pancakes with strawberries and i couldn't resist. they were fluffy, lemony heaven, but the portion size was GINORMOUS, so i had leftovers to take home! luckily, my bro ordered the corned beef hash which he devoured. we also got biscuits and gravy on the side to share, the gluttons we are, and devoured that as well. i definitely recommend this place. only complaint about this spot is that it is definitely cramped up in there, but it was peak breakfast time, so understandable.
author: Brokester C.

description: I love this place, always packed, but the pancakes are so damn yummy and they are so big, its worth the travel to the seemingly darker side of haight street.  Worth the wait in line in the ghetto.
author: matt j.

description: Decent brunch, but after going there a few times you realize everything tastes about the same ...
author: Tom S.

description: So THAT'S what a fried egg sandwich is supposed to taste like! It was great! A little gooey yolk in the middle. Some cheddar cheese. On a poppy seed bun. YUM! The home-fries were unique. I think it was the jalapeo they threw in there. My sister is a REAL granola/yogurt elitist. And she LOVED theres. It came with LOTS of fruit (that's really what impressed her). Quality granola, honey and plenty of yogurt. The portions here are HUGE! We also got the Hush Puppies with "Pooh" Butter (had to be honey butter - little Winnie the Pooh reference there...cute Kate). I've only ever been here for brunch. Last time I had the Waffle Granola Orgy thing  - which could probably feed half the children in china. Seriously...that thing was enormous! And the prices are low. There always seems to be a wait (for good reason). You sign up on the clipboard that hangs off the wall out front. Didn't bother me - we waited maybe 15 minutes before we were seated. Yeah...I'll be back...
author: Eli S.

description: Good breakfast spot, but there's always a wait on weekends. The prices are reasonable and they give you lots of food. My favorite are the hush puppies. They aren't the healthiest but they are soooo good with the pooh butter (butter w/ honey I believe). The French Toast Orgy is huge and very good if you like french toast.
author: Luke F.

description: absolutely the best breakfast in town. anything with "orgasm" in the title is worth it. and huge portions. if you're not there by 10am, or sooner some days, enjoy the lengthy line.
author: Dean E.

description: I'm an ex employee of Kate's and even after many years of working there and having the pleasure of eating Kate's food for free I still crave her food. I love the corned beef hash that is made from scratch it is the real deal melts in your mouth and the biscuits made fresh every morning are delicious too. It is hard to pick a favorite there are way too many. I usually get the corned beef and then a pumpkin pancake or when in season peaches pancakes it taste's like peace of heaven. If u have a big hangover I recomend trying Kate's homemade ginger soda it will help your tomy to feel better and your head too. I will definetely be back many times as I love Kate's food.
author: kat m.

description:
Came here for what I was hoping would be a filling recover-from-my-hangover breakfast. The food turned out to be decent, but the service was definitely lacking...
The waitress didn't even acknowledge us for the first two minutes after we walked in, too busy talking to her friend (which continued throughout our meal), she was pretty unfriendly, didn't get our order right, didn't check us to re-fill water or ask how the meal was etc etc
The food was filling and a good price, me and my friend got the big boy breakfast and corn meal pancakes which were the highlight of our meal, fluffy and delicious. Didn't try the meat but my friend enjoyed his homemade sausage... Mom ordered the French toast orgy, and we were all looking forward to trying the french toast, however her meal came lacking the central ingredient... I guess the fruit was pretty fresh and the granola was decent.
All in all I would go back, just hope I don't get the same waitress
author: Leah H.

description: One of the best breakfasts I have ever had! They have great pancakes with maple syrup and fresh strawberry
author: loui k.

description: the cornmeal cakes were gross. they offer a "pelana" salad wich is a southern mexican style salad "pelana" translates from yucatecan mayan slang to "fuck your mother" was funny. i didnt care for the potatoes theyjust seemed thrown together. sausage was ok and eggs are hard to ruin. my girlfriend is a veghead so she had a fruit orgy and said it was good. and they were playing p.o.d and other bad music. the waitress just sat around doing nothing and seemed annoyed when customers came in. cool spot near my house, moderatelypriced and unpretentious. il totally go back maybe ill try something else next time.
author: manny t.

description: not bad, came on a weekend and waited maybe 15-20.  big portions.  would say 1 big breakfast could feed 2.  the pancakes were good!
author: Michelle H.
